3:35.race_name: Virgin Bet Queen's Cup (Heritage Handicap) (GBBPlus Race)
3:35.going_detailed: Round course - GOOD, Good to soft in places; Straight course - GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places

runners.name: Aimeric
runners.comment: Won handicap first time out in 2023 and 2024; solid record last year but stamina to prove
runners.spotlight: Won a handicap first time out in 2023 and 2024; mostly solid efforts in defeat in Listed and Group 3 races later last year over about 1m4f; probably needs a career best and the latest of his three attempts (well beaten in them all) over this far was in July 2023.

quotes.race: William Hill Epic Value Handicap
quotes.quote: Aimeric is a fun handicapper. He's going up in the ratings, so they could have a crack at something else, but he is what he is. The quicker the better for him. I had to ride him slightly differently, he prefers to not get there too early but they can get away from you down the hill here. He's always had ability, he just needs proper summer ground - James Doyle, rider.

quotes.race: William Hill Silver Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: Aimeric ran well at Ascot but got boxed in on the rail and didn't get a clear run. Then at Newmarket they had a thunderstorm and the rain ruined the ground for him. He likes top-of-the-ground - he's a good mover. He's got his confidence and his mojo back. He'll get better with age -  Jack Mitchell, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: I don't know how much improvement he's got in him but I hope we can place him to win a race or two in the summer. He appreciates fast ground. He could start at York in a mile-and-a-half handicap next month. 25-04-24

runners.name: Wise Eagle
runners.comment: Latest Flat win was this race in 2023 off 5lb lower; a very mixed Flat campaign last year
runners.spotlight: Peak Flat efforts on good to soft and his latest win in this sphere was this race in 2023 off 5lb lower; off 318 days before a very mixed Flat campaign last year but he had two wins and two seconds from his four runs over hurdles this winter; off two months but needs a second look.

quotes.race: Racing TV Profits Returned To Racing Handicap
quotes.quote: Wise Eagle broke on terms but they went so quick that I just left him to it. He easily got into it in the back straight and won with plenty in hand. He has plenty of ability but they went so quick they set it up for him - Billy Garritty, jockey.

runners.name: Kihavah
runners.comment: Better than ever Flat/hurdles last year; off 133 days before a hurdle race last Saturday
runners.spotlight: 8yo who was better than ever on Flat and over hurdles last year, including when second in the Ebor at York and winning at Ayr next time (4lb higher today); off 133 days before a hot race over hurdles (16-1) last Saturday, sprawling badly at the fourth flight; probably needs to resume improvement.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Ebor Handicap (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: Kihavah is a great horse and does brilliant things for our yard. Hopefully he's around for a long time. He ran a blinder but if you could predict the future and were a few pounds lower and were able to get in, that'd been an ideal scenario. The winner won well though, and we ran a brilliant race and are delighted. The mile and six stretches his stamina and that's as far as he wants to be going - Adrian Keatley, trainer.

quotes.race: bet365 Trophy (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: Kihavah ran a blinder. It's a pity we didn't win on the day but the ground probably got away from us, so what can you do. Hopefully now he gets into the Ebor. We were targeting the Summer Hurdle at Market Rasen but I'd say the ground will have gone there by next week, so we'll mark him out for the Ebor and see how we get on - Adrian Keatley, trainer.

quotes.race: Queen Mother's Cup Handicap (For Female Amateur Jockeys)
quotes.quote: We mapped Kihavah out for this race after he won here last month. He'll probably go to the Curragh on Irish Derby weekend for a mile-and-a-half premier handicap then he could go back to Market Rasen for the Summer Hurdle - Adrian Keatley, trainer.

quotes.race: Stuey Weston & Friends Getting Out Handicap
quotes.quote: We gave Kihavah a break and then ran him over hurdles to get him right and then waited for this - Adrian Keatley, trainer.

quotes.race: Conundrum HR Consulting Handicap
quotes.quote: Kihavah is a lovely, big, genuine horse and hopefully he'll come back here and win another nice contest. He loves a big, galloping track. Nothing went right at Chester, the first time in a handicap, on the turn all the way, with a slow pace. But it didn't take much out of him - Adrian Keatley, trainer.

runners.name: Align The Stars
runners.comment: Handicap hat-trick included Glorious Goodwood; bold show is on its way after Listed return
runners.spotlight: Completed a handicap hat-trick last summer, the final leg coming from the front over 1m6f at Glorious Goodwood (good to firm); gelded in December and returned better than ever when close third of four in Listed race at Nottingham (1m6f, good) ten days ago; a bold show looks on its way.

quotes.race: Coral Summer Handicap
quotes.quote: Jason Hart galloped Align The Stars in July last year before he'd ever run and said he'll win the Ascot Gold Cup, and we're still bang on track.   He still hasn't really raced over a relentless mile and six furlongs and I think an emphasis on stamina in the St Leger is really going to take him to the next level. It will take another step up for him to be competitive, but I have enough faith in him that it's a realistic aim.  I think back to Subjectivist at the same part of his career and he went to the Leger and it was too sharp a test for him, but then he won a Group 1 in the Prix Royal Oak as a three-year-old - Charlie Johnston, trainer.

quotes.race: bet365 Handicap
quotes.quote: Align The Stars is a huge horse who's bred to be top-class. We probably ran him more than we wanted to last year, chasing his Book 1 bonus. I've always hoped he would be a Group horse in time and I've not seen anything today that doesn't give me that confidence. If he went to Goodwood he'd have to come back to a mile and a half and Tony [Farmer, owner] is a big York man, so the Melrose has been on the radar for a long time - Charlie Johnston, trainer.

runners.name: Wild Waves
runners.comment: Improved in handicaps and when 7l sixth of seven at 40-1 in the St Leger at Doncaster
runners.spotlight: Hooded on last five starts; fourth of 16 in the Melrose Handicap at York (1m6f, good to firm) on penultimate start, meeting interference but staying on well from off the pace, and he improved on that form when 7l sixth of seven at 40-1 in the St Leger at Doncaster on final outing; gelded since; up another 5lb but seriously progressive.

runners.name: Chillingham
runners.comment: A mostly reliable sort at 1m4f-1m6f, ideally suited by softer than good; competitive mark
runners.spotlight: Can race freely and has been hooded except on last three outings last term, running well in those only on penultimate start (wore today's cheekpieces on last four); reliable sort otherwise over 1m4f-1m6f, ideally suited by softer than good, and he has a competitive mark; tongue-tie (worn twice in 2023) returns; stable is among the winners.

quotes.race: Ben And Mary Hibbert Memorial Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Chillingham made a pleasing start and I knew he'd improve with racing. It was a case of whether the favourite was going to be very tough to beat. I hope the handicapper won't take it too literally. There was a shortage of mile-and-a-quarter maidens for this type of horse in the north of England. Our hand was kind of forced to come here, otherwise we were waiting until Leicester on the 16th, which wouldn't have suited us - Ed Bethell, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He did well last year, winning twice over 1m2f and 1m4f before we gave him a nice long break. He came back looking terrific and was an impressive winner at Thirsk on his return in April, landing a 0-95 handicap off 90. That impressed the handicapper as he raised him 7lb to a new high of 97. He has been on ice for the last few weeks and is being trained for a handicap at Royal Ascot, either the Copper Horse [1m6f] or the Duke of Edinburgh [1m4f]. If there were a little ease in the ground on the opening day, I'd lean towards the Copper Horse. Essentially, I'm working back from the Ebor. I'd love to get him in that as a relatively unexposed individual and I think the extra trip won't be an issue as he's from the family of Profound Beauty, who won the Curragh Cup. Realistically we probably need another 3lb on his rating to get in at York and hopefully a big run at the royal meeting will sort that out. With sprinters and stayers, there's not always a massive leap from top handicaps to Group 1s and so he's entered for the Irish St Leger. He's an exciting horse for us and I'm sure there's more to come. 01-06-23

runners.name: Intinso
runners.comment: Plenty of ability on first two runs for new yard but latest (February) was less positive
runners.spotlight: Useful on his day at up to 1m6f for the Gosdens; sold for 7,000gns in October and showed he retains plenty of ability on first two runs for new yard this winter, but latest start (February) was less positive; 6lb below his peak mark and a 5lb claimer is recruited.

runners.name: Laafy
runners.comment: Absent 1373 days when well beaten for new yard three weeks ago; now tries cheekpieces.
runners.spotlight: Thrown in judged on his best form for Sir Michael Stoute but that was over 1m4f in 2020 when usually visored; absent for 1373 days (joined current yard for 27,000gns one year ago) and no headgear when fading right out of it at 40-1 in 1m2f handicap at Doncaster three weeks ago; now tries cheekpieces.

quotes.race: Victoria Racing Club Handicap
quotes.quote: I wasn't tied down on Laafy and thought they went plenty quick enough; I thought they'd come back to us. He loves soft ground and has won over a mile-six, but he's effective over over a mile and a half. He's a smashing horse, a big horse and that was a lot of weight in that ground - Jim Crowley, rider

quotes.race: Lutterworth Novice Stakes
quotes.quote: Laafy travelled well around there and picked up nicely off what was a steady pace. He's a nice prospect - Pat Dobbs, jockey.

runners.name: Lieber Power
runners.comment: Close 2nd at York Ebor meeting (2lb higher today) when he once again finished with gusto
runners.spotlight: Best form came over about 1m4f on turf last summer, with two wins (York and Chepstow) and three close seconds, the latest at York Ebor meeting (2lb higher today) when he once again finished with gusto; 1m5f in the mud did not work out on final start and he was never dangerous in a warm AW race three weeks ago, but this trip is interesting.

runners.name: Emiyn
runners.breeder: H H The Aga Khan's Studs Et Al
runners.comment: Fifth in this race in 2023 and his first-time-out record leaves something to be desired
runners.spotlight: Usually front-runner but some slow starts have been interfering with that; fifth in this race in 2023 and his first-time-out record leaves something to be desired; second in last year's Chester Cup in May (2lb lower today) and best known for his exploits at that track, where July 2023 saw his last win; perhaps best watched this time.

quotes.race: Duke Of Westminster Supporting The Chester Cup (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: Emiyn ran a cracking race. Turning in he was travelling well and he was probably looking for a gap. He likes it round here and we'll see what there is for him back here - Declan Carroll, trainer.

quotes.race: Deepbridge Watergate Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: Emiyn is a nice horse who always runs well in nice races round here and we knew there was a big race in him. He got a drop of rain and that played a big part of it. The softer the better for him and if it was soft ground we'd have to consider the Cesarewitch. He's had a tough race there and we'd have to see how he comes out of it - Declan Carroll, trainer.

runners.name: Loughville
runners.comment: Flowered last term, most notably for a stylish 1m4f win at Newbury (soft) in September
runners.spotlight: Flowered last term, most notably for a stylish 1m4f handicap win at Newbury (soft) in September; not disgraced in 1m6f/1m2f Listed races afterwards; no shock if she still has more to offer.

runners.name: La Pulga
runners.comment: In the form of his life over 1m3f-1m6f in the autumn but better still will be required
runners.spotlight: Usually front-runner; last season's two wins (including in April first time out) came in small fields and although he was in the form of his life over 1m3f-1m6f in the autumn, better still will be required to win this race.

runners.name: Faylaq
runners.owner: B Jordan, Brian Jordan, S Jordan & N Mcconnell
runners.comment: Last August saw his first win in nearly five years and he scored again two starts later
runners.spotlight: Last August (1m2f) saw his first win in nearly five years and he scored again two starts later in the Mallard at Doncaster (14.5f); ran well first time out in the last two seasons and he could be thereabouts again.

quotes.race: Betfred Mallard Handicap
quotes.quote: I just had to get Faylaq relaxed and it's worked out well. He was travelling so well and he picked up nicely - Amy Waugh, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: Amie Waugh gave him a great ride to win the Mallard at Doncaster, beating Oisin Murphy and James Doyle in a blanket finish, so we had quite a few scalps that day. He dropped back to 1m1f at Hamilton and ran well to be fourth. He's capable. 02-10-24

runners.name: Struth
runners.owner: Mrs S Russell & A M Russell
runners.comment: Last season was disappointing but he's too well handicapped to be totally dismissed
runners.spotlight: Last season was disappointing on the whole and his last win was in May 2023; that suggests he's not the percentage call, but he's too well handicapped to be totally dismissed.

3:00.race_name: Virgin Bet Daily Price Boosts Scottish Sprint Cup Handicap
3:00.going_detailed: Round course - GOOD, Good to soft in places; Straight course - GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places

runners.name: Cover Up
runners.comment: Returns to handicaps off a manageable mark; conditions should suit; strong claims
runners.spotlight: Made his name for the Gosdens on AW but he's fine on turf too and ran well in all three turf starts at Meydan for his new stable (flopped on dirt in February); 5lb higher than when winning at Doncaster last October but conditions should suit and he's a big player.

quotes.race: Ertijaal Dubai Dash Sponsored By Emaar (Listed Race) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Cover Up likes a fast pace and he got that today; he picked up all the way. I thought it was a good race; Bilhayl and Ponntos set a high standard, so he had to improve, which he did - William Buick, jockey.

quotes.race: Join Century Racing Club Today Handicap
quotes.quote: That was a grand performance. Cover Up is in the sales next week and it's going to be a lot of fun for someone to buy a horse like that. I think they went a bit quick in the ground, he enjoyed it and came to them - John Gosden, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: BetUK. It's Where The UK Bets Handicap
quotes.quote: Cover Up showed plenty of gate speed, that's not easy from stall ten from the six-furlong start, but he was plenty quick and that enabled us to be well positioned. We were in the firing lane from there and waiting to pounce. I didn't really have a plan to be honest, but his speed out the gate made up my mind for me. He was quickening all the way to the line, he's a progressive horse - Kieran Shoemark, jockey.

runners.name: Vintage Clarets
runners.comment: Enjoyed a good autumn but high in weights again now and his reappearance was low key
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in this race in 2023; came good last autumn on slow ground, winning 5f handicaps at Chester and Catterick; well behind Cover Up on final run in 2024 and he'll need to leave his recent AW reappearance behind him.

quotes.race: William Hill Catterick Dash Handicap
quotes.quote: It was a bit easier this year [than last year]. Vintage Clarets' last couple of runs were good, he enjoys that ground, he broke well and I was able to get the run of the race - Osin Orr, rider.

quotes.race: William Hill Catterick Dash Handicap
quotes.quote: We got there plenty soon enough and in the last-furlong Vintage Clarets was only just doing enough but I did think we got nailed on the line.  He's a legend of a horse and he's been very consistent all year. It's great to get a win on him - Oisin Orr, jockey.

runners.name: American Affair
runners.comment: Giant strides in 2024, winning Portland off 2lb lower; C&D win first time out last year
runners.spotlight: One of the success stories of the 2024 season, winning three handicaps, including over C&D and the valuable Portland at the Doncaster St Leger meeting; 11-4 favourite for the Ayr Gold Cup when last seen but raced freely and didn't get home; remains capable of better over 5f, won first time out last year and is just 2lb higher than for the Doncaster win; chance.

quotes.race: Betfred Portland (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: American Affair has done nothing but improve all year. Jim Goldie is some trainer. The last couple of races he's been running with the choke out and not really finishing. Jim said today to ride him ice cold, I got him to switch off and he finished really well. What will he be like next year with another winter on his back? He's still very babyish and raw - Paul Mulrennan, jockey.

quotes.race: Sky Bet For The Fans Handicap
quotes.quote: American Affair is a homebred and as he came off the box, I said to him, 'Your granny [Class Wan] won here' and we've had a few generations of this breed. From where he was drawn [13], Paul got the rail and kind of bossed it - Jim Goldie, trainer, speaking to ITV Racing.

quotes.race: Watch Racing TV In Stunning HD Restricted Novice Stakes (For horses In Bands C And D) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: American Affair is a work in progress but the uphill finish and the step up to seven played to his strengths. He's a big horse and there should be a lot more to come from him - Paul Mulrennan, jockey, speaking on Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: He's had a fantastic season. It was one of the rides of the season when Paul Mulrennan brought him very late to land the Portland but it wasn't by accident; we meant to do that. He'd been running about with the choke open and not quite getting home, so because we were stepping up half a furlong we thought we'd try to keep cover on him and come through late. He was very impressive in that last furlong and it was a beautifully timed run. It was good that Paul took a chance because the easy thing is to just let them run. Not many have tried to do the Portland-Ayr Gold Cup double- I think the last one to do it was Lochsong- and it was a tough ask. We decided to get a bit of cover to switch him off at Ayr and they probably didn't go hard enough. He was a wee bit unlucky in running but we weren't going to be winning it. It was a blip but it was his third run in three weeks. We may go to York for the big 6f race on October 12. His win in the Portland probably opens up a whole new ball game as there aren't many horses who have the turn of foot in class races like that. 02-10-24

runners.name: Tatterstall
runners.comment: Two 5f wins last year, notably at Glorious Goodwood; needs a career best but it's possible
runners.spotlight: Speedy sort who won twice last year, notably at Glorious Goodwood (5f, good); absent since a good fourth off this mark at Southwell 233 days ago; career best required but that's not out of the question.

quotes.race: Aston Martin 3YO "Dash" Handicap
quotes.quote: We thought Tatterstall had a nice chance. He hung when winning on his first run at Wolverhampton, and then at York he was only beaten about two and three-quarter lengths. This was the obvious race to come for, he likes the ground and Connor said he battled back - Chloe Dods, trainer's daughter.

stable_tour.quote: He won a 5f handicap at Glorious Goodwood on the opening day. We only had two runners there and he won. He likes a quick 5f and has won at Wolverhampton, Catterick and Epsom as well as at Goodwood. He doesn't like it soft, so our hands are tied slightly about where we could go with him, but at the moment he'll run on Thursday at Southwell in the Racing League over 5f. 28-08-24

runners.name: Jm Jungle
runners.owner: Mps Racing Ltd & The Ayrshire Tradesmen
runners.comment: York win last summer was quality sprint form; career best is needed to win this on return
runners.spotlight: Promising return to action over C&D last April and showed what he was capable of when beating his 21 rivals at York's Ebor meeting (5.5f, good to firm); close third behind American Affair in the Portland and ran okay at Ascot when last seen; could progress further this year but he'll need to.

quotes.race: Symphony Group Handicap (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: When the draw came out and the ground was dry we were delighted. This was the plan all along, but Jm Jungle will roll away in all the big five-furlong handicap sprints for the rest of the year - John Quinn, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: World Pool Handicap
quotes.quote: JM Jungle is in very good form, and up to Haydock he had been running really well and just got touched off at York and Hamilton. Then he won nicely at Haydock. He's got a lot of speed from the gate, so we felt that this track would suit him - John Quinn, trainer.

quotes.race: Bet Boost At bet365 Handicap
quotes.quote: JM Jungle has been running consistently and I thought he was unlucky to bump into a well-handicapped horse last time. He went to bite the second horse and I had to drag him back off, but he's done it well in the end - Jason Hart, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's another who did well in Bahrain and he arrived back in such good form that we decided to keep going for now, so he'll either head for the Scottish Sprint Cup at Musselburgh or a valuable race at Bath a week later. He gave Jason [Hart] a good feel on his last run in Bahrain and he could still be improving. He's an out-and-out 5f horse. 20-03-24

runners.name: Jer Batt
runners.comment: Form ties in with a couple of these and he's open to further progress this year; e-w shout
runners.spotlight: Won from American Affair at Haydock last summer (5f, good) and ended 2024 by chasing home Cover Up at Doncaster (5f, soft); weighted to beat both of those rivals today and connections won this race in 2022; capable of another prominent showing.

runners.name: Twilight Fun
runners.comment: Front-runner on a sharp upward curve in headgear; 7lb rise against stronger rivals today
runners.spotlight: Has speed to burn and he's been on a sharp upward curve since headgear was fitted last September, winning three of his last five starts; 7lb rise for latest Chelmsford win asks more of him and stall 1 is not ideal.

runners.name: Mon Na Slieve
runners.comment: Well backed when capitalising on his reduced mark over C&D 17 days ago; respected up 5lb
runners.spotlight: Quiet winter on AW but, having dropped 10lb in the weights, he rewarded market support with a ready C&D win 17 days ago; this time he has 5lb rise, stronger opposition and other pace to contend with but still likely to go well.

stable_tour.quote: He was unlucky after winning his novice first time out at York because he never really had his ground. He loves it fast and even good to soft is no good to him. He's an out-and-out 5f horse who is up to winning some nice races. 04-04-24

runners.name: Vince Lamour
runners.comment: All wins on slow ground but effective on a sound surface & still open to further progress
runners.spotlight: Won three handicaps in 2024, all on soft or heavy; fully effective on a sounder surface and should be sharper with a recent return to action behind him; could be in for another good year but eligible for weaker races.

4:10.going_detailed: Round course - GOOD, Good to soft in places; Straight course - GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places

runners.name: Canavan
runners.comment: Three-race maiden, third over 7f here last term; this is a steep rise in distance
runners.spotlight: Best of three runs last term when third of seven here (7f, good; 40-1) in September; may improve in his second season but this is a steep rise in distance (mixed messages about its suitability from his pedigree).

runners.name: Ivatt
runners.comment: Made good start when second at Newmarket to a subsequent winner; entered in the Derby
runners.spotlight: Made a good start to his career when second at Newmarket (1m2f, soft) six months ago to a subsequent winner; bred to stay at least 1m4f and is entered in the Derby; should improve and win races in 2025.

runners.name: Wise Counsellor
runners.comment: Improved when second to promising stablemate at Wolverhampton last time; more to come
runners.spotlight: Probably needed the run on his first outing and improved when second to a promising stablemate at Wolverhampton (1m4f; 18-1) last month; more to come on turf debut.

runners.name: Amalfina
runners.owner: Fine Claret Racing,Mrs Burke & C Wood
runners.comment: Pleasing debut when fourth at Doncaster last autumn; this step up in distance should suit
runners.spotlight: Beaten only by three runners with experience when an encouraging fourth of eighth at Doncaster (1m, soft; 15-2) towards the end of last season, left behind from 2f out; has a useful middle-distance pedigree and likely to stay this longer trip; open to plenty of improvement.

runners.name: Caspi Star
runners.comment: Green as 2yo; improved second on return; type to keep getting better with experience
runners.spotlight: Too green to do herself justice as a 2yo but showed improvement when second of seven at Southwell (1m4f) three weeks ago, making the running; type to keep progressing with experience and could get an easy lead.

2:25.race_name: Virgin Bet Every Saturday Money Back Silver Arrow Handicap
2:25.going_detailed: Round course - GOOD, Good to soft in places; Straight course - GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places

runners.name: Alzahir

prev_owners.owner: Al Wasmiyah Stud, G Bailey, N Wrigley

runners.comment: 7f specialist; won at Doncaster and Thirsk after wind op; should be thereabouts again
runners.spotlight: 7f specialist who won at Doncaster in March after wind surgery and followed up at Thirsk last Saturday, both on good ground; should be thereabouts again despite a 7lb rise.

stable_tour.quote: A half-brother to Suedois who had a couple of runs for us last year and I think he could do well. He wants fast ground over seven furlongs or an easy mile. He's had a nice break and has come back working well. 19-04-24

He was purchased at the horses in training sale for 20,000gns. He runs on December 7 at Wolverhampton in a 0-85 and with luck in running he should go close. He was unlucky last time and probably would have been a lot closer had he got out, but he's dropping in grade at Wolverhampton and I think he should win. 05-12-24

runners.name: Lord Bertie
runners.comment: Soft-ground winner last autumn; the ground may not be ideal unless there's rain
runners.spotlight: Goes well on ground softer than good and scored at Ascot (7f, soft) last autumn when trained by Jane Chapple-Hyam; sold for 30,000gns in October; not ruled out for new stable after six months off, although conditions may not be ideal unless there's rain.

runners.name: Gweedore
runners.comment: 12 wins (five here); sign of revival over C&D last time; big player in first-time headgear
runners.spotlight: Has been an excellent stable servant over the years, winning 12 races, five of them here; seemed rusty on his first two outings this year but showed much more when second of eight over C&D (good) last Sunday; now wears headgear for the first time; big player from an unchanged mark.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Ayr Gold Cup Handicap (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: It's fantastic, Gweedore jumped and travelled well, everything went great, I think he was just beaten by two better handicapped horses at the end of the day. It's just fantastic to have a horse here in the Gold Cup. He's been an amazing horse for his owners, they're Scottish too, so to even have a runner in the race is very special. The options are a bit dry on the ground over seven furlongs for him, so we'll probably look at something again over six - Katie Scott, trainer.

quotes.race: Aspall Premier Cru Handicap
quotes.quote: Gweedore hit the rising ground which really suited him and the further he went the better - Katie Scott, trainer.

quotes.race: tote.co.uk Bet£5Get£20 Musselburgh Silver Arrow Handicap
quotes.quote: I didn't think Gweedore would get such an easy lead but he was going quite well and I just let him bowl away. He's done it well in the end - Billy Loughnane, jockey, speaking on ITV

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Handicap
quotes.quote: We thought Gweedore was really well but he had a tricky draw. Jason (Hart) gave him a great ride, he got him in the perfect position and it all went to plan - Katie Scott, trainer.

runners.name: Lexington Belle
runners.comment: Sole 2024 win came over this trip; not ruled out if fit after a break
runners.spotlight: Ended 2024 with two runs in European Listed races (second in Germany on first of them); last year's win came on soft ground at Newbury (7f) and she also handles good to firm; not ruled out if fit after a break.

runners.name: Waleefy
runners.comment: Well bred and progressive; drawn wide on today's return but still has untapped potential
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to Baaeed and has gone off favourite on each of his eight outings, winning twice; steadily progressive last year, running his best race when second at Newbury (7f, good to firm) in August; didn't seem to get home on soft ground when third to Lord Bertie at Ascot on final start; stall 10 isn't ideal today but he still has untapped potential.

quotes.race: Unison Campaigning For Public Services Handicap
quotes.quote: Waleefy is maturing throughout the campaign. He seems to be improving all the time and things went right for him, even if the ground was a little quick. Going up to a mile should suit and he's exciting - Cieren Fallon, jockey.

quotes.race: Aston Martin Handicap
quotes.quote: Waleefy is not as talented as his relatives but he was a late foal and is only just beginning to fill his frame. Coming back to six furlongs was a gamble and they went no pace, which didn't help, but he got there in the end. Jim Crowley said the ground was quick enough for him but to stick to this trip for now -Angus Gold, Shadwell racing manager.

runners.name: Persuasion
runners.comment: Well held three times since decisive Haydock success last September
runners.spotlight: Well held three times since a decisive Haydock success (7f, good to soft) last September, and as a result he's back to that winning mark; however, he'll need to step up significantly from his reappearance form when last of seven at Southwell; stable won this race in 2023.

stable_tour.quote: He really pleased me on his only start this season when beating stablemate Dulas at Haydock over seven furlongs. The form of that race is working out well and on a new mark of 96 he should have a nice weight in the Buckingham Palace. I'd like to think he has a very good chance. - 10-06-21

runners.name: Rockymountainway
runners.comment: Consistent; two wins in 2024 and also runner-up over C&D; will need another personal best
runners.spotlight: Proved a model of consistency in 2024, unplaced just once from seven attempts, winning over this trip at Ffos Las and Carlisle and runner-up over C&D on final start; likeable type, but she'll need another personal best to make a winning reappearance after more than six months off.

runners.name: Diligent Resdev
runners.comment: 3-7; another surge of improvement to win Ayr Bronze Cup; big danger if ready after absence
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 4yo with three successes from just seven starts; won a competitive 7f event at York last spring and showed another surge of improvement to beat his 23 rivals in the Ayr Bronze Cup (6f, good) in September, staying on strongly from midfield; open to further progress and he'll be a danger to all if ready to roll again after seven months off.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Ayr Bronze Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: They went a nice gallop throughout, we got cover and at the three-pole I was looking around thinking 'I'm going well here.' I kept it simple, pulled Diligent Resdev out and he steamed home. He's a very quick horse with a high cruising rate and he powered through the line - Lewis Chalkey, jockey.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Best Odds Daily Cock O'The North EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB Race) (Div I)
quotes.quote: I don't think that was expected but Billy (Garritty, jockey) was more confident than David (Easterby, joint-trainer). Diligent Resdev did it really well, I think he was on the best part of the track but there were some very expensive horses in that race, costing the best part of half a million - Lee Westwood, part-owner.

runners.name: Dain Ma Nut In
runners.comment: Upwardly mobile 4yo; began new campaign with promising C&D third; seems sure to go well
runners.spotlight: Upwardly mobile 4yo who ended last season with a Scottish hat-trick and began the new campaign with a promising third over this C&D (good ground); that last effort ties him in closely with second-placed Gweedore who runs for the same owners; remains unexposed and seems sure to go well.

runners.name: Benacre
runners.comment: On long losing run but narrowly beaten here last time and should put up another bold show
runners.spotlight: Losing spell goes back to 2022 but he's on an attractive mark and ran well from the front when beaten a neck over C&D last Sunday, rallying; should put up another bold show.

1:50.race_name: Livescore Bet Best Odds Daily Royal Mile Handicap
1:50.going_detailed: Round course - GOOD, Good to soft in places; Straight course - GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places

runners.name: Castle Stuart
runners.comment: 1m maiden winner last year; can't have been right last time; yard won this 12 months ago
runners.spotlight: Progressive in his first three runs, culminating in a Hamilton maiden win (1m, soft); something can't have been right when tailed-off last of five in Pontefract Listed race (1m, soft again) on final start; no shock were he to resume his progress for last year's winning owner and trainer.

runners.name: Thunder Wonder
runners.comment: Novice win last year; creditable third on recent AW reappearance
runners.spotlight: Off the mark in a Thirsk novice (7f, good) last August; tailed off in 7f Doncaster nursery on final 2yo start but got his career back on track when third in 1m Southwell handicap on reappearance 13 days ago; his stable, which is no stranger to success in this contest, also runs Hot Dancer.

runners.name: Invited
runners.comment: Arrives on a hat-trick after two AW wins; 6lb rise demands more improvement, but respected
runners.spotlight: 0-5 for Richard Hannon but has quickly hit the target on AW for new stable, following a Southwell maiden win in January with a handicap success at Kempton last month (both 1m); a 6lb rise demands further progress back on turf but he has to be respected in his current mood.

quotes.race: Bet MGM: It's Showtime Restricted Maiden Stakes (For Horses In Bands B, C And D) (GBB Race) (Div II)
quotes.quote: It was a nice spot for Invited today, and the race couldn't have gone any smoother for him - Billy Loughnane, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: He looks progressive and he really appreciates a bit of time between his runs. His pedigree suggests his three-year-old career is what it's really about, so we might just wait and get him on the grass in the next month or so. 07-04-25

runners.name: Zowal
runners.breeder: Miss Scuderia Micolo Di Nicola Gall Et
runners.comment: Ex-French; won C&D maiden for new yard 17 days ago; more needed from opening mark of 84
runners.spotlight: Placed in each of his three runs for Jean-Claude Rouget in France last year; new connections acquired him for 69,000euros at the end of 2024 and he made a winning start for them in a C&D maiden (good) 17 days ago, wandering around a little under pressure but nicely on top towards the finish; will need to step up on that form to defy an opening mark of 84 but further progress wouldn't surprise.

quotes.race: Livescore Bet Best Odds Daily Confined Maiden Stakes (Three Runs Or Less) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Zowal had shown good form in France last year, he's pleased us since we've had him and that was a really nice start. He was just rolling around a little bit. Hopefully he'll improve going forward and still learn. When we first got him we thought he might be a mile-and-a-quarter horse and wouldn't have been stunned if he was a mile-and-a-half horse, but he's not shy of speed. He'd been working at home with Empirestateofmind, who ran in the Spring Mile, so that convinced us to start at a mile and take it from there - Sean Quinn, joint-trainer, speaking on Racing TV.

runners.name: Wiltshire Lad
runners.comment: Won AW nursery on final start for Sir Michael Stoute and likely more to come for new yard
runners.spotlight: Ended his time with Sir Michael Stoute with an improved performance to win a 1m Southwell AW nursery in a first-time visor (retained) in November; subsequently gelded; likely he has more to offer for a new stable (same owner) in excellent form.

runners.name: We Dare To Dream
runners.comment: Progressive at 6f/7f as 2yo and there should be more to come this year; likely to stay 1m
runners.spotlight: Runner-up on first two starts (6f, good) before making all in a maiden at Haydock (7f, good to soft) in September; advanced his RPR again when second of ten in Doncaster nursery (7f, soft) the following month; gelded after; likely to stay 1m and go on to even better things in 2025.

stable_tour.quote: A nice horse who got off the mark at the third time of asking at Haydock over seven and then ran really well at Doncaster. He looks like he's taken a step forward and there's absolutely no reason why he can't progress. He's very straightforward and likeable. 14-04-25

runners.name: Our Mighty Mo
runners.comment: Two nursery wins last year but more exposed than some in this field; has been gelded
runners.spotlight: Won a pair of nurseries in the mud (6f/7f) last September but the handicapper looked in charge by the end of the autumn; gelded ahead of reappearance; proven at 1m but possibly vulnerable to less exposed types.

quotes.race: Leisure Connect WiFi Approved Suppliers 2-Y-O Series Final Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Our Mighty Mo ran a really solid race last time out at York and we thought we'd come here with a real live chance. He's strengthened up all year and he stuck at it really well - James Cowley, trainer's assistant, speaking on Racing TV.

runners.name: Hot Dancer
runners.breeder: Minster Stud And Mrs H Dalgety
runners.comment: Promising at two and potential improver in handicaps for yard which does well in this race
runners.spotlight: Promise when second at Chester (7.5f, good to soft) and Thirsk (1m, good) on first two outings and had heavy ground as a possible excuse for below-par third at Nottingham on final start; no surprise were he to resume his progress on handicap/seasonal debut for a stable which does well in this race.

4:45.going_detailed: Round course - GOOD, Good to soft in places; Straight course - GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places

runners.name: Yorkshire Lady
runners.owner: J Munroe, M Mchale & R Wreglesworth

prev_owners.owner: J Munroe, M McHale & K Wreglesworth
A Pollock, K Wreglesworth & J Munroe
L Folwell, K Wreglesworth & J Munroe

runners.comment: Well beaten back on the Flat at Ripon on Thursday; best watched if running again
runners.spotlight: In decent form on the Flat last autumn but no significant impact in two handicap hurdles this winter and well beaten back on the level at Ripon on Thursday.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Kilkerran Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: That was brilliant. Yorkshire Lady is so hardy. Serena Brotherton rides her out every day and she's come on no end for her last run when she was fourth at York and ran a blinder. Everyone keeps saying she wants soft ground but she just goes better on it when others don't - Jo Mason, jockey.

runners.name: Reach
runners.comment: Well treated on the form she showed at start of last season, including reappearance
runners.spotlight: Well below par on final two starts but recorded two good placed efforts over 1m2f at York (good/good to soft) off 3lb higher at the start of last summer, including on reappearance; good shout if resuming in similar form.

runners.name: Zapphire
runners.comment: Consistent last year and a bold show is likely if she's ready to roll after six months off
runners.spotlight: Largely consistent record last year, including a win at Beverley (extended 1m, good to firm) in August; ended her season with creditable in-frame efforts over 1m on soft ground at Redcar and Newmarket; bold show likely if ready to roll after six months off.

quotes.race: Hull Asphalt Handicap
quotes.quote: Zapphire is not winning out of turn. She's not entirely straightforward but she has a decent level of ability. I popped her in a fillies' handicap in a fortnight at Leopardstown and that might be interesting. She loves soft ground so if it rained over there we'd be even happier - Steve Brown, trainer's husband and assistant.

quotes.race: Betfred 'Passionate About Sport' Handicap
quotes.quote: I'm pleased with that. Zapphire has definitely got ability and she's done that well but she can be a bit of a madam - Julie Camacho, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She belongs to the Elite Racing Club and is a talented filly who can be a little temperamental at times. The handicapper was kind to her after her Haydock win last month as the front two were three lengths clear of the rest. She's in good form and is ready to run again soon, preferably with some cut in the ground. 06-09-23

runners.name: Samra Star
runners.comment: AW novice winner for Richard Hughes but progress stalled over winter; sold for 5,500gns
runners.spotlight: Won Wolverhampton novice (9.4f) for Richard Hughes last August; failed to progress after, not helping herself by racing freely on occasions; sold for 5,500gns last month; best watched for new yard.

runners.name: Alessia Fernanda
runners.comment: Won in blinkers in Ireland last year but ended 2024 out of form; blinkers off for new yard
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at Cork (1m, yielding) last October in first-time blinkers, added to regular tongue-tie,  but the effect of the headgear had worn off by the end of the year; resumes for new yard, minus the blinkers; the betting is perhaps the best guide to expectations.

runners.name: Epidavros
runners.comment: Did well on turf last year and recent AW reappearance was encouraging; likely to go well.
runners.spotlight: Did well for Katie Scott last year, winning handicaps at Carlisle (1m, soft) and Hamilton (1m1f, good to soft) in September; sound return to action when fifth of 12 on AW at Southwell (1m) 15 days ago and should be spot on for this.

5:17.going_detailed: Round course - GOOD, Good to soft in places; Straight course - GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places

runners.name: Moonstone Boy
runners.comment: Three wins in 2024, well suited by testing ground; back from six months off; others safer
runners.spotlight: Three 5f wins last year, one on Tapeta and the other two on testing ground at Hamilton; could prove vulnerable on a sounder surface back from six months off.

quotes.race: Boost Your Acca With BetUK Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was very straightforward. Moonstone Boy has been knocking on the door and deserved to win. Iain [Jardine, trainer] and Andrew [Mullen, regular jockey] said to me that he'd come on leaps and bounds from his first run here. He's got a lot of speed - Paul Mulrennan, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: He's won on the all-weather and he's also run quite well on the turf but he must have soft ground. He's plenty quick enough and is a hard-knocking sprinter whose trip is 5f. We're giving him a slightly easier time and will look for races in the next wet spell. He's back on a nice mark. 26-07-24

runners.name: Balon Dor
runners.comment: C&D win on debut; added a Chester handicap last summer; O Murphy booked for return; chance
runners.spotlight: C&D win on his 2yo debut; ended losing run when scrambling home at Chester last August (blinkered first time); has the rail draw and can go well fresh, so not discounted with Oisin Murphy a positive booking.

stable_tour.quote: He made the perfect start when successful at Musselburgh in April. He ran third at the Chester May meeting and second at Epsom but hasn't added to that debut win. He has picked up plenty of prize-money along the way and he could go to York next week for the 7f nursery. He seems versatile as regards ground and I'm hopeful he'll add to his gains this year. 17-08-23

runners.name: Zarzyni
runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.comment: Talented but could find trouble in a match; close 3rd here on Sunday; e-w claims again
runners.spotlight: Notoriously tricky to win with but there's no doubting his ability and he won the big sprint on this card back in 2022; close third over C&D on Sunday having found plenty of trouble; shouldn't be far away.

quotes.race: Watch On Racing TV Handicap
quotes.quote: It worked out well. I haven't a clue why Zarzyni won there, we've tried everything with him. He's very smart, but I don't think the horse knows he's won. If he had time to think he'd have got beaten. He's a handy type to have in the yard as he's a very good work horse. When we have sprinters we have to work, he's the boy. We're thankful he's won and Musselburgh's been a lucky place for us -  oint-trainer David Barron, speaking on Racing TV.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Zarzyni is very straightforward and had been working well. For one of ours to win first time is always a good sign. We thought he was up to winning a maiden but not necessarily first time - Michael Halford, trainer.

runners.name: Arecibo
runners.comment: Conditions to suit and on dangerous mark; needs to leave Sunday's reappearance behind him
runners.spotlight: Veteran who hasn't won as often as he should for one of his undoubted ability; on a reduced mark now and last Sunday's run, his first for 173 days, should have freshened him up; others look stronger for the win.

quotes.race: WSG Sports Signage Handicap
quotes.quote: Arecibo loved the ground and he was down in class so he was entitled to win like that - Frankie Dettori, jockey.

runners.name: Profitable Edge
runners.comment: C&D win last summer; sharper for recent reappearance; stable runs two
runners.spotlight: C&D win off 3lb lower last summer; shaped as though the run was needed when last of eight here 17 days ago; better than that and could leave it well behind; stable also runs Zarzyni.

runners.name: Water Of Leith
runners.comment: Latest C&D 4th can be upgraded; will need luck in running but handicapped to go well
runners.spotlight: Another in the field who needs things to fall just right but he made a pleasing return to turf over C&D on Sunday, meeting a bit of traffic when initially launching his challenge and also caught towards the middle of the track; capable off this mark if the gaps appear.

stable_tour.quote: He won twice for us as a juvenile and then left for a season before joining us in July after a Carlisle win for Rebecca Menzies. He's in the form of his life and has won twice more for us, rising from 61 to 76 in the handicap. He's far from straightforward but we know his quirks. He must walk to the start and goes in the stalls without a jockey. He was carried badly left and promoted to third in the stewards' room at Windsor last Thursday. He stayed down in the area and ran another good race on Saturday when fourth at Ascot, which more than paid for his trip. He thrives on his racing and could be a Bronze Cup hope at Ayr next week. 12-09-22

runners.name: Eternal Sunshine
runners.comment: Five wins last year; saw no daylight here on Sunday and she's a contender granted any luck
runners.spotlight: Won five times last year, including C&D, and although she has been unplaced in both runs this time around she was unable to show what she could do here on Sunday having run into several dead ends; capable if the gaps appear.

stable_tour.quote: She's had a really good season, winning five times. It was frustrating to get beat last time when she got hampered in the Ayr Bronze Cup. She's a homebred and we purposely let her mature. I still think there's improvement in her but we've decided that was enough for the season. Hopefully she'll come back off a nice mark next year and we'll look to follow in the footsteps of American Affair. 02-10-24

runners.name: Our Absent Friends
runners.comment: Of interest on last year's turf best; return of cheekpieces is a positive; one to consider
runners.spotlight: Prominent racer who won twice on turf last September; in and out on AW this winter but he's slipped down the weights and the return of cheekpieces can help back on turf; should go well in a race in which the majority like to come from off the pace.

runners.name: Knicks

prev_owners.owner: Capla Development, J Nordoff, L Westwood

runners.comment: 4lb better off with Only Spoofing for a short head on Sunday's C&D run; less kind draw now
runners.spotlight: Picked off late by Only Spoofing over C&D on Sunday; 4lb better off for a short head today but he's not so well drawn this time; others appeal more.

quotes.race: tote.co.uk Saddle-Up For More Than Racing Handicap
quotes.quote: We didn't give Joanna any instructions, we just wanted to see what the drop back was going to do and it seems to have worked. It's Epsom next next, that's the plan - the three-year-old only Dash, because it's easier to win! - David Easterby, joint-trainer of Knicks.

runners.name: Only Spoofing

prev_owners.owner: Mrs H Mannion, B Carter & F Durbin

runners.comment: Improved his excellent C&D record when finishing fast here on Sunday; should go well again
runners.spotlight: Well into the veteran stage but he retains lots of enthusiasm and he enhanced his fine C&D record when beating six of today's rivals to win last Sunday; picked up impressively once seeing daylight and can confirm his superiority despite the revised weights.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Acca Freeze Handicap
quotes.quote: We had this planned a long way out and we had the best jockey in the north of Britain on - he doesn't panic. We were going to retire Only Spoofing last year but he's not one for that just yet. He's a tough nut and doesn't think he's 11 - Kevin Coleman, trainer.

quotes.race: Bellinter Handicap
quotes.quote: Only Spoofing loves this track and trip. He cut out at Naas last day and back to five today suited him - Kevin Coleman, trainer.

quotes.race: Neptune Investment Management Supports Child Bereavement UK Handicap
quotes.quote: Only Spoofing is improving and came here in good form. He was great today and I think he could win a big one before the end of the year - Kieran O'Neill, jockey.

quotes.race: Troytown Bar Handicap
quotes.quote: He can be very buzzy and went to the start early. Sean (Davis) had ridden him before and gave him a very brave ride. He's great value for his 7lb claim and you'd never think he was a claimer watching that ride. I'd imagine Only Spoofing will be coming back to Ireland before the end of the season - Tim Hogg, assistant to Jedd O'Keeffe, trainer of Only Spoofing.

runners.name: Zaphea
runners.comment: Conditions no problem but she returns from an absence and could find a few too strong
runners.spotlight: Won four 5f handicaps last year, two of them over C&D; 2lb rise for her last-gasp win here in November pushes her into a higher grade; not ideally drawn and others appeal more.

runners.name: Classy Al
runners.comment: Well behind Only Spoofing here on Sunday and he's again not fared well with the draw
runners.spotlight: Well beaten on Sunday's seasonal return and, as on that occasion, she's not fared well with the draw; stable has stronger claims elsewhere.

stable_tour.quote: He's a bairn I know well as I trained his dam and granny, but he hasn't been easy to train. First time out this year he dropped Paul Mulrennan going to the start but, despite his quirks, he has an engine. I have an idea to run him on the all-weather to change the script a little. He's in grand form at home and we'll look at the 5f and 7f handicaps next week at Ayr. 12-09-22

3:15.race_name: Unibet Middle Distance Veterans' Handicap Chase (Series Final)

runners.name: Eldorado Allen
runners.comment: The season started well but his form has cooled and now has to stage a revival
runners.spotlight: Reduced mark appeals on his placed efforts earlier this season but he needs to stage a revival after three fairly heavy defeats, latterly in the Topham at Aintree; cheekpieces return but the significance of that is questionable.

quotes.race: Betfair Chase (Grade 1) (Registered As The Lancashire Chase) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'm delighted with Eldorado Allen. It's like a winner as he's run an absolute blinder. He's turned into a proper stayer. It was a great performance by the winner but we're proud as punch with our horse. He's got a King George entry and we'll see how he comes out of it, so we might take our chance in that - Joe Tizzard, trainer

quotes.race: bet365 Charlie Hall Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was a nice first run by Eldorado Allen. I thought he'd travel better than he did. He was flat out turning in and then he's galloped right through the line so he's definitely getting the trip. With a run under our belt we can ride him a bit more aggressively. He'll get an entry at Haydock for the Betfair Chase. We've got three weeks and I'm sure he'll improve. It could turn out to be a good run trying to give a bit of the weight to the winner - Joe Tizzard, trainer.

quotes.race: Betfair Denman Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Eldorado Allen sat last in the Arkle and finished strong and we were convinced he was a three-miler, but whether he's three-mile-two is something else. It was a brilliant ride and we'll talk about supplementing for the Gold Cup with the owners. I'd say there are a few who can win the Gold Cup, but we'll see, and he's in the Ryanair - Colin Tizzard, trainer.

quotes.race: Betway Haldon Gold Cup (A Limited Handicap Chase) (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Eldorado Allen didn't travel all that well early on and Brendan said he was virtually flat out. It turned into a proper slog. We thought going to Aintree over two mile four last season would have been ideal, but he just ran a bit flat. He was second in an Arkle and off 151 you had to fancy him. He beat the right horse in my opinion. I think the right two fought it out so it was a solid performance. We will probably be looking at going a bit further now. Quite possibly the Peterborough Chase could be a race we look at as he has put himself in that sort of bracket. He could be a Ryanair horse as we get further down the line - Joe Tizzard, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: From The Horse's Mouth Podcast Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (Registered As The November) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Some of his hurdle form was outstanding. Eldorado Allen is a big, strong horse and I think he's the best two-miler we've had. His jumping was pretty slick today - Colin Tizzard, trainer.

quotes.race: 188Bet Mobile Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Eldorado Allen is very impressive in everything he does and he's right up there in our novice hurdle division. He's not flash but does it like a good horse. No doubt we'll step him up now. Perhaps one more run and then aim at something like the Tolworth now he's proven himself around here-  Joe Tizzard, assistant trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We had thought about the Grand Sefton but we're looking at the veterans' races and he could go to Warwick. He could run in the two and a half mile races or over three miles and should be all right in those races. 07-11-24

He just lacks a gear now and probably got stuck in the mud at Plumpton the other day. He doesn't owe us anything and can run in veterans' races now, but he ran a blinder when fourth in the Coral Gold Cup at Newbury in December. He should get his head in front in a veterans' race. 18-01-24

runners.name: Numitor
runners.owner: Paul G Jacobs And Wetumpka Racing
runners.comment: Won this last year; career-high mark after 5lb rise for Ascot but he did win well
runners.spotlight: Beat Dubai Days in this a year ago; 13lb higher for this defence but he's won three of his last four and beat a few of these in the process; back up to a career-high mark after his 5lb rise for Ascot last time but he did win well.

quotes.race: Unibet Middle Distance Veterans' Chase Series Handicap Chase (Qualifier)
quotes.quote: That is amazing. I mean, we weren't sure Numitor would handle the track, because he didn't handle Sandown, but you've just got to take your chance, haven't you? That wasn't his ground, he didn't jump as well out of it, but he still won - Heather Main, trainer.

quotes.race: Unibet Middle Distance Veterans' Handicap Chase Finale
quotes.quote: I was warned before the race that Numitor didn't really love that ground. Although he didn't really enjoy it, he's such a tough horse and he keeps trying for you. It's great to pick up the ride and James [Bowen] rode him 11 days ago after a year off. It was a good run but him not having a hard race last time has massively contributed to winning today - Sean Bowen, rider.

runners.name: Le Milos
runners.comment: Won a qualifier for this in Feb and subsequent defeats have come against younger rivals
runners.spotlight: Ended a losing sequence off a reduced mark in a qualifier for this at Warwick (2m4f, soft) and subsequent defeats have come against younger rivals, latterly in a big handicap on Aintree's Grand National card; should have a part to play.

quotes.race: Unibet Middle Distance Series Veterans' Handicap Chase (Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: This track really suited him and the fences in quick succession down the back straight meant Le Milos could fill up. He's such a nice horse so it's great to see him back winning - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: bet365 Premier Chase (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Le Milos just got tired halfway up the run-in. I knew how much he was going to improve for today. The National is where he's going. He jumped very well bar one at the top of the hill on the final circuit and he was always going to get tired at some point - unfortunately it was in the last ten strides - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: Coral Gold Cup Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: There was definitely some apprehension over the ground. Bangor was very soft but I felt he'd really stepped forward. I'm glad they put the water on last night and that probably helped Le Milos from the back of the last, I thought Remastered had got us and I'm actually surprised he hasn't because we were out there to be gunned down for a while. He was so brave for Harry at the last. If he'd put one more stride in we were beat and you have another winner - Dan Skelton, trainer.  He was magic. He was good for me as he was on the limit the whole way and I knew he would stay galloping. It's a big team effort. We're led by Dan and we're all so lucky in that position to work for him. The horse responded really well - he's really tough and he kept galloping until the line - Harry Skelton, jockey, speaking to ITV racing.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Masters Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Le Milos has got speed and sharpness but he's very gritty as well. I think that will probably have been his Gold Cup - Alan Johns, jockey.

quotes.race: Racing TV Profits Returned To Racing Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: I was going to enter Le Milos in the Welsh National, but thought we might not get in, so sat quiet, but he definitely looks that type of horse. It looks like he'll stay a lot further and he loves the ground. He's been progressive and is not an old horse. That was a career-best today and you could see him in an Eider Chase, where you might not need as much class as the Welsh National. He's still young and unexposed - Tim Vaughan, trainer.

quotes.race: Get Switched On With Matchbook Juvenile Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Last time we ran Le Milos handy at Exeter and he was keen for the first mile and a quarter. We dropped him in today with a hood on. He's almost fallen asleep at the back and was behind the bridle the whole way. He was tough as they come up the straight - Alan John, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He ran nicely on his first race of the season at Cheltenham last month but we probably thought he was fitter than he actually was and I'd say he blew up that day. He'll go to Haydock on Betfair Chase day for a three-mile handicap chase [November 23] and I still think he can win good races. Obviously he's not hitting the form he did when he won the Coral Gold Cup, but they can never take that away from him, he was brilliant that day, and I still think there's plenty left in the tank. He's a pleasure to have and I think he can win another nice pot. 12-11-24

runners.name: Glynn
runners.comment: Could be well-in with Numitor; tough task last time and could feature back from a break
runners.spotlight: His bid for a four-timer over fences came unstuck when Numitor beat him at Wincanton but the margin was only a little over 2l and he has a 10lb pull on the winner; a Grade 2 last time was always going to be tough; absent since November but trainer gets them fit at home; respected.

quotes.race: Newton Abbot Novices' Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was a really good performance and Glynn's gone from strength to strength in the last couple of months. He's lightly raced for his age and looks to be improving. He appears to have appreciated a change in scenery, which can happen, and we've had a clear run with him in the last year. He's a very good jumper and we could potentially pitch him in a bit deeper if the ground stays on the quick side in the next month - Dan Downie, racing manager to the Owners Group.

quotes.race: Sporting Life EBF "National Hunt" Maiden Hurdle (Qualifier)
quotes.quote: I hope that looked as good as it felt. Glynn gave me an incredible feel. He settled very well, jumped and travelled - I wouldn't be scared to drop him down to two miles. We were expecting a good run and he delivered with flying colours. He isn't the biggest in the world but he's very well put together - Jerry McGrath, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: I thought he was destined for great things when he won at Doncaster as a youngster, but he lost his form and has had niggles. I'm determined to get him back and chasing is an option, but he'll start over hurdles. 24-10-22

runners.name: Flic Ou Voyou
runners.comment: Up 9lb for winning so well at Newcastle last time but he's on top of his game again
runners.spotlight: Has rolled back the years to win three of his last four races and he fairly bombed clear last time at Newcastle (2m4f, good); has more on his plate here off 9lb higher but he'll love the ground and is bang in form.

quotes.race: Val And Kath Bollado Memorial Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Flic Ou Voyou is dependent on good ground, that's why we gave him a layoff. I'm glad that he's done it as well as he did, apart from when I look at what the handicapper does with him! - Henry Hogarth, trainer.

quotes.race: JenningsBet Bracknell Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Flic Ou Voyou can go to Ayr for something at the Scottish National meeting in April as he needs fast ground - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: John Ayres Memorial Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Flic Ou Voyou's jumping let him down a couple of times last season, we did a lot of work on it. He loves that ground, looked fresh and well. He had a nice weight and I thought he'd win today, he had everything in his favour. It's a nice prize to win with him - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: EBF Stallions "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Flic Ou Voyou has now won three and that was just an exercise canter for him. We'll try and find a better race for him now. I'm not sure where yet - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Unibet 3 Uniboosts A Day Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race) (Div I)
quotes.quote: Flic Ou Voyou was a big, backward horse last year, but just needed time. He's going to run at Newton Abbot on Sunday and I was going to run once and then go chasing, but if he's improving he might just win a nice novice hurdle - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: For a big horse he wasn't the most fluent of jumpers last season, but we have done a lot of work in that department this autumn and it paid off as he came out and jumped nicely to win at Chepstow. I fancied him strongly as everything was in his favour; he wants 2m4f on decent ground. Rarely runs two races alike and was below that form at Wetherby three days ago; the fences there were slightly stiffer than at Chepstow and he got caught out by one. Is ideally suited by a small field and provided I place him right he should win again. 31-10-22

runners.name: Dubai Days
runners.comment: C&D winner before a second over 3m at Carlisle; better at this trip and in the mix
runners.spotlight: Second to Numitor in this 12 months ago; consistent 11yo who was going away at the finish over C&D two runs back and probably better at this trip than the 3m over which he finished second at Carlisle; remains on a competitive mark and very much in the mix.

quotes.race: Unibet Middle Distance Chase Series Veterans' Handicap Chase (Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Dubai Days usually takes a couple of runs to show his best so to do that first time out is good. He had a little niggle in the autumn so we thought we'd get him as ready as we could at home because he can be very hard on himself. He'll be back here next month for the final now - Bruce Lynn, jockey.

quotes.race: Seko Logistics Scotland Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Dubai Days is a lovely, consistent horse. He takes a chance with one or two but I think he'll be better as a second-season chaser. He's declared tomorrow but I don't think he'll run. There's a race back here for him in ten days but I may put him away - Nick Alexander, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He unfortunately had a setback but he's due to be back in training at the end of this month. He's always shown his best form in the spring anyway, so I'd be targeting similar races that he ran in last year. He's a veteran now too, so he can run in that 2m4f veterans' series. He certainly retains all of his ability. 21-11-24

runners.name: Spyglass Hill
runners.comment: Perhaps unfortunate not to beat The Widdow Maker at Exeter as he made a bad mistake
runners.spotlight: All three wins for Henry De Bromhead were on heavy ground but it was good when perhaps unfortunate not to beat The Widdow Maker at Exeter (2m3f, good; made a bad mistake); has the cheekpieces back on here and should go well.

quotes.race: Tim Duggan Memorial Handicap Chase (Grade B)
quotes.quote: Spyglass Hill jumped well out there today, for him he was electric and he deserved to get a nice big one which he did today - Hugh Morgan, rider.

quotes.race: Download The BoyleSports App Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Spyglass Hill was clever and jumped well. He picked up well in the straight and is improving all the time. The novice handicap chase at Cheltenham was on my mind coming here so we'll see. It has taken a long time for the penny to drop with him but he's improving all the time - Henry de Bromhead, trainer

quotes.race: David Fitzgerald Memorial Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: It was a great performance and he got a lovely ride from Hugh [Morgan]. He was a bit unfortunate not to win here at Christmas and had some really good runs since. The plan was to go chasing but we thought he was entitled to have a go at one more hurdle before we went chasing. He's really matured over the summer, he was very immature last year but the penny is starting to drop now - Henry de Bromhead, trainer of Spyglass Hill

stable_tour.quote: I thought he ran really well in the Munster National at Limerick and I'd say the trip just found him out there. With that in mind, we're dropping him back down to two miles five furlongs and going for the Grand Sefton over the National fences at Aintree on Saturday week. 24-10-21

runners.name: The Flier Begley
runners.comment: Beaten about 10l behind Dubai Days here last time and he's off an untouched mark
runners.spotlight: This 10yo has had a fruitful campaign but the handicapper has had his say and there were no real excuses when about 10l behind Dubai Days over C&D two months ago; could be vulnerable again off an untouched mark.

quotes.race: Unibet Middle Distance Chase Series Veterans' Handicap Chase (Unibet  Vets' Chase Series)
quotes.quote: The Flier Begley is a dream to ride, he travels and jumps like a buck. He won quite well in the end. He ran well last time at Haydock and before that he just didn't get home as he was too keen. He's in form now and seems to be showing it. I thought we were up against it with some of the horses here, but we were coming into it with a horse in form. He likes top of the ground and he stays well - Jack Hogan, jockey.

runners.name: The Widdow Maker
runners.comment: All out to win at Exeter but only 2lb higher and historically well handicapped
runners.spotlight: Well held in two hurdles after a long absence but returned to fences at Exeter (2m3f, good) and was all out to repel Spyglass Hill in a four-runner race; up only 2lb and he's historically well handicapped.

quotes.race: Unibet Middle Distance Series Veterans' Handicap Chase (Qualifier)
quotes.quote: It was nice to see The Widdow Maker back, he'd been off the track for two years. These races are made for him as I'm not sure he'd win a normal handicap chase. We'll have a look at the veterans [middle distance] final for him at Haydock next. We could think about it with Le Ligerien too who has been a great horse for us - Joe Tizzard, trainer.

quotes.race: Aspen Waite Complete Business Growth Service Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It wasn't a great race but The Widdow Maker travelled and jumped well. The hood has helped. He's going the right way and he'll be a lovely horse for around Taunton, Wincanton and places like that. He's improving and he's got size and scope - Harry Cobden, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He missed a season with a leg but he's back in now. He's a talented horse who was placed at Grade 1 level as a novice. He's rated into some half-sensible races but we'll try and go as small as we can with him. 07-11-24

runners.name: Whistleinthedark
runners.comment: Looks held by a handful of these based on his last couple of runs
runners.spotlight: Beaten 6l by Le Milos at Warwick in February and looked on the retreat when blundering away any hope he had in the C&D handicap here two months ago won by Dubai Days; others would appear to have more going for them.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Whistleinthedark has been going well since he went chasing and I was hopeful coming here today. He's been progressive and I think he'll go to Aintree next month for a handicap - Laura Morgan, trainer.

quotes.race: Tysers Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I thought turning in I'd win well. Didn't jump the last well but didn't lose any ground and I thought Whistleinthedark would go away away and win well but he's had to dig deep - Brendan Powell, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He joined us this season and his two runs have been encouraging. He finished a half-length second at Ayr and on Boxing Day put that experience to good use with an easy win in a 2m5½f handicap chase at Market Rasen. He's much better over fences than hurdles and is going to give us a lot of fun, although his 12lb hike in the handicap is not going to help. 18-01-23

2:40.race_name: In Memory Of Ian Chambers Challenger Stayers Hurdle Series Final Handicap Hurdle (Final) (GBB Race)

runners.name: Thank You Maam
runners.owner: The Posh Pundit Racing Club Limited
runners.comment: Plucky front-running stayer who's had a thoroughly commendable season under Olive Nicholls
runners.spotlight: Plucky front-running stayer who's had a thoroughly commendable season under Olive Nicholls, including in competitive handicaps and with cheekpieces on last five starts; he needs to pull out extra once again, though.

quotes.race: Thames Materials Novices' Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It seems to have taken a while. Thank You Ma'am has been second six times and deserves to get his head in front and I'm really chuffed. We were going to go straight over fences next but I'm not sure now because that looked like his best performance. He stays well but I'd say he doesn't want bottomless ground through the winter - Georgie Nicholls, trainer.

runners.name: An Tailliur
runners.breeder: S A R L Haras Du Logis Saint Germain
runners.comment: Missed last season and has not fired this term but he's now 14lb below his peak mark
runners.spotlight: Missed last season and has not fired this term but he's now 14lb below his peak mark and all of his wins have been on good ground; he's been too well beaten for comfort this term, notwithstanding the softer ground, but needs a close look and market check.

quotes.race: Challenger Stayers Hurdle Series Final Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: An Tailliur is a great little horse who keeps on improving and likes good ground, which is key to him. He had a good few races so we had to give him a bit of a break and you could see he needed it but he hung on. He'll go through the summer, the owner is from Galway and we'll see what's there in the summer - Jonjo O'Neill, trainer.

quotes.race: Short Run Press Celebrating 40 Years Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: That was a great performance, we're happy with that so onwards and upwards. It was disappointing the last day at Cheltenham - An Tailliur was positioned out but knuckled on landing - but he's bounced back so happy days. He's a good ground horse so I'd imagine we'll put him away and go out again in the spring, maybe think about something at Cheltenham in March. You never know - Joe Hickey, racing manager to Pat Hickey, owner of An Tailliur.

quotes.race: N&L Franklin Developments Ltd Novices' Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: An Tailliur jumped really well and he's still learning as he progresses. He was obviously well in so we had to go. Dad and the team have done well finding these races for him - Jonjo O'Neill Jr - jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's won his fair share of races but he's going to find it harder now having gone up in the weights. He needs good ground and we were delighted to qualify him for the Pertemps Final when third at Cheltenham on Saturday before the ground goes against him. If the ground is suitable we'll look at what was the Fixed Brush Hurdle [now the Betfair Exchange Stayers' Handicap Hurdle] at Haydock next month and then freshen him up for the spring. We'll probably go chasing with him in either the spring or summer. 25-10-22

runners.name: Tiny Tetley
runners.owner: R J Hodges & Mrs S L Hobbs
runners.comment: Can front-run; won three small-field handicaps this season, including his last two starts
runners.spotlight: Can front-run; won three small-field handicaps this season, including last two starts and the latest (on good to firm; under Calumn Pritchard) seemed to be a career best; up another 6lb and it's not clear whether soft ground can be blamed for lesser efforts in two more competitive fields, but he needs plenty of respect.

runners.name: Burrows Hall
runners.owner: Mrs C Casterton & Mrs J Morgan
runners.comment: Made all last three races, with a last-flight mistake latest; up another 5lb but on a roll
runners.spotlight: Made all at Uttoxeter (2m4f), Market Rasen (extended 2m7f) and Doncaster (3m, good) on last three outings, with a last-flight mistake not helping his margin of victory last time; up another 5lb but he's on a roll.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Daily Price Boosts Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Stayers Hurdle Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Burrows Hall has improved again because I thought the mare would win today. He'd gone up a bit for winning but she'd [Rialannah] stayed where she was and we'd waited for the ground with her. It's a shame to run them together, but they needed to run for the final. She'll probably run again beforehand, he probably won't. It's hard to tell how much improvement there is in him because he's so tough. He's not very big. The idea was to go novice chasing but he needs a small track and there hasn't been enough novice chases around those courses. We've set our stall out for this final at Haydock - Joel Parkinson, joint-trainer.

runners.name: Land Genie
runners.comment: Soft-ground win in December; creditable 4th last time showed that he now needs improvement
runners.spotlight: Wind surgery before second and first in soft-ground handicaps in December for new yard, latterly over 3m2f at Warwick; fourth of 11 there three weeks later was creditable on form but showed that he now needs improvement; withdrawn when the ground was officially good at Bangor four weeks ago.

stable_tour.quote: He won his bumper at Huntingdon last season and bumped into a nice horse on hurdling debut at Carlisle, who has subsequently won since. He's a half-brother to Constitution Hill but this fellow is by Flemensfirth and bred to get a trip, so we're looking forward to stepping him up in distance at Lingfield on Tuesday. 14-11-23

runners.name: High Game Royal
runners.comment: Two close 2nds in the autumn and back-to-form 2nd latest; should be seriously involved
runners.spotlight: Two close seconds in the autumn (2m7f, good to soft/good) and he was back to form when second of five at Bangor (2m7f, good) four weeks ago; should be seriously involved.

stable_tour.quote: His comeback second at Warwick the other day was a really good run. It was his first chase and I was a bit concerned beforehand because it looked very competitive and there were a lot of runners but he ran with enormous credit. The front two pulled clear but he's only gone up 4lb for that so should still be competitive. 23-11-23

He's a tough little horse who always wears his heart on his sleeve. He galloped all the way to the line when second on his reappearance at Exeter last week. He'll be out again in two or three weeks and hopefully he'll be able to continue to give connections plenty of fun over the winter. 30-10-24

runners.name: Bold Recruit
runners.comment: Fair 3rd to Burrows Hall on h'cap debut at Doncaster (3m, good) but needs markedly better
runners.spotlight: 0-5 in Irish points; placed in his two bumpers and off the mark in a maiden at Ludlow (3m, good to soft) in February on third start over hurdles; fair third of six to Burrows Hall on handicap debut at Doncaster (3m, good) last month but needs markedly better than that with his mark unchanged.

2:05.race_name: JCB Challenger Two Mile Hurdle Series Final Handicap Hurdle (Series Final) (GBB Race)

runners.name: Givemefive

prev_owners.owner: Any Excuse For A Holiday Syndicate
