runners.comment: Personal best when making all at Newcastle five weeks ago; should go well again
runners.spotlight: Posted personal best in first-time tongue-strap five weeks ago, making all in four-runner race at Newcastle (2m1f, good to soft); that was his fourth hurdles win, and with more improvement possible he should go well again.

quotes.race: Masterson Holdings Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Givemefive has been a fabulous little horse and well found by my cousin Megan [Nicholls]. From the first day we jumped him we knew we'd have some fun. I'm really proud, he's never let us down and this was a plan we've had for a long time and it's paid off. I won't do big handicaps until after Christmas, there's a race for four-year-olds at Fairyhouse next month or we leave him alone. He's got good days ahead of him and I'd love to run him in a Betfair Hurdle - Harry Derham, trainer.

quotes.race: Coral Adonis Juvenile Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'm delighted with Givemefive. He has run a screamer and there are lots of options but I'd be surprised if he went to Cheltenham as he's had a fair tear up there - Harry Derham, trainer.

quotes.race: Hazelton Mountford Insurance Brokers Juvenile Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We were hoping Givemefive might go and run in the Fred Winter and you could go for the Adonis (Juvenile Hurdle at Kempton Park) before that. Entries close for the Triumph Hurdle tomorrow and I'm going to enter him after winning like that carrying a penalty. To run in the Fred Winter he needs to have another run. If he didn't need to have another run then I would almost certainly run him in the Fred Winter - Harry Derham, trainer.

quotes.race: Download The Rhino.Bet App Juvenile Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Givemefive held modest form on the Flat, but we loved his last performance. He stayed going well and with a juvenile you need a horse who stays well. He's loved jumping from the start, which is a big advantage, and the form of his last race reads well, so we hoped he'd do that and he did it nicely - Harry Derham, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: We were delighted with his win at Cheltenham last weekend. It was the first time we rode him tucked in behind and he settled. His target after Christmas will be the Betfair Hurdle and whether we go to Fairyhouse at the end of November is up for debate. He has a fabulous attitude. 01-11-24

runners.name: Luttrell Lad
runners.comment: Capitalised on reduced mark at Taunton and far from disgraced at Aintree; shortlisted
runners.spotlight: Fourth of 17 in the Swinton Hurdle here last spring; capitalised on reduced mark at Taunton (2m, good to soft) in February and far from disgraced in warm race at Aintree two weeks ago; shortlisted.

quotes.race: MansionBet Beaten By A Head Maiden Hurdle (Arc Summer Novices' Brush Hurdle Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Luttrell Lad is nice. He had very good bumper form and it was nice to get him started off over hurdles. He can be a bit fizzy but we went a good gallop there and it allowed him to settle and jump well. Day one is out of the way now and there's plenty to look forward to - Tom O'Brien, jockey.

quotes.race: Pertemps Network Standard Open National Hunt Flat Race (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Luttrell Lad was very green at Stratford first time. He learned a lot and he kept on well here - Richard Johnson, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's gone for a winter break and will be back in the spring but he's a good horse for us. We got him handicapped on the Flat [75] and his last run was probably just one too many. 08-11-22

He's been a decent horse for us, winning over hurdles as well as running a cracker when eighth in the County Hurdle at the festival in March. I was happy enough with his reappearance effort at Haydock last month and then he looked like he was going to win at Hereford on Saturday but got caught late on having started racing way too soon. Unfortunately he's been plagued with problems; he's got a suppressed immune response without a shadow of a doubt and has been very difficult to train. As a result he'll never achieve what he possibly could have done. He's incredibly genuine and a lot of horses wouldn't have faced the bridle suffering what he's been through. He's had to have constant treatment and the owners have had to be so patient - for them it's like owning two horses in training as he has to have constant physio. I'd still like to think he has a nice handicap in him, but he's a mystery. I don't know if he'd stay as far as 3m. When we first got him we thought he'd be a real speed merchant who'd want top of the ground, but he's not as fast as he thinks he is. 20-12-23

runners.name: Bluegrass

prev_owners.owner: D Smith, Mrs J Magnier, M Tabor, Westerberg
M Tabor & D Smith & Mrs J Magnier & Westerberg

runners.comment: Enhanced good Fakenham record when scoring bravely last time; cannot be dismissed
runners.spotlight: Having a productive season and took his record over 2m at Fakenham to 3-3 when scoring bravely five weeks ago; handles good and soft ground; up another 3lb but cannot be dismissed.

quotes.race: PH Betts (Holdings) Ltd Silver Cup Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: We might run Bluegrass in some nice handicaps on the Flat in the summer. He's fairly straightforward, he's very lazy at home. He's had a few wind operations and he runs in a tongue-tie for a reason - Stuart Edmunds, trainer.

quotes.race: Robert Case Memorial Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Bluegrass has a bit of class about him but I don't know if the track really suited him. It's great that he's got his head in front and he was rated high enough to be competitive in a maiden hurdle. We'll go back handicapping after that - Stuart Edmunds, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF (C & G) Maiden
quotes.quote: Bluegrass never really got into his stride last day but he can improve a bit more. He's a very relaxed horse - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's one of those Galileo colts with a lot of speed on the dam's side. She won the Commonwealth Cup and the Sprint Cup at Haydock, but he's got the Galileo stamina. He was still green when he ran in the Zetland and you'll see a more mature horse this year. He could go to the Derrinstown, and we'll take it from there. 19-04-22

runners.name: Oslo
runners.comment: Often let down by his jumping; potentially well handicapped but has something to prove
runners.spotlight: Often let down by his jumping and made several mistakes when last of six at Wetherby (second favourite) in November; has since been unplaced twice on the AW; potentially well handicapped but has something to prove.

stable_tour.quote: He has been a little unlucky not to win this year with three seconds, all at Lingfield. Last week he was a little disappointing but they crawled round and he needs a good pace, so when they quickened he was caught out. He will have a break now before coming back on the turf. I think he can win on the grass in fact he could be a better horse than on the all-weather. He seems versatile regarding trip, but I feel 1m4f in a true run race would be ideal for him, as when it is run slowly he gets a bit keen and is hard to settle. 29-03-21

runners.name: Well Educated
runners.comment: Handicapper looked in charge after two wins last May; now returns from five months off
runners.spotlight: Won twice in quick succession (2m4f/2m) last May but the handicapper looked in charge after that; has slipped back down the weights but is still 1lb higher than for most recent success; returns from five months off.

quotes.race: Gilcrux Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Two Mile Hurdle Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Well Educated has run well. They said he couldn't handle the soft ground but he's handled that all right. He's a grand horse who  does everything you want - George Bewley, trainer.

runners.name: Schmilsson
runners.owner: Both Sides Of The Sea Syndicate
runners.comment: Below par since scoring at Wetherby in October; needs to be revitalised by cheekpieces
runners.spotlight: Now 2lb lower than when scoring under Kevin Brogan at Wetherby (2m, good to soft) in October, but he seems to have been going through the motions since; needs to be revitalised by first-time cheekpieces.

quotes.race: Betting.Bet New Betting Sites Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race) (Div II)
quotes.quote: I don't think it was much of a race, and Reach For The Moon ran below par, but Schmilsson is going the right way. It's taken him a couple of runs to relax but hopefully he can improve in handicaps. His work has always been nice at home and he got a good ride from Fergus [Gregory], who is riding really well at the moment - Olly Murphy, trainer.

runners.name: Got Grey
runners.breeder: S C E A Haras De Treli
runners.comment: Two wins in 2024 and excuses since; tongue-tie and Harry Skelton return today; interesting
runners.spotlight: In good form last August/September, winning twice on a sound surface; seemingly disappointing last five outings but there have been excuses; the tongue-strap returns today and so does Harry Skelton; interesting contender.

1:30.race_name: Watch On Racing TV Mares' Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.name: Forcetoreckonwith
runners.comment: Point winner; pulled hard on rules debut; will need to settle better for fitting of hood
runners.spotlight: Clearcut point winner last October but was weak in market and pulled hard when well held in 2m3f maiden hurdle at Wetherby last month; has potential but will need to settle better for the application of a hood.

runners.name: Jokers N Clowns
runners.comment: 0-9 in Ireland but more encouragement on debut for new yard when second  at Newton Abbot
runners.spotlight: Point winner; had nine goes over hurdles for Gavin Cromwell in Ireland, finishing placed just once and subsequently sold cheaply; more encouragement on debut for new yard when second of five at Newton Abbot (2m5f, good) last Thursday, headed last after making running and jumping right; cheekpieces (worn once in Ireland) back on today; should be thereabouts.

runners.name: Kalize
runners.comment: Well held in two bumpers in 2024 (wind surgery in between); bit to prove now hurdling
runners.spotlight: Comes from yard that does well in bumpers but she was twice well held in that sphere in 2024 (wind surgery in between); bit to prove now hurdling.

runners.name: Soleil Darizona
runners.breeder: E A R L Ecurie Du Fosse Blanc
runners.comment: Bled last time but had previously shaped well when second; has had wind surgery
runners.spotlight: 1m3f winner on Flat in France; made much of running when second of nine at Exeter (2m, good) on hurdling debut last autumn, pulling clear with winner; pulled hard and bled at Wetherby five weeks later; now returns from five months off after a breathing operation, in a first-time tongue-strap and a re-fitted hood; risky but clearly talented.

stable_tour.quote: A tidy sort for mares' novice hurdles. She whizzed round Exeter first time out but just got caught on the line, so I think a tighter track would suit her better, but she loves her jumping and shows plenty of pace. 12-11-24

runners.name: Susiesparkle
runners.owner: J Fyffe, A Edmondson & L Mcgurty

prev_owners.owner: J Fyffe, A Edmondson & L McGurty

runners.comment: 1m2f Flat winner; may have a future in this sphere but needs to improve to win this
runners.spotlight: Won 1m2f AW handicap at Newcastle in February and creditable third twice since; modest form in three hurdles runs over the winter, best effort on debut; may have a future in this sphere but needs to improve to win this.

runners.name: Duke Of Deception
runners.comment: Won smoothly on soft in this race last year; 2nd on good over 3m5f/3m4f on last two starts
runners.spotlight: Won smoothly on soft ground in this race last year (7lb higher today); handicapper has had the call since but seconds at Warwick (3m5f, good) and Haydock (3m4f, good) on last two outings showed that he should have a big say in this very small field.

quotes.race: Tim Molony Memorial Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Duke Of Deception has been a different horse this year. He was really inconsistent last season for whatever reason but he seems to travel and jump a lot better. He handles the soft ground and he's going the right way - Oliver Greenall, joint trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He just got beat in the Highland National at Perth in April and we'll aim him at the local Nationals, starting in the Berkshire National at Ascot on Saturday. He likes good ground and seems to get better every season. 21-11-24

He's had two runs in point-to-points, the latter when a length-and-a-half third at Tralee in May with the first and second home being bought by Paul Nicholls and Nicky Henderson for six figures. Our fellow was a length clear at the last but was very green and was just run out of it. He's a classy, big horse and the plan is to start off in a bumper and then go straight over hurdles. 05-10-21

runners.name: Impatient
runners.breeder: S C E A Haras Du Hoguenet
runners.comment: Won at Ffos Las (3m, soft) in November; rallying to challenge when he fell at Southwell
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 7yo, seen in clearly his most favourable light when off the mark in handicap chase at Ffos Las (3m, soft; 40-1) in November; well below form eight days later (good to firm) but he was rallying to challenge when falling two out at Southwell (3m2f, good to soft) last month; possibilities.

stable_tour.quote: He's needed time to fill his frame but ran very well on his first start over hurdles at Carlisle last month. He ran a bit green but I'd say the first three aren't bad and it was a good start. Hopefully he'll improve for the run and I'd say he'll be a nice staying chaser in time. We'll probably keep him to two and a half miles over hurdles for now. 14-11-23

runners.name: Good Work
runners.comment: Finally off the mark in January; first time since 2021 that's he's not had his tongue tied
runners.spotlight: 13 seconds tell a story but he did get off the mark at the 27th attempt, at Uttoxeter (3m2f, good to soft) in January; pulled up next time (3m6f, heavy) and well beaten latest (3m, good) but he's well capable of being bang there on a good day; first time since 2021 that's he's not had his tongue tied.

runners.name: Safe Destination
runners.comment: Improving 7yo who's had three wins and three seconds from his six starts this season
runners.spotlight: Improving 7yo who's had three wins and three seconds from his six starts this season; last four outings were under 7lb-claiming amateur Toby McCain-Mitchell; put in his place last time but the winner scored almost as comfortably in a much better race at Cheltenham this week and the third has been runner-up; trip and ground fine; plenty to like.

runners.name: Artic Row

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late Trevor Hemmings

runners.comment: Below best on last two starts and adding cheekpieces shows something needs to change
runners.spotlight: Three chase wins at Ayr (2m4f on soft/good to soft) last winter but below best there in March and at Carlisle since; Callum Pritchard takes off a helpful 5lb but adding cheekpieces acknowledges something needs to change.

quotes.race: Weatherbys Digital Solutions Handicap Chase (Go North Monet's Garden Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Artic Row is an improving young horse who jumps well and he's one to look forward to. He won at the track last time and likes decent ground. He'll make a nice staying chaser next year - Nick Alexander, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He had an unfortunate start to the season when he unseated at the first at Hexham and then fell at Ayr. He loves that track and we want to try him over 3m as I don't think staying that trip will be a problem. I want to get a completion and hopefully a win under his belt and then make a plan after that. He's a strong traveller and I don't see why he can't compete at a higher level. 21-11-24

runners.name: Captain Ivan
runners.comment: Recaptured form for new yard back from absence; still well treated; good claims
runners.spotlight: Has won on good to soft but suited by good; has recaptured form for new yard back from absence, beating an in-form rival at Market Rasen (2m3f) and losing nothing in defeat at Carlisle (2m, good) last month; favourably treated still on past form; good claims.

quotes.race: Vickers.Bet Independent Family Owned Bookmaker Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Captain Ivan tends to travel well but not find too much off the bridle. They went a really good gallop though and pace in a race is what he wants. Patrick Cowley, rider.

runners.name: Catchim
runners.comment: Winning hurdle debut last June; pulled up on handicap/chase debut last month
runners.spotlight: 0-6 in points but made successful hurdle debut over 2m4f at Southwell (good) last June; has more to prove on two later runs, though, particularly when pulled up on handicap/chase debut back at Southwell (3m, good) last month.

runners.name: Red Hugh
runners.comment: Won Irish point/2m7f maiden hurdle; modest handicap debut; off since August; chase debut
runners.spotlight: Won Irish point; followed Worcester maiden hurdle win (2m7f, good) last July with a modest handicap debut there in August; off since but should have potential now chasing; any easing of the ground would be an unknown.

runners.name: The Paddy Pie

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late John Wade

runners.comment: Rekindled enthusiasm this winter, completing hat-trick latest; another win on the cards
runners.spotlight: Looked rather gone at the game last winter so connections and rider Jack Power have done brilliantly to get his enthusiasm back at his age; he completed the hat-trick a shade cosily at Sedgefield (2m5f, good; won on soft twice in midwinter) in March and another win is on the cards.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Every Saturday Money Back Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We might've got to the front a bit too soon and The Paddy Pie is not really a three-miler, but he got away with it on that ground and he jumped superbly. He's not young, but he might just go in again - Joel Parkinson, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: William Hill Leading Racecourse Bookmaker Chase (A Novices' Limited Handicap)
quotes.quote: The step up in trip has done The Paddy Pie good today. He's getting stronger all the time and with another summer on his back, he'll be a very nice horse. - Sue Smith, trainer.

quotes.race: Brian Ellison Racing Club Chase (A Novices' Limited Handicap) (Sedgefield Young Chaser Series Qual)
quotes.quote: The Paddy Pie is a nice horse. He's just turned six and there's a lot more to come from him - Harvey Smith, husband of trainer Sue Smith.

runners.name: Special Dragon
runners.comment: Won 2m5f hurdle last spring; not so good over fences as yet; more to prove if ground eases
runners.spotlight: Three good runs in handicap hurdles last spring, including a Ludlow win (2m5f, good), but she's not yet as good over fences (fell two starts ago) and softening ground would give her more to prove.

runners.name: Kings Justice
runners.comment: Consistent last winter; mixed this time round but on the premises when fell 2 out latest
runners.spotlight: Consistent spell last winter included a 2m3f win at Catterick (good to soft); not having such a steady time of it this winter but he hadn't been brushed off when coming down two out in the race won by The Paddy Pie at Sedgefield last month; in the mix if shrugging that off.

4:25.race_name: JCB Hydrogen Novices' Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.name: Queens Venture
runners.comment: Dual handicap winner; may have needed the run last time and she's back up in trip
runners.spotlight: Hasn't progressed since winning back-to-back good-ground handicaps in October (2m7f/2m4f) but could have needed it after a break at Ludlow last time (2m5f) and returning to further looks a good move.

runners.name: Born In The West
runners.comment: Consistent in handicaps and appeared to get outstayed by the winner over 3m3f last time
runners.spotlight: Not out of the first two in his four handicaps and appeared to get outstayed by the winner over 3m3f at Sedgefield last time having travelled much the best; up another 4lb but looks on an upward curve.

runners.name: Mahler Moon
runners.comment: Appreciated the return to 3m at Newbury and still nicely handicapped off 4lb higher
runners.spotlight: Had been off for three months before finding 2m3f too sharp on her return to hurdling in February and was seen in a very different light back over 3m at Newbury (good to soft), winning a race in which she was second the year before when with Dan Skelton; still nicely handicapped off 4lb higher.

runners.name: Elusiveness
runners.comment: 7lb higher this afternoon but this is only her 12th start and clearly on the upgrade
runners.spotlight: Raised in grade here but she's 2-2 in this headgear combination having won easily at Taunton (3m) and again over 2m5f at Ludlow when 2lb well in; 7lb higher this afternoon but this is only her 12th start and clearly on the upgrade; good ground seems ideal.

quotes.race: Par Inn Cornwall Mares' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: It's been a long time and we were beginning to wonder what we had to do to make Elusiveness win. I think the better ground and headgear helped with her jumping and probably it wasn't a very good race. I think we can build on today. She's big enough to jump a fence and there are plenty of races she could run in - Jeremy Scott, trainer.

runners.name: Star Vantage

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late John Wade

runners.comment: Good run in a Class 2 before seemingly outstayed over 3m3f at Sedgefield; can go well
runners.spotlight: Good fourth in a Class 2 at Musselburgh (3m) before seemingly outstayed by a stablemate over 3m3f at Sedgefield; 3lb rise annoying but shouldn't be far away back at 3m.

4:14.race_name: Advertise Your Business At Huntingdon Racecourse Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.name: Law Of Supply
runners.comment: Disappointed last month, after a break, but made excellent start to chase career in autumn
runners.spotlight: Made excellent start to chase/handicap career in the autumn, winning at Worcester (2m7f, soft) and Ascot (3m, good) before good third at Taunton (2m7f, good); disappointed when back in action last month but has good chance here if he rebounds.

quotes.race: Visit Sri Lanka Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: I said Law Of Supply would never do anything until he goes over fences. And he's won really impressively today. He is a nice horse - Kim Bailey, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's a lovely horse. Unfortunately, his owner died before being able to see him run- he asked me to buy him a chaser and that's what I did. He's had wind problems but it was nice to see him take advantage of his handicap mark at Worcester fairly impressively and he'll head to Ascot provided the ground is safe. 19-11-24

runners.name: Muskoka
runners.comment: Ran well on both outings since 3m1f Hereford win in November; the one with least to prove
runners.spotlight: Built upon promising chase debut when winning by 11l at Hereford (3m1f, good to soft) in December and both runs since the turn of the year were perfectly respectable; should be fine on today's faster ground and last month's wind op could plausibly enable improvement; ought to be a tough nut to crack.

stable_tour.quote: He wasn't right last season but he came out and travelled like a nice horse on his debut over hurdles at Hereford. He's going to need further than two miles but I think he's got a chance of winning a novice and his fair share of races. 22-11-23

He wants nicer ground. It was a good run at Wincanton last week, from what we could see in the fog, but it was tacky ground there and he'd won well at Hereford, where the ground was nicer. He has a good mindset and will keep improving. He's learning and, as the ground gets better, so will he. 29-01-25

runners.name: Pearly Island
runners.comment: Won over hurdles in new headgear in January but in poor form since
runners.spotlight: Seemingly boosted by change of headgear when emphatic winner over hurdles at Fakenham (2m4f, good to soft; first-time visor) on New Year's Day, but subsequent hurdling form has been very disappointing; reverts to chasing on a workable mark but with quite a bit to prove, including stamina.

quotes.race: Gamble Plant Norfolk Ltd Grand Prix Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: After Pearly Island ran over fences at Doncaster last time I suggested a try back over hurdles. It's nice to get it right sometimes - Tom Cannon, jockey.

quotes.race: Boost Your Festival Winnings @rhino.bet Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: It was a drop in class for Pearly Island and we came here quite confident as the race he finished second in at Fakenham has worked out well. The ground was soft enough for him and we'll keep going after that - Lucy Wadham, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: It was a lovely win for his owner when he switched back to hurdles from chasing at Fakenham on New Year's Day. He's been a pretty solid horse but has been quite disappointing on his last two runs. He has a problem with his feet - they're very flat - and he recently pulled both his front plates off, which wasn't ideal. We're going to take him back to Fakenham on April 1 next. 19-03-25

runners.name: Safe Destination
runners.comment: Improving 7yo who's had three wins and three seconds from his six starts this season
runners.spotlight: Improving 7yo who's had three wins and three seconds from his six starts this season; last four outings were under 7lb-claiming amateur Toby McCain-Mitchell; put in his place last time but the winner scored almost as comfortably in a much better race at Cheltenham this week and the third has been runner-up; trip and ground fine; plenty to like.

3:39.race_name: Visit Huntingdon For Your Next Conference Handicap Hurdle

runners.name: Leading Lion
runners.comment: Pulled up on stable debut in December and arrives here with a lot to prove
runners.spotlight: Won 16-runner Bellewstown handicap (2m4f, good) for Gordon Elliott last summer, but left that stable after some below-par efforts in the autumn and was pulled up (albeit on soft ground) for new yard in December; subsequent wind op might have helped but he arrives here with a lot to prove.

runners.name: Lexies Moon
runners.comment: Dual hurdle winner on slow ground (once over C&D); needs to better last two efforts
runners.spotlight: Won soft-ground C&D maiden last season and double her tally in Stratford handicap (2m, heavy) on reappearance outing in October; however, her next two runs were underwhelming and she may not be ideally suited by the forecast good ground here.

runners.name: Book Of Tales

prev_owners.owner: Sheikh Hamdan bin Mohammed Al Maktoum

runners.comment: Raced too freely when upped to 2m5f last month; player on earlier form at around 2m
runners.spotlight: Fair Flat racer who is still unexposed over hurdles and returned from long layoff with two good handicap runs this winter (2m/1m7f, good to soft); well beaten after racing too freely over 2m5f last month, but today's drop back in trip looks the right move and the forecast good ground will suit.

quotes.race: QuinnBet Acca Bonus Handicap
quotes.quote: This trip will be the bare minimum for Book Of Tales but the blinkers certainly focussed his mind and he's going the right way now - Charlie Johnston, trainer.

runners.name: Casi Crudo
runners.owner: L Cross, Sean Cross, P Johnston

prev_owners.owner: T Acott, L Cross, Sean Cross, P Johnston

runners.comment: Ran no race last month but was in good form beforehand and remains well handicapped
runners.spotlight: Ran no race at Fakenham last month and needs to bounce back, but was placed twice on soft ground at Warwick in February and is now 5lb lower than when going close on good ground over C&D in November.

runners.name: Aotano
runners.comment: Caused 28-1 surprise in Doncaster handicap last month and now 2-5 over hurdles
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 4yo who caused 28-1 surprise in Doncaster handicap (2m, good to soft; flights in home straight omitted) last month and is now 2-5 over hurdles; will also be suited by the forecast good ground and has scope for further progress.

runners.name: Tara Iti
runners.comment: 2-4 over hurdles for current stable (one win over C&D); commands respect in current mood
runners.spotlight: Scored in first-time visor at Plumpton (2m, good) a fortnight ago and is now 2-4 over hurdles for current stable (other win was over C&D); now only 1lb below career-high mark but commands respect in current mood.

quotes.race: Veolia Nursery Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Tara Iti is bred to go on this testing ground. He travelled well despite being a little keen early. I took it up early enough, but he kept it up all the way to the line - Andrea Atzeni, jockey.

runners.name: Indemnity
runners.comment: Useful Flat racer; promising third over hurdles last month; can improve again in handicaps
runners.spotlight: Useful on the Flat for Roger Varian; spoiled chance by racing far too freely on stable/hurdle debut in February but, with a hood fitted, settled much better and shaped with significant promise when third at Market Rasen (2m, good to soft) last month; the hood is left off here but, nevertheless, he's open to considerable further improvement on this handicap hurdle debut.

quotes.race: Euro2024 Daily Giveaways On Rhino.Bet Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Indemnity has had plenty of seconds so it's nice to get his head in front and hopefully he'll get some confidence off the back of this. I was kicking myself at Leicester because he travelled into it really well and I think I pressed the button a bit soon. He won his race, pricked his ears a bit and one just picked me off from out the back. I held on to him longer today. I think he'll be suited to a competitive handicap where they go fast and he can pick them up late - James Doyle, jockey.

runners.name: Mill Street
runners.comment: Ended 2024 in good form against own age-group; open to improvement in handicaps
runners.spotlight: Came good over hurdles at third attempt with clearcut success against own age-group at Sedgefield (2m1f, good) in November, and was not discredited under penalty at Taunton (2m, good to soft) the following month; makes handicap debut after 110-day absence but may still have potential.

2:29.race_name: Purchase Hospitality At Huntingdon Racecourse Mares' Handicap Chase (Queen Boudicca Series Qual')

runners.name: Overabottleofred
runners.comment: Ran well in defeat in both chases; big player if today's faster ground suits
runners.spotlight: Placed on handicap hurdle debut at Uttoxeter (2m7f, good to soft) last May and returned from break with two clear seconds in slow-ground Leicester chases (2m6f/2m4f) this winter; big player if coping with the quicker conditions.

runners.name: Lucky Rose
runners.comment: 0-7 over hurdles but makes chasing debut from workable mark; return to good ground a plus
runners.spotlight: 0-7 over hurdles and absent since below-par run on soft ground in December, but makes chasing debut from a workable mark and will be suited by today's return to good ground; shortlisted.

runners.name: Generous Scorpion
runners.comment: Placed in 2m novice hurdle last month but well beaten over 2m4f since; chase debut
runners.spotlight: Unexposed 7yo who showed promise in Irish points last year and was placed in a 2m novice hurdle last month (good ground); ran very poorly when returned to 2m4f for next outing, though, and it's hard to know what to expect from her on this chase/handicap debut.

runners.name: Oneforthefairgreen
runners.comment: Never looked dangerous when remote third on chasing debut; now 0-14 overall
runners.spotlight: Never looked dangerous when remote third on last month's chasing debut at Ffos Las (2m3f, good) and now 0-14 under all codes; probably worth another go at this sort of trip but others in the field appeal more.

runners.name: Ladys Present
runners.comment: Consistent in low-grade handicap hurdles since December; can feature on this chase debut
runners.spotlight: 0-11 over hurdles but scores good marks for her consistency in low-grade handicaps since December; ought to be suited by today's trip-and-ground combination; can feature if she jumps adequately on chasing debut.

runners.name: Comeonrita
runners.comment: Well beaten in her first two chases and now 0-11 overall; tries a new trip
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in her first two chases (both over 2m3f this year) and now 0-11 overall; tries a new trip today; 2lb out of the weights; difficult to enthuse over.

4:49.race_name: Buy In Advance At Huntingdon Racecourse Handicap Hurdle

runners.name: The Dark Edge
runners.comment: Scored at Warwick when upped to 3m2f last month and is also suited by this track; a player
runners.spotlight: Evidently well suited by step up in trip when scoring at Warwick (3m2f, good) last month and now 2-10 over hurdles; 5lb rise probably doesn't leave him with much margin for error, but he ran well on his only previous visit to Huntingdon and ought to be on the premises again.

runners.name: The Wise Traveller
runners.comment: Won five-runner C&D contest eight days ago, his third course success; obvious contender
runners.spotlight: Returned to form with C&D (good) win in five-runner contest eight days ago, his third course victory; not always one to rely upon heavily but still feature prominently in calculations.

quotes.race: Newlands Developments Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: We were despairing of The Wise Traveller last year and nearly sent him to the sales but this year he's done nothing but improve. It was a low-grade race but he did it well - Charlie Longsdon, trainer.

runners.name: Seek Him There
runners.comment: 0-6 over hurdles and needs to improve; hiked up in trip and tried in cheekpieces
runners.spotlight: Did not achieve a great deal when last of three finishers at Market Rasen (2m2f, good) last month and is now 0-6 over hurdles; needs combination of hike up in trip and first-time cheekpieces to prompt improvement.

runners.name: Bobalot
runners.comment: Yet to build upon pleasing stable debut in February but worth another go at a staying trip
runners.spotlight: Creditable second on stable debut at Chepstow (2m3f, soft; race worked out well) in February; not quite in same form since but didn't run badly at Fontwell (2m5f, good) three weeks ago and looks well worth another crack at a staying trip; might be the answer.

quotes.race: Best Odds Guaranteed Daily At Vickers.Bet Handicap Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: Bobalot reverted back to hurdles after not enjoying jumping fences. He's got a Flat pedigree, so he appreciated that drop to them and he's well handicapped over hurdles. We knew if he was happy over them then he should run well and Tom [Bellamy] gave him a great ride - Ben Clarke, trainer.

runners.name: Shibuya Song
runners.comment: Won when fresh in September; laboured on next two outings; back from another break
runners.spotlight: Off the mark over hurdles with 33-1 success at Worcester (2m7f, good) last September, after a break, but looked laboured when well held on next two autumn outings and needs to have been refreshed by latest layoff.

runners.name: Good Bye

prev_owners.owner: Some Girls Have All The Luck

runners.comment: Regressive 10yo who needs to turn a corner
runners.spotlight: Regressive 10yo who has largely been disappointing this season and remains without a win since January 2023; too well handicapped to rule out but needs to turn a corner.

quotes.race: Happy 60th Birthday Neil Young Handicap Hurdle (Go North Cab On Target Series Qualifier) (Div I)
quotes.quote: We've sweetened Good Bye up since we got him and he was amazing today - he didn't used to go past horses and that's the first time he's wanted to go on his own in front. Sara Ender, trainer.

runners.name: Tiny Tantrum
runners.comment: Has modest strike-rate and last month's C&D run was no better than respectable
runners.spotlight: Has modest 1-17 strike-rate over hurdles and was nothing better than a respectable fifth of eight over C&D (good) last month, his second start after a layoff; others have more pressing claims.

runners.name: Jumbo Veste Verte
runners.comment: Didn't really take to chasing this season and struggled when back over hurdles last month
runners.spotlight: 12-race maiden who didn't really take to chasing this season and struggled when back over hurdles last month; swaps cheekpieces for first-time blinkers.

runners.name: Carapaz
runners.comment: Absent since some disappointing chase runs in autumn 2023
runners.spotlight: Yet to be placed after nine starts and absent since some disappointing chasing efforts in autumn 2023; 2lb wrong; could be considered only if lively in the betting.

3:04.race_name: Join The 20 Club At Huntingdon Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.name: Mint Edition
runners.comment: Non-runner
runners.spotlight: Won three in a row on the AW for Edward Bethell in early 2023 but was in very poor form on the Flat for this stable last year and makes his hurdling debut after a 278-day absence; tongue-tie fitted; non-runner.

runners.name: Give It To Me Oj
runners.comment: Excelled himself when fourth in Aintree Grade 1 last month; ought to win this easily
runners.spotlight: Fairly useful Flat racer who has taken very well to hurdling this season; comfortably justified odds-on favouritism at Newbury (2m, soft) in February and excelled himself when fourth in Grade 1 at recent Aintree festival (2m1f, good to soft); likely to collect this prize with minimal fuss.

quotes.race: Get Best Odds Guaranteed At BetVictor Juvenile Hurdle (Novices' Championship Hurdle Qualifier) (GBB)
quotes.quote: Apart from the last, Give It To Me OJ jumped well. He was going a bit left-handed, but that might have been because the front horse was going left-handed. Through no fault of his own he's had a messed up season, but he needed that run the other day when he was second - Gary Moore, joint-trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's been running well on the Flat all summer without winning but has taken well to hurdling at home and ran well on his first start over jumps at Wincanton on Sunday. He was beaten by two higher-rated Flat horses and looked like a stiffer test would have suited him better. It was a good start and he'll improve for it. There could be a nice juvenile hurdle in him this winter. 29-10-24

runners.name: Bradshaw
runners.comment: Struggled on his first two hurdling starts
runners.spotlight: Pulled up in Newbury race won by stablemate Give It To Me OJ on stable/hurdle debut in February and also struggled at Fontwell (2m3f, good) last month.

runners.name: Alvesta
runners.comment: Placed in low-grade 1m4f AW handicap last month; makes hurdle debut
runners.spotlight: 0-19 on the Flat but was placed off a much reduced mark at Southwell (1m4f, AW; RPR 60) last month and is evidently in good heart.

1:54.race_name: Happy Birthday Steve Grys Novices' Handicap Hurdle

runners.name: Bells Of Ufford
runners.comment: Ran well in defeat on recent handicap debut at Chepstow and is only 1lb higher
runners.spotlight: Kept on well for second on recent handicap debut at Chepstow (2m3f, good); that race did not competitive beforehand, but it was run in a good time for the grade and this fellow is only 1lb higher; considered.

runners.name: A Good Yomp
runners.comment: Soundly beaten when dropped back to 2m for last month's handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Soundly beaten when dropped back to 2m for last month's handicap debut at Hereford (good); might be better suited by today's longer distance but others in the line-up have much more obvious claims.

runners.name: Klapton Boy
runners.comment: Placed on both hurdling starts and does not look harshly treated for this handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Placed on Irish point debut a year ago and on both hurdling starts this season, more recently when third of ten at Wetherby (2m3f, soft) in February; does not look harshly treated for this handicap debut and should be fine on the faster ground.

runners.name: Rip Wheeler
runners.comment: Safely held when fourth of seven on handicap debut at Sandown but drops in grade
runners.spotlight: Safely held when fourth of seven on handicap debut at Sandown (2m, soft) in February, but will appreciate today's ease in grade and it's possible the different trip-and-ground combination will show him in a better light.

stable_tour.quote: We haven't pushed any buttons yet but he's a winning pointer and a nice, big horse by Walk In The Park. Hopefully he's a promising chaser down the line. 29-10-24

runners.name: Indian Sunbird
runners.comment: Won over 2m7f last summer but was out of form when last seen in September
runners.spotlight: Off the mark over hurdles with clearcut success at Worcester (2m7f, good) last summer, but was out of form when last seen in September and has fitness to prove.

runners.name: Strolling Along
runners.comment: Safely held in three novice/maiden hurdles but ought to be more competitive in handicaps
runners.spotlight: Safely held in three maiden/novice hurdles (2m-2m3f) since quite promising debut in soft-ground Carlisle bumper in December, but represents a top stable and may fare better in handicaps; tongue-tie fitted.

runners.name: Jaxonne
runners.breeder: Earl Trinquet, O Trinquet & M Trinquet
runners.comment: Just 1-11 over hurdles but looked back in good nick when second at Wincanton last month
runners.spotlight: Just 1-11 over hurdles but looked back in good nick at Wincanton (2m4f, good) last month, coming from off the pace to finish second; won't be far away if in similar form.

quotes.race: Sinclair Discovery Handicap Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: Jaxonne improved for the better ground and we're glad to have finally hit the nail on the head with him. We'll have a look and see if we can go again [under a penalty], he usually comes out of his races well - AJ O'Neill, joint-trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Barleythorpe
runners.comment: Only sixth of seven on last month's handicap debut; needs to learn to settle better
runners.spotlight: Managed only sixth of seven (albeit not beaten that far) when upped to 2m4f for last month's handicap debut at Southwell (good; first-time hood); needs to learn to settle better.

runners.name: Miss Applejack
runners.comment: Hurdle winner in December and placed on recent Flat handicap debut; a possible
runners.spotlight: Made all at Southwell (2m4f, good) in December (first-time tongue-tie/cheekpieces) and returns to hurdling after good third on recent Flat handicap debut (no headgear); not very reliable but has a chance if on a going day.

runners.name: Limelight
runners.comment: Not seen over hurdles since pulled up on handicap debut in early 2024; others more likely
runners.spotlight: Not seen over hurdles since pulled up on handicap debut for Stuart Edmunds in January 2024; placed off basement Flat mark for new stable in January this year but not in same form since; not the most obvious answer.

runners.name: Lady Fortune
runners.comment: Showed no significant promise when a 250-1 outsider for three maiden hurdles
runners.spotlight: Showed no significant promise when a 250-1 outsider for three maiden hurdles in February/March (2m-2m4f); makes handicap debut.

runners.name: Casting Aspersions
runners.comment: Unseated rider in a chase on stable debut; may yet come good for Fergal O'Brien
runners.spotlight: Unseated rider in a chase on last month's stable debut and now 0-10 under all codes, but Fergal O'Brien may yet find the key to him; market reference recommended before this handicap hurdle debut.

runners.name: Saint Vic
runners.breeder: Earl De Cordelles & Mr Robert Brard
runners.comment: Belied 100-1 odds when placed at Southwell in November but not seen again since
runners.spotlight: Belied 100-1 odds when close third at Southwell (2m4f, good) in November, his third handicap, but we haven't seen him again since and some of the others have more compelling profiles.

runners.name: Jassur Des Brosses
runners.comment: Ran well here in February, after a break, but well beaten twice since; now blinkered
runners.spotlight: Returned from break with pretty good fourth here (2m3f, good to soft) in February, but was well beaten on both outings last month (3m1f/2m3f) and needs a big boost from the first-time blinkers.

runners.name: Jventile
runners.breeder: E U R L Agb Agency & S Berger
runners.comment: Fared slightly better on latest outing but needs another big step forward
runners.spotlight: Pulled up in first two handicaps (hurdle/chase); returned from break with more encouraging run last month (2m4f hurdle; first-time hood) but needs to take another big step forward.

stable_tour.quote: We'll run her back over fences again in the spring. We've hopefully got to the bottom of her issues and she can prove herself after the break. 18-12-24

runners.name: Jailbird
runners.comment: Respectable third here on handicap hurdle debut but well beaten on the Flat since
runners.spotlight: Kept on for respectable third here (2m3f, good to soft) on handicap hurdle debut in February and is effectively 2lb lower, but suffered heavy defeat on the Flat this month and is not on the shortlist today.

5:24.race_name: Happy Easter From Huntingdon Racecourse 'Junior' National Hunt Flat Race (GBB Race)

runners.name: Chatty Girl
runners.comment: Rallied gamely to win at Newbury on debut; struggled in a Listed race next time
runners.spotlight: Rallied gamely to win on debut at Newbury (soft) in December and has good claims here if judged on that performance, but it was disappointing to see her struggle in a good-ground Listed race the following month.

runners.name: Johnny Hooves
runners.comment: Half-brother to fair staying chaser Safe Destination; top yard has good bumper strike-rate
runners.spotlight: Fourth foal; half-brother to fair staying chaser Safe Destination and a French hurdle/chase winner; dam dual point winner/maiden hurdler, out of half-sister to 7f 2yo Group 3 winner Sesmen; top stable has good strike-rate in bumpers (18%); no surprise if he features on debut.

runners.name: Laurier Des Obeaux
runners.breeder: M Devilder & Earl Les Obeaux D'Anjou
runners.comment: French-bred newcomer; market support will make him of interest
runners.spotlight: 42,000euros 3yo; fifth foal; half-brother to a French 1m4f AQPS Flat winner; dam placed in French 2m1f-2m4f hurdles/chases, sister to a useful French jumper; market support will make him of interest.

runners.name: Pic N Mix
runners.comment: Out of an unraced half-sister to top-class hurdler Harchibald; rare bumper runner for yard
runners.spotlight: 14,000euros 2yo; 12th foal; half-brother to five winners including useful Irish jumper Champoleon and a bumper winner; dam unraced half-sister to useful Flat/high-class hurdle winner Harchibald; rare bumper runner for Flat-oriented stable.

runners.name: Royal Mark
runners.breeder: E A R L Haras Du Mondant & J Le Roux
runners.comment: Raced a bit too freely and showed his inexperience when sixth of eight at Wincanton
runners.spotlight: Flat-bred; raced a bit too freely and showed his inexperience when sixth of eight at Wincanton (good) last month; that run was not devoid of promise but he needs to have learned from it.

runners.name: Saint Terry
runners.comment: Has striking Flat pedigree but was sold unraced by Martin Meade
runners.spotlight: 130,000gns yearling, 70,000gns 2yo; first foal; dam 1m2f Listed winner (RPR 112), sister to Irish Derby winner Latrobe, half-sister to winners Diamond Fields (7f Group 3) and Entangling (useful 1m-1m4f); has striking Flat pedigree but was sold unraced by Martin Meade.

runners.name: Urban Isle
runners.comment: Represents a good Flat stable but showed only minor promise on his first two starts
runners.spotlight: Represents a good Flat stable but showed only minor promise on his first two starts, latterly when eighth of nine over C&D (good) in February.

runners.name: Wondering Why
runners.comment: Very promising fifth in valuable Newbury bumper last month; commands respect
runners.spotlight: From a good German Flat family and made very promising debut when fifth of 11 in valuable Newbury bumper (good ground) last month; needs to be taken very seriously.

runners.name: Amber Waves
runners.comment: Raced a bit too freely but still made quite pleasing debut when second over C&D last month
runners.spotlight: Out of a useful 1m Flat winner; raced a bit too freely but still make quite pleasing debut when second of 12 in C&D (good) fillies' race last month; one to consider.

4:19.race_name: Plymouth Motor Company Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.name: Heltenham
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late N W Lake

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late N W Lake

runners.comment: Well handicapped and could yet turn around what's been a modest season
runners.spotlight: Only 13 months ago he won off a 2lb lower mark at Newbury (2m4f, good to soft) and he could yet turn around what's been a modest season; market confidence would be welcomed, however.

quotes.race: Get Best Odds Guaranteed At BetVictor Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Heltenham won over hurdles at the start of the season and maybe had a hard race, but he definitely had a hard race at Aintree after that on bad ground. Before Kempton in February, his coat massively changed and I knew he hadn't been right. He's come into form and is pretty effective round here and we'll look at all sorts of races. Maybe Sandown and the Oaksey Chase will suit him at the end of the season, a big galloping track. If a Bravemansgame turns up in that, he isn't in his league, but there's a race at Perth for him and options at Ayr and he's in the Topham too - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: Dransfields CIU Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Heltenham was back over hurdles and it was a bit different for him. His jumping has never been his forte, back over hurdles he was knocking them but he's gone and done the job and that's the main thing - Tristan Durrell, jockey.

quotes.race: Run For Your Money At BetVictor Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Heltenham is improving all the time and hopefully keeps improving. Chasing has helped him but time more than anything. I could see him one day coming here for a Coral Gold Cup, but that might be in 2024 rather than the autumn. More immediately, he could go to Sandown on the last day of the season for a novice handicap chase, but it would have to keep raining. He wants really slow ground, it's very important to him - Dan Skelton, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: The ground hasn't been soft enough for him yet this season but we're aiming to go to Newbury with him for a two-and-a-half-mile handicap chase at Newbury on November 29. We thought he was going the right way last term and he won a £100,000 Grade 3 handicap at Newbury in the spring - more of the same will be on the agenda. 12-11-24

runners.name: Scarface

prev_owners.owner: K Leggett, Susan And John Waterworth

runners.comment: Back to form with his Newbury second and looks a safer bet than many in here
runners.spotlight: Won three handicaps at about this distance as a novice and returned to form when second at Newbury four weeks ago; the winner ran well to be third at Cheltenham this week; versatile ground-wise and looks a safer bet than many in here.

quotes.race: Bob Champion Cancer Trust Sussex Champion Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Scarface took two or three runs to really get the hang of jumping, but the last two runs he's travelled and jumped well. Today was smooth all the way, he looked the winner some way out. I always thought he'd improve for fences. He'll have to go up in grade after that. He's still a novice this year, so we'll probably take him to Sandown at the end of the season and then step him up in trip next year - Joe Trainer.

quotes.race: Betfair Serial Winners Fund Novices' Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We've gone a nice gallop and Scarface's travelled and jumped brilliantly. He's had a tendency to down tools at certain parts of the race in the past but today he was on fire. Joe said today was his Gold Cup and he was right - Brendan Powell, jockey.

quotes.race: raceshare.com Racehorse Shares From £39 Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We bought Scarface as a store so he's taken time. Tactically we went for races last season that if he won, they were nice pots, but recognised he might not and then we'd have a full season as a novice. There was no mad rush and he's a chaser, a three-mile one I think. Joe will be in charge of race planning, but we could go for better novice races. He was rated 128 and we think he's a bit better than that - he'll be better in a better race, he wants to be covered up and towed along as he's got a high-cruising speed. What doesn't suit him is small fields and leading - all what he's just done! - Richard O'Dwyer, part-owner.

stable_tour.quote: Last season was pretty good. We picked our way with him and had a lot of fun. He won the Sussex Champion Chase last season, which is a £50,000 race, and that could be an option. 07-11-24

I was thrilled he won at Plumpton last time, although they'd dropped him to a nice mark. He took a few runs to get the hang of things over fences, but - in fairness to him - got murdered everywhere he went in the race before that win. He won like he's capable of, jumping like a stag in cheekpieces. I'm hopeful he can go forward from that and there should be more to come. 18-01-24

runners.name: Galop De Chasse
runners.comment: Has the form to have a major say but last three runs have been underwhelming
runners.spotlight: Beat none other than Kandoo Kid at Newbury (2m4f, good to soft) in November 2023 and his two runs after an absence were encouraging; lesser ones have followed, though the latest was in the Kim Muir over a trip of 3m2f he would struggle to stay.

stable_tour.quote: He won well at Newbury last November but picked up a nasty wound which took a long time to heal. The horse he beat at Newbury, Kandoo Kid, franked the form and is rated 145 now. He's in good shape, should be versatile from two to two and a half miles and will be running quite soon. 23-10-24

runners.name: Mount Tempest
runners.comment: Below his best the last twice but he's got the ability to have a say off this mark
runners.spotlight: His fourth to Jagwar at Bangor (2m4f) reads well and he went in next time at Sandown (1m7f, soft); below that level the last twice but he's got the ability to have a say off this mark.

quotes.race: William Hill Epic Value Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Over two miles with a bit of cut in the ground, Mount Tempest is an improving horse. He likes to boss the race, hanging on to him is not for him at all, he wants to be in charge. Fergus Gillard gave him a super ride - Jason Fildes, northern racing manager of Highclere Thoroughbreds.

quotes.race: Best Odds On The Betfair Exchange Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Mount Tempest has obviously got plenty of ability but he's a little rascal. The other day at Wetherby we gave him a chance to get the trip and he just stayed behind. I think he'll stay two and a half miles. The trip isn't the biggest problem, just his application, but the blinkers have helped him. I hope he can give the syndicate a bit of fun. He'll probably go to the Winter Millions meeting for the novice handicap chase there - Dan Skelton, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He won twice for us last season and loves it when the mud's flying. When he gets those conditions I'm sure he'll pick up the winning thread again. Soft ground and two miles are ideal for him, and we may have to go in search of those, although we could go a little further with him if necessary. 12-11-24

runners.name: Bucksy Des Epeires
runners.comment: Until last time he had made an excellent start to chasing career; could bounce back
runners.spotlight: Won at Ascot (2m2f) on his chase debut and then an excellent second of nine in 2m3f handicap at Doncaster; has to bounce back from a poor run last time but that was two months ago; hard to dismiss.

quotes.race: CopyBet Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We were a bit concerned about the ground, but it was Bucksy Des Epeires' first run over fences and he was a little bit novicey early on. He warmed to it and I always hoped he'd be a better chaser, so it was nice to do it - especially at Ascot - Venetia Williams, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He'll go chasing this season and has been enthusiastic in his schooling. He did well as a novice over hurdles but most of ours improve for fences. He'll be out fairly soon and will be suited by races up to two and a half miles. 23-10-24

runners.name: Happy And Fine
runners.breeder: Mrs P Souverain & Mr A De Boisbrunet

prev_owners.owner: T Acott, L Cross, S Cross

runners.comment: Couldn't adopt favoured front-running tactics next time; respected off what's a good mark
runners.spotlight: Good fourth at Haydock in December (2m4f, soft; won same race the previous season) and couldn't adopt his favoured front-running tactics next time; respected off what's a good mark.

quotes.race: Betfred 'Hot Shots' Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Chasing was always going to be his game. He jumped brilliantly, especially out of that ground. Happy And Fine is going the right way - the question is whether we keep nudging our way up or go and have a pop at something - Alex Hales, trainer.

quotes.race: Summer Plate Day 22nd July 2023 Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: We liked Happy And Fine last year but he lost his way a bit as he was a bit weak. He had a really good summer. He's quite a nice horse in this grade and he wants a fence in time - Alex Hales, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's a lovely horse bought for us by Charlie Mann out of France. His first run was a very encouraging one when third to Bombs Away at Sandown in November, and I fancied him to open his account back at the Esher track earlier this month, but he ran very flat and hung. He came back lame, but he is fine now and ran a good race at Catterick on Tuesday, when third. He has a rating of 108 which is very workable, and I am keen to get a win into him as he has new owners, and it would be great for them. 30-12-21

runners.name: Equus Dancer

prev_owners.owner: Roddy Owen & The Late Paul Fullagar

runners.comment: Multiple winner down the years but impossible to know what ability he retains
runners.spotlight: Multiple winner down the years but finished last of three over fences when last seen 13 months ago and that was after a lengthy absence; impossible to know what ability he retains.

quotes.race: Your Dream Holiday With Optimum Experience Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Equus Dancer has been a good horse - he's very genuine and consistent. We were originally targeting the Topham but he didn't jump with much fluency last time and if he wasn't confident over normal fences he'd have no chance over the National ones! We'll go for a handicap hurdle at Aintree - Peter Bowen, trainer.

quotes.race: MansionBet Best Odds Guaranteed Novices' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Equus Dancer wasn't right last season, he had a lot of trouble with his feet. But he seems to have come right now. We'll have a look for something in three or four weeks and we'll see what the handicapper does but he's got a bit of experience now so he could go for something a bit better. He'll go a bit further as well - Peter Bowen, trainer.

quotes.race: Baldwinholme Standard Open National Hunt Flat Race
quotes.quote: Equus Dancer is a lovely horse. The track was too sharp for him at Catterick last time and the ground was too quick - Peter Bowen, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's a nine-time winner for us under rules and is back in training, having been off the racetrack since March 2024. He could be a nice little horse for veterans' races if he stays in one piece. He might also go for the Summer Plate at Market Rasen in July. 26-03-25

runners.name: Smarty Wild
runners.comment: Would prefer further ideally but the new cheekpieces might sharpen him up
runners.spotlight: Strike-rate of 1-17 over fences but has kept on to be third in his last two races (3m/2m4f); would prefer further ideally but the new cheekpieces might sharpen him up.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Where The Nation Plays Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: The flat track probably helps Smarty Wild. He's a big horse but he is still on the weak side and a bit babyish. He had run well twice at Ascot this season and deserved to get his head in front - Richard Johnson, jockey.

quotes.race: William Hill Cheltenham Festival £1M Golden Race Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Smarty Wild is a big, green and raw horse and it was not ideal running him again so quickly after his Exeter win last week. But he did not have a penalty for that and we had to take our chance - Philip Hobbs, trainer.

quotes.race: Follow @ggcouk On Twitter Conditional Jockeys' Training Series Handicap Hurdle (RE Initiative)
quotes.quote: There is not much for Smarty Wild next week and after that he probably needs to be out again pretty quickly before he is reassessed. He has got an entry at Taunton on Monday which would be plenty soon enough but I suspect he will take his chance now - Philip Hobbs, trainer.

quotes.race: M.G. Shopfronts Ltd. "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle
quotes.quote: It's quite a pleasant surprise that Smarty Wild has won over two miles as he is really a big three-mile chaser in the making. He has still got some growing up to do but is going the right way - Diana Hobbs, representing her father Philip.

stable_tour.quote: He's a big, strong horse with a good level of ability and might yet improve. Two and a half miles is probably his trip but three might be. 25-10-21

He won at Kempton last month over 2m4½f and went up 7lb to 137, but I don't think that would get him into the Paddy Power Plate over the same distance at Cheltenham next month. We will enter him in the race with a view to getting balloted out, which would entitle him to run in the consolation race at Kempton on the Saturday after the festival. 25-02-21

runners.name: Sheldon
runners.comment: Fell over 3m1f last time; this is probably his best trip and he's not badly handicapped
runners.spotlight: In contention when falling late on at Wincanton (3m1f) but that wasn't as deep a race as this; however, this is probably his best trip and he's not badly handicapped.

runners.name: Royal Jewel
runners.comment: Good last run given the circumstances and a likely contender with Harry Cobden booked
runners.spotlight: Free-goer who was game in victory at Chepstow (2m, heavy) two runs back and he got competitive a long way out there over 2m3f last time, so that was a good run in the circumstances; likely contender with Harry Cobden booked.

stable_tour.quote: He's another new horse to us this season who was fifth on his first start over hurdles at Exeter on Haldon Gold Cup day. That looked a good enough race and he'll improve a fair bit. 23-11-23

He won his maiden hurdle at Exeter last December and then finished second in his next two runs, once in a novice and then in a handicap. He's been off since January but is now ready to run and is entered up at Newton Abbot on Wednesday. He is probably at his best on very soft ground. 30-10-24

runners.name: Eaton Collina
runners.comment: Below best this campaign but he's back from a break and too well handicapped to ignore
runners.spotlight: Won back-to-back Wetherby handicaps over slightly shorter last season but hasn't hit the same notes this campaign; however, he's back from a break and too well handicapped to ignore.

quotes.race: Vickers.Bet Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: We can't get too carried away as the race fell apart behind him but I'm delighted for Mrs Watson, who is one of our longest standing supporters. Even though Eaton Collina won like he has, I don't think we'll get him out quickly as he runs up light after his races - Kerry Lee, trainer.

3:09.race_name: Trojan Motor Company And Instant Justice Handicap Chase

runners.name: Time To Bite
runners.comment: C&D winner; bids for a hat-trick but latest success came in a messy contest; vulnerable
runners.spotlight: C&D winner who bids for a hat-trick after wins on good ground at Exeter (2m3f) and Taunton (2m7f) last month (has won twice on soft); latest success came at the expense of two other finishers in a messy contest, though, and another 3lb rise may leave him vulnerable.

runners.name: Begin The Luck
runners.comment: C&D winner who is 1lb lower than when successful over hurdles at Stratford in October
runners.spotlight: Four wins for another yard in the middle of 2023 including one over C&D, but only success in 16 starts for this yard came over hurdles at Stratford (2m3f, heavy) in October; now 1lb lower, though, so a case can be made.

runners.name: Lady Pretender
runners.comment: 0-14 under rules; twice placed over 2m in December but last two efforts have been poor
runners.spotlight: 0-14 under rules but looked to have races in her when twice placed over 2m on good to soft/soft at Wincanton and Leicester in December; last two efforts over 2m2f/2m4f have been poor, though, and she has plenty to prove all of a sudden.

runners.name: Kadex
runners.breeder: Mme Jocelyne Ventrou & Mr Guy Cherel

prev_owners.owner: The Sanguiners, Mrs G Redman & B Painter

runners.comment: 15lb below last winning mark but has failed to complete in eight of his last nine starts
runners.spotlight: 15lb lower than when beating three rivals at Pumpton (3m2f, good to soft) in October 2023 when trained by Lucy Wadham, but has failed to complete in eight of his last nine starts; may have won had he not fallen heavily two out back there 16 days ago so he retains ability, but very risky.

runners.name: Tribesmans Glory
runners.comment: 2lb above last winning mark; ran well when third at Chepstow last month; could play a part
runners.spotlight: Getting towards the veteran stage, but only 2lb higher than when winning at Warwick (2m4f, good) last May and last month's third of eight at Chepstow (2m3f, good) showed that the ability remains; could play a part if repeating that performance.

runners.name: Universal Secret
runners.comment: Has shown ability over fences, but still has to prove that he wants this far
runners.spotlight: Dual hurdle winner who has shown ability over fences and had an excuse last time; still to prove that he wants this far, though.

quotes.race: JenningsBet Devizes 'National Hunt' Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Universal Secret is a big baby. He's growing all the time and is a chaser, but we knew he'd win a hurdle race. We won't do anything fancy but he'll go chasing next season - Helen Nelmes, trainer.

runners.name: Poets Reflection

prev_owners.owner: Exors D Cocks & S Livesey-Van Dorst
D Cocks & Mrs S Livesey-Van Dorst

runners.comment: 1-27 under rules; 1lb wrong and some way down the list
runners.spotlight: 1-27 under rules and was returning from 340 days off when pulled up at Taunton (2m, good) last month; 1lb wrong and some way down the list.

runners.name: Pooroldmackley
runners.comment: 0-7 under rules, but may find the return to this intermediate trip more suitable
runners.spotlight: 0-7 under rules; 2lb wrong but may find the return to this intermediate trip more suitable having found 3m too far on his final start over hurdles and 2m too sharp when a remote third of five on chase debut; a better performance wouldn't surprise.

runners.name: Master Mikey Dee
runners.comment: Hasn't built on his successful chase debut over three years ago; 7lb out of the weights
runners.spotlight: Hasn't built on his successful chase debut over three years ago and hasn't shown enough in four starts since returning from a mammoth absence in December to suggest he will be winning soon (visor made no difference last time); 7lb out of the weights.

runners.name: Kruger Park
runners.comment: Not up to big rise in weights for 2m4f win last March; pulled up latest; trip query
runners.spotlight: Took a hiding at the weights for Newbury win (2m4f, heavy) last March; he's run to a similar level in defeat twice since but was pulled up at Fontwell in February and 3m2f may be further than he wants to go.

quotes.race: Howden Supporting West Berkshire Mencap Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: The ground didn't worry Kruger Park much as he's a Kapgarde who stays forever. He's beginning to learn at long last. He'll be a chaser next season and a lovely one, but he's taken a long time to come right. He ran off the course at Taunton last season and has been a real baby, but today is the best he's behaved and he travelled and jumped well, while Freddie gave him a super ride. He wasn't easy to break in and is a typical Kapgarde - they take forever. He was a boy and wasn't straightforward last year, but he's got there now - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

runners.name: Rickety Bridge
runners.comment: Suited by soft ground; below best on good latest but has his conditions again
runners.spotlight: Suited by soft, as for 2m4f maiden win at Southwell last March and when staying on well to be a close second at Chepstow (2m7f) in February; failed to reproduce it on good ground since but these conditions are more up his street; yard also runs Kruger Park.

stable_tour.quote: As he's a novice over hurdles until December 1 we were keen to get him out fairly early, but he was disappointing on his first run at Ludlow last month. He probably just needed the run but didn't jump as fluently as he can. He's been put on a mark of 117, which is tough; if you ask me, it should be nearer 107. He probably wants to go left-handed on soft ground and shapes as if three miles will be within his compass. 04-11-24

runners.name: Christopher Wood
runners.comment: Smart in his prime but in poor form over fences; first hurdle run for 3 years
runners.spotlight: Smart hurdler and useful chaser in his prime but on a losing wicket over fences for a long time; perhaps he'll be all the better for a return to hurdles, for the first time in three years, but that's up in the air.

quotes.race: bet365 Scottish County Hurdle (A Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Christopher Wood was good because you wondered turning in whether the runner-up had gotten away from him. This place suits him well as he travels nicely and is a slick jumper. He seems to like this type of ground and for a handicapper he's quite consistent. We'll go now for the Morebattle at Kelso on March 6 - Harry Derham, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Thoroughbred Marketing Juvenile Hurdle (Novices' Championship Hurdle Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: The likelihood is Christopher Wood will go to Aintree. He did it really well and improved fitness-wise from Fontwell as we expected him to. He's getting better and better and the key thing is he loves jumping. He attacks his hurdles and has taken to it naturally. Harry said he did that quite comfortably and Aintree, a flat track where they'd go a good gallop, should suit. He's not won two of the best contests in the world, but Harry says he's won them with any amount in hand and deserves his chance in a better race - Harry Derham, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Ivor Laws Memorial Handicap
quotes.quote: I was told not to be in front too soon but I was! So I had to really make his mind up, but Christopher Wood won easy enough and loves that ground - Jim Crowley, jockey.

quotes.race: Whitsbury Manor Stud ebfstallions.com Blagrave Maiden Stakes (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: I have like Christopher Wood since the moment he walked into the yard and we thought he would like this ground with a bit of cut in it. He is a horse for the future and a mile and a quarter will suit him next year - Ralph Beckett, trainer

stable_tour.quote: What appeared to be a golden opportunity in a beginners' chase at Lingfield in January was sadly lost to the weather, which was gutting. We dropped him back to two miles at the start of last season but he was a running-on sixth in the Chester Plate over two and a quarter on the Flat in May, so there aren't any concerns over his stamina and we'll have that in mind this season. He's starting on the right kind of handicap mark over fences, 26-10-23

runners.name: Rockadenn
runners.comment: Acts on soft; creditable first 3m run latest; needs more for this greater test
runners.spotlight: Acts well on soft; formerly useful at up to about 2m5f but it's been a long road back and although he seemed to stay the new 3m trip at Southwell (good) last month, this greater test asks for more.

quotes.race: Dorset & Somerset Air Ambulance Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I didn't know what to expect from Rockadenn as he ran out the other week. He had a wind op just before Christmas as he couldn't breathe at all. We didn't know what to expect as he jumped free and ran off the other day. He's a bit of a lad but he's clearly got ability to do that. I'm really surprised by it and I thought the other horse would get tired. He's not entered at Cheltenham but there's a nice handicap we might go to on Midlands National day and something like that could be realistic. He could mix and match chasing too - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We acquired him from Paul Nicholls' yard last spring and he's pretty useful. He was a very good second in a handicap hurdle at Haydock over 2m3f in December before we raised him significantly in class for a Grade 2 back there last month. He revels in getting his toe in and is as versatile over fences as he is over hurdles, so we'll be scanning the French programme book to find some suitable races for him this spring, as the prize-money there is so good. The key for him is very soft ground. 21-02-22

runners.name: Moonset
runners.comment: Stayed on for close 2nd in 2m7f maiden, then won over 2m4f; handicap debutant; improve
runners.spotlight: Not an obvious stayer on pedigree but he kept on well when losing out late in 2m7f maiden at Worcester (good) in September before getting off the mark at Market Rasen (2m4f, good to soft; narrowly) last month; acts on soft; potential improver now handicapping.

stable_tour.quote: He's a nice horse for the future. He ran in a couple of Irish point-to-points and only narrowly missed out on winning his bumper at Uttoxeter in November, when he ran really well. He'll go hurdling after May. He just needed a bit of time to strengthen up and we think he can make a nice novice hurdler. 06-03-24

runners.name: Striking A Pose
runners.owner: S Clare G Kennington C Knowles & J Reed

prev_owners.owner: I & C Gosden, M Sharp & G Kennington

runners.comment: Latest win over 2m7f last February; down weights but still having a slow season
runners.spotlight: Suited by Exeter and the most recent of four wins there came over 2m7f on heavy last February; he wasn't too far away there in November but hasn't looked like adding to his tally since, the last twice in blinkers.

quotes.race: Kenn Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Striking A Pose is rated 130 so he was supposed to win like that. He's a nice chap and a gorgeous-looking horse and it was nice to watch all the way round - his ears were pricked and he didn't put a foot wrong. I think 2m4f is perfect, he's got a bit of class about him so he's not short of speed. I'm sure he'll end up over 3m but this trip is fine on genuine soft ground. I don't think we'll step him up to three this season. We've got some options now, he's qualified for the EBF Final at Sandown in a couple of weeks. He's probably not an Albert Bartlett horse but he might be competitive at Sandown, or he could go to Aintree. I expect we'll lean to Sandown. He'll be a lovely chaser for next season - Joe Tizzard, assistant to trainer Colin Tizzard.

quotes.race: Racing TV Profits Returned To Racing "National Hunt" Novices' Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Striking A Pose has learnt his job over two miles and the form from Ascot looked quite nice. He's a point-to-point winner so stepping him up in trip worked a treat. He's a gorgeous-looking four-year-old and is a nice horse who's at the right end of the handicap who we hope will continue progressing through the ranks. He'll go over fences next season and he won't run again until the new year. - Joe Tizzard, assistant trainer

stable_tour.quote: He just seems to love it at Exeter. We could back over fences soon but he was third the other day and that was a good run, so we'll probably pick and choose with him. The handicapper has had his say with him though. 07-11-24

runners.name: Coconut Twist
runners.comment: Has won on soft; best form for recent wins at 2m7f (good to firm) and 3m2f (good)
runners.spotlight: Has won on soft but two recent wins, at Exeter (2m7f) and here (3m2f), have been on good to firm and good, the latest when too good for one on a hat-trick; he won well enough there to think he can manage a 7lb rise but the switch back to soft ground gives pause.

quotes.race: Racing Partnership Novices' Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: He was always very immature, very green so Coconut Twist went down to Chris Barber's and won a point-to-point. He came back from that a mess and so it's taken until now to get him back right. Harry (Reed)'s done a lot with him at home - Daisy Hitchins, trainer, speaking to Sky Racing.

runners.name: Copshill Lad
runners.comment: Winning yard debut on soft; back to form latest (2m7f, good); needs more
runners.spotlight: Winning yard debut at Stratford (2m6f, soft) in October but that's as good as it's got, despite a return to form when third at Uttoxeter (2m7f, good) in March; looks to have more to do here.

stable_tour.quote: He runs in the famous colours of Middleham Park Racing and made a winning debut when landing a Stratford bumper in May. We have tinkered with his wind over the summer, and he is now back in full work. He should be ready to resume next month with a view to tackling National Hunt novice hurdles. 13-10-22

runners.name: Despereaux
runners.comment: Won twice over 3m in December; not on his game latest; query about soft ground
runners.spotlight: Improved for 3m and cheekpieces when winning two in a row, at Ludlow and Taunton (good to soft and good) in December, but he wasn't on his game at Plumpton recently and soft ground might not be helpful.

stable_tour.quote: He's brilliantly named as Despereaux is a speedy little mouse and this horse is not very big to say the least. But what he lacks in size he makes up for in heart and effort. After running out on his debut in October, he won his first completed start at Huntingdon in November. I then ran him in the Chatteris Fen at Huntingdon, where he would have been second but for jumping the last a bit long and then veering right. The runner-up won afterwards, making the form look very decent, and it was no surprise when Despereaux won again in a junior hurdle at Taunton on Monday. Due to his size, he looks more of a hurdler than a chaser and is clearly above average. 15-03-23

runners.name: Barricane
runners.comment: Quiet until back to form in first-time blinkers (3m2f, soft); needs blinkers to work again
runners.spotlight: He hasn't had masses of racing in the last four years and was rather quiet back from the latest layoff until successful in first-time blinkers at Warwick (3m2f, soft) in February; a 4lb rise shouldn't be a problem on past form but the blinkers need to work a second time.

quotes.race: Urban Logistics Reit Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Barricane lost so much ground at the start and was so far behind that I'd given up on the second circuit and started looking at tomorrow's racing on my phone.
