Then at the cross flight I though he might be fourth and he just came from nowhere at the last. It has to be one of the rides of the season to win and this is the second time that Lewis has won on the horse - Olly Murphy, trainer.

quotes.race: Follow At The Races On Twitter Novices' Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Barricane's last run was a step in the right direction and he has improved again today. He'll appreciate going over fences down the line and goes on most ground. Aidan Coleman, jockey.

runners.name: Thankyouandplease
runners.breeder: Sarl Igep Haras Du Chateau De Rabodanges
runners.comment: Has shown just enough to believe he could pay his way in low-grade handicaps
runners.spotlight: Modest point form and a similar tale so far over hurdles, though has shown just enough to believe he could pay his way in low-grade handicaps.

runners.name: Dexter

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late C J Leech

runners.comment: Questionable what he's achieved in two small-field chases following a long absence
runners.spotlight: Won all sorts in France but without a win of any type since 2021; questionable what he's achieved in two small-field chases following a long absence but he didn't run too badly.

runners.name: John Betjeman

prev_owners.owner: Robin Gillard, Rory Gillard, Tim Seegar

runners.comment: Tries a visor but his overall strike-rate of 3-74 is forever offputting
runners.spotlight: Behind Opticality on his penultimate start (blinkered) and then ran just okay at Plumpton (no headgear); tries a visor but his overall strike-rate of 3-74 is forever offputting.

runners.name: Holy Legend
runners.comment: Remote 4th on handicap debut but was only 5-1 and presumably thought capable of better
runners.spotlight: His thirds at Uttoxeter were quite remote, as was his fourth when only 5-1 for his handicap debut there in November (on soft); presumably thought capable of a bit better.

runners.name: Clear Storm
runners.comment: Third on handicap debut in January and has moved yards; has to be of interest
runners.spotlight: 1m2f winner for William Haggas; only had four races over hurdles and was a rallying third on handicap debut at Taunton (2m, soft; first-time cheekpieces over hurdles); looks capable of winning races for new trainer Neil Mulholland.

runners.name: Organic
runners.comment: Won three on the Flat for George Boughey; essentially disappointing over hurdles
runners.spotlight: Won three on the Flat for George Boughey from 7f to 1m2f; essentially disappointing over hurdles, including handicap debut latest when 33-1; now goes in cheekpieces.

runners.name: Greystoke
runners.breeder: G Hedley & Mike Channon Bloodstock Ltd
runners.comment: Yet to reach the frame on seven starts for this stable, trying fences the last time
runners.spotlight: Consistent and capable under both codes when with Alan King; has yet to reach the frame on seven starts for this stable, trying fences the last time; has a lot to prove right now.

quotes.race: White Oak Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: Greystoke had been in good form on the AW and he was going to go hurdling, but I couldn't find the right race for him so he came here. I was worried about the rain and I'd have been more confident on good ground - Alan King, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We bought him from Mick Channon and I've been delighted with him since he arrived. His work and his schooling have been good. He's ready to start over hurdles as soon as we get a drop of rain. 19-10-21

We bought him from Mick Channon and I've been delighted with him since he arrived. His work and his schooling have been good. He's ready to start over hurdles and I plan to run him at Warwick on Friday. 03-11-21

runners.name: Opticality
runners.comment: Running well on the Flat before her 4l fourth in a Taunton handicap last month
runners.spotlight: Running well on the Flat before her 4l fourth in a Taunton handicap last month (good); handles softer ground; respected.

runners.name: For You Buzz
runners.comment: Tailed off and pulled up in his two handicaps; unexposed on soft ground
runners.spotlight: Tailed off and pulled up in his two handicaps; unexposed on soft ground and could yet raise his game.

runners.name: Mind Hunter
runners.breeder: Saleh Al Homaizi & Imad Al Sagar
runners.comment: Returned in October from a long absence and has struggled on his four starts since
runners.spotlight: Returned in October from a long absence and has struggled on his four starts since, three over hurdles.

1:59.race_name: Welcome To Easter Raceday "National Hunt" Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.name: Devon Blue
runners.comment: Well beaten at triple-digit odds on first two hurdling attempts (2m3f/2m)
runners.spotlight: Well beaten at triple-digit odds on first two hurdling attempts (2m3f/2m); can't be recommended.

runners.name: Gorcombe And Wise
runners.comment: Has struggled at huge odds in two hurdle runs (2m, soft/heavy) this year; readily opposed
runners.spotlight: Has struggled at huge odds in two hurdle runs (2m, soft/heavy) this year; readily opposed.

runners.name: Lantic Bay
runners.comment: An 8yo who was tailed off in a Worcester maiden on belated debut in June 2023 (50-1)
runners.spotlight: An 8yo who was tailed off in a Worcester maiden on belated debut in June 2023 (50-1).

runners.name: Lokis Mischief
runners.comment: Walk On High has superior form but he looks good for at least place honours
runners.spotlight: Twice runner-up (bumper/novice) and didn't run too badly when favourite for handicap debut last time (2m4f, good to soft); Walk On High has superior form but he looks good for at least place honours.

runners.name: Southfield Finale
runners.comment: From a fine jumping family and positives to take from his run in an Exeter bumper
runners.spotlight: From a fine jumping family and positives to take from his run in an Exeter bumper that was won by a useful horse; improvement on the cards.

runners.name: Walk On High
runners.comment: Has the best form claims and the return of a hood could be significant (keen last time)
runners.spotlight: 0-8 over hurdles but his second in a Taunton handicap (2m, soft) reads extremely well in today's company and he was a bit too free when turned over at short odds in a maiden at Fontwell; has the best form claims and the return of a hood could be significant.

runners.name: Barford Groover
runners.comment: Third on stable debut but was beaten 15l and needs to step up on that form
runners.spotlight: Went close in a Bangor bumper when in a different yard; finished a 15l third on debut for this one at Wincanton (1m7f maiden on good) and will need to step up on that form.

runners.name: Chique Angel
runners.comment: Bumper promise but beaten 28l and 42l in her two runs over hurdles
runners.spotlight: Back from a long absence to run well in a Plumpton bumper (good to soft) but beaten 28l and 42l in her two runs over hurdles, at 2m5f and 2m; could yet turn a corner for her top yard but reservations for now.

runners.name: Daisy Me Rollin
runners.comment: No worthwhile form and was 150-1 when tailed off on her hurdling debut
runners.spotlight: No worthwhile form and was 150-1 when tailed off on her hurdling debut.

runners.name: Neon Madonna
runners.comment: Bryan Carver has jumped ship to her stablemate who has much better form
runners.spotlight: Beaten about 20l in her first bumper at Wincanton and probably ran to a similar level at Ascot; could improve for hurdles but Bryan Carver has jumped ship to her stablemate who has much better form.

runners.name: Sea Thrift
runners.comment: Shaped with some promise in her first Irish point but was pulled up in the second
runners.spotlight: Shaped with some promise in her first Irish point but was pulled up in the second.

runners.name: Field Of Aces
runners.comment: Inexperience was evident when a tailed-off last in his only bumper run (16-1)
runners.spotlight: Inexperience was evident when a tailed-off last in his only bumper run (16-1); he may be better than that.

runners.name: Colonel Whizz
runners.comment: Placed in a bumper and three times over hurdles; this trip may be ideal; cheekpieces on
runners.spotlight: Placed in a bumper and in three of his six starts over hurdles; should be all the better for his return from a year off when a remote fourth of seven finishers at Taunton (2m3f, heavy) in February and this trip may prove ideal; respected in first-time cheekpieces.

runners.name: Carved In Stone
runners.comment: Disappointing over hurdles including in both handicaps since joining this yard; visor on
runners.spotlight: Doncaster bumper winner for Hugo Palmer at the end of 2023, but disappointing over hurdles including in both handicaps since joining this yard; switch to a visor will need to make a big difference.

runners.name: Military Tycoon
runners.comment: Won at Fontwell last month and the form has been boosted; up 7lb but still a major player
runners.spotlight: 1m6f soft-ground Flat winner on his final start for Hugo Palmer and justifed market support when making it tenth-time lucky for this yard over hurdles at Fontwell (2m6f, good) last month (second and sixth won next time); up 7lb but still a major player.

runners.name: Goddess Afrana
runners.comment: Has shown some ability in bumpers/hurdles, but has been off three months; cheekpieces on
runners.spotlight: Has shown some ability in bumpers and over hurdles, such as when sixth of 13 finishers on handicap debut at Warwick (2m3f, good to soft) in January; 2lb lower and cheekpieces are given a go over this longer trip, but she has a three-month absence to overcome.

runners.name: Outside Adesa
runners.comment: Won a maiden point last month, but not quite sure what to expect back over hurdles
runners.spotlight: Regressed under rules after hinting at early promise, but managed to win a maiden point last month; back over hurdles today; market may guide.

runners.name: Dgesteevo
runners.comment: Has shown little in bumpers/hurdles so far; steps up again in trip; look elsewhere
runners.spotlight: Has shown little in bumpers/hurdles so far and was already on the retreat when unseating at Taunton (2m3f, heavy) last time (Colonel Whizz fourth); steps up again in trip; look elsewhere.

runners.name: Broomfield Gale
runners.comment: 0-16 under rules; has refused to race and been pulled up in her last two starts
runners.spotlight: 0-16 under rules; made an encouraging stable debut when third of ten at Ludlow (2m5f, good to soft) in November, but has gone backwards since, refusing to race and pulling up in her last two starts; wind surgery since last seen will need to have made big a difference.

runners.name: Mach Ten
runners.comment: 0-13 but ran with credit when twice making the frame last month; tongue-tie on
runners.spotlight: 0-13 under rules but ran with credit when in the frame off this mark on good ground at Taunton (2m3f) and Wincanton (2m4f; first-time visor) last month; wouldn't need to find much more in order to figure with a tongue-tie added.

runners.name: Oval Street
runners.comment: 3-11 in points but 0-10 under rules; makes debut for new trainer after nine months off
runners.spotlight: Three-time winning pointer but 0-10 under rules, albeit placed in three of his five starts over hurdles including over C&D; something to prove starting out for another new trainer (same owner) after nine months off.

runners.name: Manala
runners.breeder: J C Haimet &  J P Liberge
runners.comment: Hasn't shown much over hurdles for this yard; improvement needed on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Just beaten in a bumper here for Nicky Henderson in May 2023, but was then off for 617 days; hasn't shown much over hurdles for this yard since returning and achieved little when last of three behind a 1-16 shot at Taunton (2m3f, heavy) in February; improvement needed up again in trip on handicap debut.

stable_tour.quote: Another with loads of talent, she's attractive and was second when getting the hang of things in her bumper, but a pelvis injury will hold her up. I'd love to see that fixed fairly sharply so she can start over hurdles. 30-10-23

runners.name: Bredon Hill Dart
runners.owner: R W And Mrs Mitchell, D V Gardner
runners.comment: Well held in three starts since returning in December; best watched up again in trip
runners.spotlight: 0-9 under rules; showed some ability in bumpers/hurdles at Exeter early last year, but well held in three starts since returning in December (cheekpieces made no difference last time); best watched up again in trip.

runners.name: El Bandido Pancho
runners.comment: 0-7 under rules but has shown ability as when second at Ffos Las last time; shortlisted
runners.spotlight: 0-7 under rules but has shown ability, falling two out when in with every chance on handicap debut at Lingfield (2m3f, soft) in November and finishing well clear of the rest when second of eight at Ffos Las (2m4f, heavy) in February; up 3lb but still one for the shortlist.

stable_tour.quote: He got himself well handicapped last year as we couldn't keep him healthy. His owners have been very patient. He fell on his handicap debut at Lingfield when he would have won. Then we went chasing and he acted like he'd never seen a fence in his life. He was second back over hurdles last time and ran very well as he was beaten by a battle-hardened handicapper and was an immature baby in comparison. He'll definitely mature over the next few years. We'll look back at some stage and laugh at his current rating. He's a lot better than that but it might take time for us to get there. I think he'll want 3m over fences in time but we'll stick to 2m4f over hurdles for now with a bit of dig in the ground. 12-03-25

runners.name: Atlantic Power
runners.comment: 0-6 under rules; third at Fontwell on penultimate start, but still more needed
runners.spotlight: 0-6 under rules; best effort when third of eight on handicap debut at Fontwell (2m6f, soft) on his penultimate start, but still finished 18l behind the winner; more needed.

runners.name: Felton Bellevue
runners.owner: Mrs H Munn, R E Good, B Case
runners.comment: May have had excuses for two defeats since winning in good style at Lingfield; respected
runners.spotlight: Four wins over fences, the latest a comfortable success at Lingfield (2m7f, soft) in February; twice held since, but the race may have come too soon at Ludlow a week later while 3m7f appeared to stretch him at Chepstow last time; respected.

quotes.race: Sri Lanka, The Wonder Of Asia Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: I couldn't believe the price difference between Felton Bellevue and Twilight Glory because they've run against each other quite regularly. He didn't run badly at Sedgefield the other day. I expected them to go a gallop there, but it just turned into a bit of a sprint - Ben Case, trainer.

runners.name: Puddlesinthepark
runners.comment: 1-17 over fences; ran creditably in both completed starts since the win; shortlisted
runners.spotlight: 1-17 over fences, the win coming in returning cheekpieces at Hereford (3m1f, good to soft) in February; has run with credit in both completed starts since and one for the shortlist.

runners.name: Lightonthewing
runners.comment: C&D winner; scored at 33-1 over hurdles in February, but well beaten in both starts since
runners.spotlight: Three wins over fences last spring on ground ranging from good to heavy, the latest over C&D; made all when causing a 33-1 surprise over hurdles at Chepstow (3m, soft) in February, but well beaten in both starts since and not quite sure what to expect.

runners.name: Jikala
runners.breeder: Ecurie Biraben, D Biraben & A Biraben
runners.comment: Ordinary form in five starts over fences since returning in December; more needed
runners.spotlight: Sole success came over hurdles at Hereford (2m, good to soft) in March 2023; absent for almost 20 months after April of that year and has only shown ordinary form in five starts over fences since returning in December; more needed.

runners.name: Williamdeconqueror
runners.breeder: Mrs C M Dickin & Mr & Mrs Cooper

prev_owners.owner: Mrs M A Cooper & Mrs C M Dickin

runners.comment: Placed five times from higher marks over fences, but is 0-17 under rules; enough to prove
runners.spotlight: Placed five times from higher marks in ten starts over fences, but is 0-17 under rules and has been well beaten the last twice including over hurdles; reverts to just cheekpieces, but he has enough to prove.

runners.name: Firefly Lane
runners.comment: Sole success came here last September; she's now 1lb lower but has stamina to prove
runners.spotlight: Sole success in 19 starts under rules came here (2m5f, soft) last September and she is now 1lb lower; ran with credit when third of six at Taunton (2m7f, good to firm) ten days ago, but she still has stamina to prove over this far.

runners.name: Janeslittlevoice
runners.comment: C&D winner who was pulled up on last month's return from a long absence; needs to step up
runners.spotlight: Won twice in the autumn of 2023 including over C&D, but was off for 518 days before pulling up on her Chepstow return (3m, good) last month (Puddlesinthepark third); 1lb below her last winning mark, but she needs to step up.

runners.name: Elpologreg
runners.breeder: E A R L Haras De Lonray
runners.comment: 1-19 but placed in his last three starts; 4lb wrong, but still more appealing than a few
runners.spotlight: 1-19 with his win coming at Fakenham (2m, soft) early last year; placed in his last three starts at Fontwell including when second of seven over a similar trip to this (good) last month; 4lb out of the weights, but still more appealing than a few.

quotes.race: Payne Crop Nutrition Ltd Novices' Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: We thought going out on to the last circuit that Elpologreg would get there as the others went off too fast, but that has to be the ride of the season - Seamus Mullins, trainer.

5:55.race_name: Race And Rest - Wolverhampton Holiday Inn Novice Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.name: Jolly Roger
runners.comment: Ready winner at Kempton in December and holds an entry in the 2,000 Guineas
runners.spotlight: Promising third on 6f turf debut before easily justifying short-priced favouritism over 7f on AW at Kempton; that bare form is nothing to get carried away with but a 2,000 Guineas entry suggests this Dark Angel colt is well regarded.

runners.name: Red Sand
runners.comment: Off since ready Goodwood success last May but still potentially useful
runners.spotlight: Made a good start to his career on turf last May, finishing second over 5f at Bath before readily seeing off nine rivals at Goodwood (6f); his length of absence is a bit of a concern but he looked a useful prospect.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Red Sand was angelic in the prelims and I loved how straight and true he was. I didn't have company from a long way out but he never felt like being beaten. I loved the way he hit the line and he galloped out really well. He's a classy animal. He travelled well over five at Bath last time and I think the team expected him to be a little green that day. He's a proper professional and the response was immediate when I pressed the button. I don't see why he couldn't [be a Royal Ascot horse]. A stiff six furlongs would suit him there - Saffie Osborne, jockey.

runners.name: Warrior Mode
runners.comment: Should have more to come on the back of C&D debut win last month
runners.spotlight: Justified market support on C&D debut last month; more will be needed under a penalty in this stronger-looking race but surprise if he isn't capable of better.

runners.name: Arundel
runners.comment: Form of last month's 1m Southwell race modest and vulnerable is this much stronger race
runners.spotlight: Very green on debut in December; gelded after and showed ability when third at Southwell (1m) but that was in a restricted maiden and this looks a significantly stronger contest.

runners.name: Bowfell
runners.comment: Bred to have a future but he'll need to be very useful to make a winning start here
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to winners Bowland Park (7f-1m2f including 2yo/France; RPR 93), Distinct Spirit (7f; 81) and Twenty Years On (1m4f; 70); dam 6f 2yo winner (including Group 3; 104); bred to have a future but he'll need to be very useful to make a winning start here.

runners.name: Kentucky River
runners.comment: Promise over 1m2f/1m3f at end of 2024 but best watched over much shorter on return
runners.spotlight: Showed fair form over 1m2f and 1m3f on AW at the end of 2024; subsequently gelded; might be best watched reappearing over a much shorter trip

runners.name: Kilima
runners.comment: With an excellent yard so a betting check required on debut
runners.spotlight: Pinatubo half-brother to three winners, notably Banzari (1m-1m3f including 2yo/Group 3; RPR 110); makes his debut in a decent race but in excellent hands and needs a betting check.

runners.name: Reds And Wolves
runners.comment: Well-held fifth on C&D debut 12 days ago; needs to have come on a lot
runners.spotlight: 11-1 and tongue tied, missed the break and never involved when 10l fifth of 11 on C&D debut 12 days ago; needs to have come on a lot in a short time.

runners.name: Skibo
runners.comment: Promise over 7f/1m on turf last year; has been gelded; almost certainly has more to offer
runners.spotlight: Out of an unraced half-sister to his yard's 6f/7f Group 1 winner Kinross; promising third in maidens at Newmarket (7f) and Goodwood (1m) last August; a bit keen at the latter venue and reverts to 7f on return with the hood he wore on debut back in place; has been gelded; almost certainly capable of better this year.

runners.name: Wave Rider
runners.comment: Showed when reaching frame twice on turf as a juvenile; more to come in 2025
runners.spotlight: Fourth to subsequent Group 2 winner Bay City Roller on 7f fast-ground Sandown debut last summer; couldn't improve on that form when a beaten favourite at Yarmouth (7f again) on a softer surface 11 weeks later but it was no bad run and he remains open to improvement.

runners.name: Zero Zero
runners.comment: More one for the longer term judged on last month's 7f Kempton debut
runners.spotlight: More one for the longer term judged on last month's 7f Kempton debut.

runners.name: Skyler
runners.comment: Sold cheaply from James Tate since never invovled on 6f debut last month
runners.spotlight: Never a threat when sixth of seven 6f course debut in March and sold out of James Tate's yard for only 2,200gns this month.

6:30.race_name: Download The At The Races App Handicap

runners.name: Gincident
runners.comment: Justified favouritism on recent stable debut (7f, good to firm); still well treated; solid
runners.spotlight: Had a BHA rating in the high 80s in his pomp for Richard Fahey; justified strong favouritism in determined style at Leicester on his stable debut a fortnight ago (7f, good to firm); remains well treated up 3lb and a tongue-tie now goes on.

runners.name: Novak
runners.comment: He's been in good form all winter and latest Southwell second was up with his recent best
runners.spotlight: Eight wins and 21 placed efforts from his 64 starts; ran up to his recent best when second to the well-backed favourite at Southwell last month; capable of another prominent showing.

runners.name: Hows The Guvnor
runners.comment: Drops in trip/class but needs to leave stable debut well behind him
runners.spotlight: Turf winner (6f, good) for Clive Cox as a 2yo; ended his time with that yard with a good fourth at Newbury last summer; raced freely when disappointing on stable debut (8.6f) last month; drops in trip and class but there are risks attached.

runners.name: Double Time
runners.comment: Absence to overcome on stable debut but he returns on a dangerous mark; check betting
runners.spotlight: Won four times for Sir Mark Todd, the latest coming on turf last summer off a 7lb higher mark; ended 2024 quietly but on slow ground; worth a market check at this level.

runners.name: Ultramarine
runners.comment: Conditions to suit and he's slipped to a handy mark; each-way claims
runners.spotlight: Two of his five AW wins have come over C&D; on a dangerous mark again now and returning to 7f won't be an issue; each-way claims.

stable_tour.quote: Is showing us plenty of pace and will probably run later this month 19-04-21

We bought him out of Joseph O'Brien's stable having shown some decent form in Ireland. He's had one run for us at Newcastle this month when third to a useful runner of Roger Varian's and has come out of it very well. He could be a very smart horse. 23-09-22

runners.name: Perennial
runners.comment: Dropping down the weights but he hasn't found his best for new yard this year
runners.spotlight: Yet to find his best for Stuart Williams; he's dropped 11lb since debuting for the yard in December but there are risks attached.

runners.name: Enthused
runners.comment: Quiet this year and 7f looks too sharp; stable have more obvious claims with Gincident
runners.spotlight: Quiet this year and 7f looks too sharp; stable have more obvious claims with Gincident.

quotes.race: Friends & Family Remembering Norman Sharpe Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: I thought the ground would be on the soft side for Enthused as he likes it rattling but fair play to him and he only ran on the Flat a week ago. Alex Chadwick, jockey, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Welcome Back To Ludlow Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: It's amazing, you can't top it. I had Enthused in my hands the whole way and his jumping is perfect. He doesn't get much height but he's very quick and he took me to the front and off we went - Jamie Gambin, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Visit racingtv.com Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Enthused ran well at Fakenham but got trapped on the inside when they had taken the last hurdle out and he was unlucky. He was given a great ride from Alex Chadwick and will run next at Fakenham's final meeting of the year next month - James Owen, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's owned by good friends of mine, the butcher Michael Clarke and the farmer George Wright, and he's a lovely little horse who cost me£5,500 this time last year. He's run 17 times since then, won five times and earned just under£45,000. He's ultra-consistent but very ground-dependent; he needs top of the ground. We probably shouldn't have run him at Cheltenham last time when the rain came. He had a history of breaking blood vessels but I hope we've sorted that out we turn the horses out a lot and he's gained confidence. He's having a break and will be back in the spring. Two miles is his trip. 06-12-23

runners.name: Harbour Vision
runners.comment: Conditions to suit but his recent efforts need bettering
runners.spotlight: Two C&D wins last November and he was a good second here in February; quiet since though and others look stronger.

quotes.race: Stay Safe Players With BetMGM Handicap
quotes.quote: Harbour Vision knows his way round here better than all of us! He jumped well enough but there was plenty of pace and he really settled for me. The gap opened up on the inside and he was away - Taryn Langley, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

7:00.race_name: Sky Sports Racing Sky 415 Fillies' Handicap

runners.name: Ill Give It A Go
runners.comment: Placed in all three starts but not progressing; longer trip should suit on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Placed in all three starts over 1m on the AW this year, albeit not really progressing; needs to turn things around now handicapping, but the longer trip should suit on pedigree.

runners.name: Magic Runner
runners.comment: Off four months since beaten a head on nursery debut over C&D; respected if ready to go
runners.spotlight: Showed improvement when beaten a head on nursery debut over C&D in December; respected if ready to go after three months off for in-form yard.

runners.name: Zaraquelle
runners.comment: Held in three starts on turf in the autumn; out of a French 1m1f AW winner; watch market
runners.spotlight: Out of the frame in three starts over 7f/1m on soft turf during the autumn; makes her handicap debut after six months off, but is out of a French 1m1f AW winner so well worth a market check.

runners.name: Silent Affair
runners.comment: Has shown some ability in three novices; open to further progress, but it will be needed
runners.spotlight: Has shown some ability in three novices, as when fourth of nine (albeit 9l behind the winner) on her return over C&D last month; open to further progress now handicapping, but it will be needed.

runners.name: Romantic Spirit
runners.breeder: S A R L Haras De La Mercerie, F & P Ga
runners.comment: 5lb higher than when winning narrowly over C&D last month (first two clear); respected
runners.spotlight: Defied a 166-day absence and market weakness when narrowly winning a handicap over C&D last month (first two clear); up 5lb but she looks the type to carry on progressing now that she has got her head in front; respected.

runners.name: Its Life
runners.comment: Well beaten in three maidens and a handicap over 6f-1m; hard to make a case for
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in three maidens and a handicap over 6f-1m; dam is a half-sister to 2m Group 2 winner, but still hard to make a case for.

runners.name: Slowdownbarney
runners.comment: 7lb higher than when winning easily over C&D last time, but should still be hard to beat
runners.spotlight: Winless in his first 15 starts, but was showing improved form prior to winning by nearly 5l over C&D 12 days ago; raised 7lb for that but should still be hard to beat in his bid for a follow-up.

runners.name: Emaculate Soldier
runners.breeder: Gestut Hof Ittlingen U S J Weiss

prev_owners.owner: H H SH Nasser Bin Hamad Al Khalifa

runners.comment: Has regressed in four outings for this yard and now 0-8; stamina still not proven
runners.spotlight: Showed ability in a couple of 1m4f Southwell novices for the Crisfords around this time last year, but has regressed in four outings for this yard and is now 0-8; stamina still not proven either.

runners.name: Laser Focus
runners.comment: Unplaced in eight starts on AW and last four efforts on artificial surfaces have been poor
runners.spotlight: Won three times on turf last year and also twice over hurdles in November; unplaced in eight starts on the AW, though, and last four efforts on artificial surfaces have been poor; look elsewhere.

quotes.race: Clive Graham Memorial Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Laser Focus is in at Southwell on Friday and we might have to go again as he's won so easily. He's a good ground horse so it makes sense - James Owen trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's done well for us as a dual-purpose horse. He was a cheap purchase as we got him out of a claimer. He's won a good few for Pontoon Racing. He's currently on a break but will come back and have a spring/summer campaign. 01-01-25

runners.name: Payment Plan
runners.comment: Did well over 16.5f on Tapeta after November; modest the last twice; needs to bounce back
runners.spotlight: Did well over 16.5f on Tapeta after November, finishing first past the post in four of his five starts here and at Southwell; hasn't run very well in his last two outings elsewhere, though, and hopes pinned on the return here rekindling the fire.

runners.name: Grand Duchess Olga
runners.comment: Back off her last winning mark and has been mainly consistent since then; could go well
runners.spotlight: Back off the same mark as when winning at Kempton (2m, Polytrack) last summer and has been placed in six of her nine outings since, including three times over C&D; may get her own way in front and no surprise if she runs well.

runners.name: Moon Over The Sea
runners.comment: Five wins around here including over this trip last time; only 2lb higher; shortlisted
runners.spotlight: Five wins around here including when stepped up to this trip for the first time in a steadily run event last month; still has stamina to prove in a truly run race over this far, but he is only 2lb higher so has to make the shortlist.

quotes.race: £30 In Free Bets With BetUK Handicap
quotes.quote: There was no real pace on paper beforehand. I wasn't going quick where I was but if I'd been going any quicker I'd have taken Moon Over The Sea out of his comfort zone. He's seen the trip out well - Jason Watson, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Black Smoke
runners.comment: Three of his four wins have come over C&D; bit more needed if he is to resume winning ways
runners.spotlight: Three of his four wins have come over C&D, the latest in February; fair fourth of nine behind a stablemate of Slowdownbarney here a fortnight ago, but more needed if he is to resume winning ways.

5:20.race_name: Weekend Winners On Sky Sports Racing Apprentice Handicap

runners.name: Billy Mcgarry
runners.comment: C&D winner bidding for a hat-trick; drawn wide but still respected in his current mood
runners.spotlight: C&D winner just under a year ago and comes into this on a hat-trick after two wins at Southwell (1m, Tapeta), the latest a narrow success under Andrea Pinna 11 days ago; up another 2lb and although his wide draw isn't ideal, he has to be respected in his current mood.

runners.name: Wyvern
runners.owner: Pat Morris And Clear Cut Racing
runners.comment: Still 1lb below last winning mark but form since has been patchy; not sure what to expect
runners.spotlight: Course winner (6f) who is usually seen at Newcastle these days; still 1lb lower than when winning there (1m, Tapeta) in November, but his form has been patchy in the meantime so not quite sure what to expect; cheekpieces return.

runners.name: Enzos Angel

prev_owners.owner: Opulence T/Breds, Regents Racing Et Al

runners.comment: Both wins have come over 9.5f here; dropping back in trip may no bad thing; thereabouts
runners.spotlight: Both wins have come over 9.5f here, the latest in a 0-50 classified event (first-time cheekpieces) in January; dropping back in trip may no bad thing given he took a keen hold last time and should be thereabouts.

runners.name: Northbound
runners.comment: Made a winning return from six months off at Southwell in February, but not built on it
runners.spotlight: Made a winning return from six months off at Southwell (1m, Tapeta) in February, but not built on it in three outings since; edging back down the weights but needs to find a bit more.

runners.name: Dappled Light
runners.comment: Off six months since winning over 9.5f here; has won fresh before; shortlisted
runners.spotlight: Two wins last year, the latest a narrow success off 3lb lower here (9.5f) in October; off six months since, but he has won fresh in the past and the drop in trip shouldn't be an issue; shortlisted.

runners.name: King Of The Dance

prev_owners.owner: HP Racing King Of The Dance

runners.comment: First and third over C&D late last month; another big run seems likely
runners.spotlight: In good form over C&D late last month having dropped in the weights, winning a handicap and finishing a close third of 11 under a penalty in a 0-50 classified event four days later; another big run seems likely.

stable_tour.quote: He ran once last year when an encouraging third over 6f at Windsor. He had a few issues after that, hence why he didn't run again until last month when finishing in mid-division at Lingfield. He was ring rusty but has come on in leaps and bounds since and the plan will be for another novice to get a handicap mark - he could be a dark horse for later in the season. 03-08-22

runners.name: Olympic Quest
runners.comment: Form has been up and down since winning over C&D early last year; opposable on balance
runners.spotlight: Form has been up and down since winning over C&D from 2lb higher early last year; went close off this mark over 9.5f back here in October, but twice well held since; drawn widest and opposable on balance.

runners.name: Genta
runners.comment: 0-8; some promise last autumn but hasn't built on it; best watched for now
runners.spotlight: Eight-race maiden who showed some promise in his first four starts last autumn, but hasn't built on it (cheekpieces made little difference last time); best watched for now.

runners.name: Gatsby Cap
runners.comment: Irish stable is 2-2 here this month; much respected, all the more so if backed
runners.spotlight: Has regressed since winning twice at Dundalk (1m, Polytrack) early last year, but is now 5lb lower than for the most recent and his respected Irish stable is 2-2 here this month; major player, all the more so if backed.

quotes.race: GAIN Equine Nutrition Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: Gatsby Cap is tough in fairness to him, he hasn't been spared. We'll just keep pooching away with him - Fozzy Stack, trainer.

quotes.race: LMFM Dual Race Night Friday 3rd May Handicap
quotes.quote: Gatsby Cap travelled well through the race and did it easily. He did it very easy off that rating and I can see him going well in better company - Andy Slattery, rider

runners.name: Rebel Cove
runners.comment: Well held in three AW novices; major improvement needed on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Well held in three AW novices, the first two over 7f here and the latest on debut for this yard; major improvement needed on handicap debut; stable also runs Juan Cool Dude.

runners.name: Juan Cool Dude
runners.comment: 0-10, but only just beaten over C&D last October; each-way claims if able to repeat that
runners.spotlight: 0-10, but by far his best effort came when narrowly beaten over C&D last October; each-way claims if able to repeat that back from 168 days off.

runners.name: Mykonos St John
runners.breeder: T K & Mrs P A Knox
runners.comment: 9lb below last winning mark but will need to improve on recent efforts; blinkers on
runners.spotlight: Three-time winner over C&D including twice in the autumn; 9lb lower than for the most recent, but he will need to improve on recent efforts if he is to take advantage; first-time blinkers replace the usual visor.

quotes.race: Visit attheraces.com/marketmovers Handicap
quotes.quote: There was plenty of pace in the race so I bided my time out of the wind down the back straight and Mykonos St John came through at the end. Gelding has been the making of him - Saffie Osborne, jockey.

8:00.race_name: Easter Family Fun Day 21st April Handicap

runners.name: Saffredi
runners.comment: 2-2 over C&D and did well to dominate from stall 12 last time; 3lb rise manageable
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish 4yo who is 2-2 since dropped back to 6f by his new yard, both victories achieved over C&D; he had been off for 170 days prior to his recent win and he did well to dominate from his wide stall on that occasion; might face competition for the lead this time and no banker to confirm the placings with Radiant Angel.

runners.name: Aljezur
runners.comment: Exposed maiden; well held in two runs over further for new yard; risky back at 6f
runners.spotlight: Exposed maiden who failed to build on his early promise for Luke Dace; down the field in two runs over further for his new stable and enough to prove back at 6f.

runners.name: Kensington Agent
runners.comment: C&D win last month when ridden by Rossa Ryan; 2lb rise manageable; contender from stall 2
runners.spotlight: Kept on well to win a C&D handicap last month when Rossa Ryan was on board; 2lb higher mark offset by her rider's useful 3lb claims; better drawn than stablemate Agent Mayfair; contender.

runners.name: Nazca
runners.comment: Little to shout about in the last 12 months; down in the weights but has plenty to prove
runners.spotlight: Little to shout about in the last 12 months and he remains opposable despite a big drop in the weights; cheekpieces left off today.

runners.name: Southbank
runners.owner: David N Reynolds &  C D Watkins

prev_owners.owner: Qatar Racing Limited & China Horse Club International Ltd

runners.comment: Consistent on AW this winter and no obvious reason why he wouldn't make another bold bid
runners.spotlight: Won a 6f handicap at Chelmsford in December off a 5lb lower mark; held his form well since then and he's a key player in this field.

runners.name: Radiant Angel
runners.comment: Running well over C&D in recent starts; needs some luck but he's capable of a big run
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the 12th attempt when leading in the final 100 yards over C&D in February; better form when second here 12 days ago; will need some luck in running but he has the ability to feature.

runners.name: Beaumadier

prev_owners.owner: Paul Cullen & Joseph E Keeling & E J Dwyer & M C Grassick

runners.comment: Hit and miss over 5f this year; stays 6f but comes with risks attached
runners.spotlight: Hit and miss on AW this year, winning at Newcastle for Daragh Bourke in January and second at Lingfield on stable debut (both 5f); has 6f form but comes with risks attached.

runners.name: Agent Mayfair
runners.comment: 5f win at Southwell in February; held form since and Rossa Ryan booked; wide stall
runners.spotlight: Off the mark with a front-running 5f win at Southwell in February (0-50 classified); held his form since and has Rossa Ryan on board so respected, despite a wide stall.

runners.name: Heartrate
runners.owner: Horn And Trumpet Lads & S & A Mares
runners.comment: C&D win in February but beaten into seventh back here last time; usually worth opposing
runners.spotlight: He had dropped a long way in the weights prior to leading late on in a C&D handicap in February; only seventh here last month and others are more persuasive for win purposes.

quotes.race: Weatherbys Stallion Book Handicap
quotes.quote: Heartrate drifted from 5-4 to 13-2 and we couldn't get our head around it as we thought he'd go well. I liked the look of him at the sales, he's a big, strong horse and has plenty of form, including on the all-weather. He was bought as a fun horse and we'll keep him going through the year. He looked good in what probably wasn't the strongest race for the grade - Mark Loughnane, trainer.

runners.name: Candy Warhol
runners.owner: Homecroft Wealth, Paul J Dixon & Partners
runners.comment: 7f win here this month but failed to back it up next time and he's drawn wide back at 6f
runners.spotlight: Made all to win a 7f handicap here on April 1; well held six days later and he has a wide stall to deal with now dropped back to 6f.

runners.name: Black Cab
runners.comment: One course run that offers hope of better; makes handicap debut at a low level
runners.spotlight: Left the impression he was capable of better when a never-dangerous fourth over 7f here on his third start; tailed off at Leicester since but he makes his handicap debut at a low level and the betting should guide.

runners.name: Miss Moonshine
runners.comment: Did too much early last time and better judged on earlier efforts, including C&D
runners.spotlight: Dropped away at Lingfield last time having helped force a good pace; better efforts beforehand, including C&D, and she holds each-way claims.

runners.name: Stoneacre Girl
runners.comment: 12-race maiden; snippets of form but drawn widest on stable debut
runners.spotlight: 0-12 for Jessica Macey but showed the odd bit of promise; drawn widest ahead of her stable debut (same owner).

runners.name: Royal Accord
runners.comment: Ready win at Lingfield (6f) last time; 5lb rise asks a stiffer question but he's improving
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the ninth attempt when coming from off the pace to win a 6f handicap at Lingfield nine days ago; did well there given he was caught wide and he should be fine back at 5f with so much potential pace on; he'll need to improve again to defy a 5lb rise but it's possible.

runners.name: Auntie Jo
runners.comment: Flopped last time but she's of interest on this winter's AW best; considered
runners.spotlight: Not at her best at Southwell last time (behind a couple of today's rivals) but she has been placed a couple of times on Tapeta and could still have a bigger effort in her; best effort came when held up at Newmarket and she should get a good pace to aim at here; considered.

runners.name: Watkins
runners.comment: Unplaced in all eight starts; headgear left off today but others are more appealing
runners.spotlight: Unplaced in all eight starts, including when some way behind Wee Mary at Southwell two weeks ago; goes without headgear this time.

runners.name: Wee Mary
runners.comment: Good second on stable/handicap debut this month; up 2lb and other pace to deal with
runners.spotlight: Showed speed in three runs in Ireland last summer but ran to just a modest level; improved on stable/handicap debut at Southwell two weeks ago (5f), making the running and headed only by the gambled-on winner; up 2lb and has other pace to contend with this time.

runners.name: Hidden Verse
runners.comment: Finished last in two handicap runs over further; drops in trip but not a solid option
runners.spotlight: No improvement for the switch to handicaps this year, finishing last at Lingfield (7f; pulled hard) and Newcastle (6f); drop in trip needs to have a positive effect.

runners.name: Kameko Spirit
runners.comment: Placed in three AW handicaps this year; below par on turf latest; wider draw than ideal
runners.spotlight: Front-runner; placed three times in AW handicaps this year but her form dipped on turf at Bath two weeks ago; this scenario should be more suitable but she has a wide draw to negotiate.

runners.name: Trust Sergei
runners.breeder: Mr & Mrs S Matheson & Mr S Goodwin
runners.comment: More promise over 6f here on handicap debut; drop to 5f can prompt further progress
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in novice/maiden company but he offered more when third of 11 over 6f here on last month's handicap debut; drop to 5f could prompt further progress and he's of interest; withdrawn at Southwell this month having bolted before the start.

runners.name: Sunny Time
runners.comment: 5f win at Lingfield in January; not kicked on and now goes without headgear
runners.spotlight: Made all to win a 5f handicap at Lingfield in January; that success hasn't proved a springboard to better things and he's drawn widest here without his usual cheekpieces.

runners.name: Baby Rover
runners.owner: Ursa Major Racing Ltd And Partner
runners.comment: She has offered a bit more the last twice but others appeal more for win purposes
runners.spotlight: She has offered a bit more on her last two starts without suggesting she was ready to shed her maiden tag.

stable_tour.quote: An interesting horse as she's Curious Rover's full-sister. She has started to come to hand and we like what we're seeing. We expect her to be on the track in August. 14-06-24

runners.name: Miss Campanella
runners.comment: Poor form in her six starts, including three AW handicaps this year; hard to recommend
runners.spotlight: Poor form in her six starts, including three AW handicaps this year; hard to recommend.

3:27.race_name: Kenny Stewart Roadshow 65th Birthday Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
3:27.going_detailed: GOOD, good to soft in places (GoingStick: Chase 6.6, Hurdle 6.1) (Selective watering) (Inner Hurdle course)

runners.name: Special Rate
runners.comment: Won seven last season and runner-up the last twice; solid claims despite top weight
runners.spotlight: Won seven times over hurdles/fences last season; has returned from a break in good order, for all that he failed to remotely trouble the winner last time at Newcastle (2m4f).

quotes.race: Vickers.Bet Independent Family Owned Bookmaker Novices' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Special Rate jumped brilliant. I let him run to the front down the back, I thought he'll stay anyway and he's kept galloping - Ross Chapman, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Bleu Denfer
runners.comment: Twice runner-up here before facing a tough test in a Listed handicap at Navan last time
runners.spotlight: Now 0-11 over fences but he faced a tough test last time and was beaten narrow margins in three of his four previous runs, two of those here; solid chance with cheekpieces now fitted.

runners.name: Geryville
runners.comment: Fair run last time out on good ground but softer surfaces are ideal for him
runners.spotlight: Ran well but no match for the winner on good ground at Wetherby (2m3f) a month ago and softer surfaces are ideal for him.

quotes.race: William Hill B.O.G Is Back Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: He likes it here. Geryville jumped well and travelled and it was our day today - Micky Hammond, trainer

quotes.race: bet365 Handicap Chase (Challenger Middle Distance Chase Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: We were just hoping for a nice run from Geryville. The ground has been so firm he hasn't been schooled over fences, he's just been over French-style hurdles on the all-weather. He jumped a bit big early on but hopefully he can win again-Micky Hammond, trainer.

runners.name: Jet Legs
runners.owner: Mrs Suzy Brown & Peter R Brown
runners.comment: Has gone up 5lb for winning at Hexham and this has the look of a better race
runners.spotlight: Visored first-time when digging deep to win at Hexham (2m4f, good to soft) last month but this is a higher grade race and he's gone up 5lb.

quotes.race: Schloss Roxburghe Hotel Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Jet Legs had no weight on his back and a good 5lb claimer. He's a nice horse for the future. He's a laid-back character, a good traveller through the race. His owners have been very patient, you'll see the best of him as a staying chaser; Martin Todhunter, trainer.

runners.name: Hello Judge
runners.comment: Winning for a fourth time at this track when staying on best over this trip a month ago
runners.spotlight: Winning for a fourth time at this track when staying on best over this trip a month ago; has another 5lb to deal with but looks sure to put up another bold show.

quotes.race: Racing Post North Monet's Garden Series Final Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Hello Judge is is a lovely big, strong horse. He ran over three miles last time here but he's a two-and-a-half miler. It's a nice prize and this is the first time we've won one of the finals. We declared him for Hexham on Tuesday, thinking the ground here would be too quick - he'll not go there now! - Ian Hamilton, owner and trainer's husband.

quotes.race: Watch Racing TV Now Handicap Chase (Go North Monet's Garden Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I just had to try and get Hello Judge in a rhythm and it was good to see him get back to form. The stable has been a bit quiet lately but hopefully that's them turning the corner - Danny McMenamin, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

4:37.race_name: Stephex Horse Trucks Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
4:37.going_detailed: GOOD, good to soft in places (GoingStick: Chase 6.6, Hurdle 6.1) (Selective watering) (Inner Hurdle course)

runners.name: Homme Dun Soir
runners.owner: Jb Harper And Cavalry And Guards
runners.comment: Has won three of last four; best right-handed, on a roll and has major chance again
runners.spotlight: On a roll at present and he made it three successes from his last four outings when scoring in workmanlike style at Ludlow (2m, good) last month; tends to jump right and all his wins have come this way round; major chance again.

quotes.race: P.J. Foley Memorial Flat Race
quotes.quote: He's a big weak horse and maybe one for next year - Gordon Elliott, trainer of Homme D'Un Soir.

stable_tour.quote: He won his bumper at Gowran Park but got beaten next time in a messy six-runner bumper at Leopardstown. He's jumping very well and we're looking forward to getting him out soon. 09-11-20

runners.name: Grey Diamond
runners.breeder: Philippe Ouvry & Ecurie Des Vives Terres
runners.comment: Doesn't look the force of old and a losing sequence stretches back more than two years
runners.spotlight: Doesn't look the force of old and a losing sequence stretches back more than two years; tailed off when switched back to hurdles at Bangor in December; needs to be revived by a break.

quotes.race: Haydock Park Racecourse Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Grey Diamond was brilliant early and the pace kind of died. He's got an incredibly high cruising speed and it's about channelling his energy the right way. He likes soft ground - Sam Twiston-Davies, rider.

quotes.race: Paddy's Rewards Club Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I sat Grey Diamond just off the pace set by Antunes and it worked out very well - Sam Twiston-Davies, rider.

stable_tour.quote: A horse we bought from Sam Thomas who we will try to find a suitable two-mile handicap hurdle for. 24-10-23

He has been a real star of a horse for us, but he only ran three times last season as he picked up a niggle after his last run at Wincanton in January, hence he has not been seen since. He is fine now and looks good and strong ahead of his return to action. I am keen to get him out soon to see where we are with him. 09-11-22

runners.name: Coup De Coeur
runners.comment: Consistent; followed win at Newcastle with a second there; unlikely to be far away
runners.spotlight: Has been consistent since joining Micky Hammond and he followed a win at Newcastle (2m, soft; also handles good) with a creditable second over the same C&D; unlikely to be far away.

runners.name: Five Dollar Fine
runners.comment: Back to last winning mark but disappointing since and difficult to recommend
runners.spotlight: Can compete off the same mark as when winning over C&D (good to soft) in October, but that's because he's been disappointing since; beaten a long way out at Newcastle two weeks ago and difficult to recommend.

runners.name: Clean Getaway
runners.comment: Four wins in autumn and impossible to discount after five-month absence
runners.spotlight: Had an excellent autumn, winning four times (two hurdles, two chases) at Sedgefield, and soft ground was possibly against him when he was only fourth of nine there last time; will need a personal best to get back on the winning trail after a five-month absence but he's impossible to discount.

stable_tour.quote: He's lively but is a great character. He didn't run as I anticipated in his bumper, but I'm confident he's considerably gifted and suspect we'll try to win a bumper before hurdling. 19-10-21

4:02.going_detailed: GOOD, good to soft in places (GoingStick: Chase 6.6, Hurdle 6.1) (Selective watering) (Inner Hurdle course)

runners.name: Tigerbythetail
runners.comment: Catterick winner in February; ran poorly at Southwell last time and needs to bounce back
runners.spotlight: 1-11 over hurdles; won at Catterick (3m1f, good to soft; raced up with the pace as usual) in February but ran unaccountably poorly at Southwell three weeks ago and needs to bounce back.

runners.name: Hurricane Ali
runners.comment: Winless since September 2022; last run was well below par; others look far more obvious
runners.spotlight: Losing run goes back to September 2022; slowly falling in the weights and is best away from soft/heavy ground, but his last run was well below par and others look far more obvious.

quotes.race: Sky Sports Racing Sky 415 Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Hurricane Ali is progressing nicely and likes this ground. Running him over 2m is clearly working but he will stay 2m4f down the line - Stan Sheppard, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: A nice horse we've just bought from John Mackie. John has looked after him really well and was sad to see him go, and I think he's going to have a good summer campaign. He's an older horse who's been really consistent over hurdles. I like these good-ground horses for Cartmel and he could be one to jump a fence. 14-02-24

runners.name: Forged Well
runners.owner: Mrs Suzy Brown & Peter R Brown
runners.comment: Still only a 6yo; ought to be suited by 3m+ but hasn't given his running yet when tried
runners.spotlight: Best efforts when winning (2m5f) and runner-up (2m6f) at Kelso towards end of 2024; still only a 6yo and ought to be suited by 3m-plus, but hasn't given his running yet when tried; now wears a visor.

runners.name: Kilmore Rock
runners.comment: Improved for cheekpieces when scoring at Newcastle; still unexposed and may well follow up
runners.spotlight: Both wins on good ground, improving for the application of cheekpieces when scoring at Newcastle (2m7f) 19 days ago; still unexposed and may well follow up.

runners.name: Storm Nelson
runners.comment: Veteran; tumbled in the weights during fruitless 2024; needs to be revitalised by a break
runners.spotlight: Veteran who tumbled in the weights in the first half of 2024 when mostly out of form, signing off with a poor effort at Uttoxeter; needs to be revitalised by a 284-day absence.

stable_tour.quote: He did well last year, winning his first three races for us having come from Lucy Normile. He just had a little breathing issue which we had operated on and the result has been very positive. After a 329-day break he won at Carlisle and followed that up off a4lb higher mark at Ayr. He is in very good order and off a career-high markof 134 I expect him to be competitive ina valuable 3m handicap hurdle at Sandown this Saturday. He is a relentless galloper, and with plenty of give in the ground I would hope he has a serious chance. 01-02-23

runners.name: Cruden
runners.comment: Back from wind surgery; relatively low mileage and has possibilities if staying the trip
runners.spotlight: 4yo with Flat (1m3f, soft/heavy) and hurdles (2m, good) wins to his name; beaten at odds-on at Newcastle (2m4f, good) on latest start but ran respectably on the figures; returns from wind surgery over a much longer distance; relatively low mileage and has possibilities if he stays.

quotes.race: AOS Security Median Auction Maiden
quotes.quote: Cruden is a big horse who's really starting to fill into himself and is learning on the job. When Shane got him out into the open he didn't really know what to do but he really ground it out to the line - Kate Harrington, assistant trainer.

stable_tour.quote: This colt by Time Test hasn't started out yet, but he is one we like and we're looking forward to getting him out onto the track. 24-04-24

5:12.going_detailed: GOOD, good to soft in places (GoingStick: Chase 6.6, Hurdle 6.1) (Selective watering) (Inner Hurdle course)

runners.name: City Derby

prev_owners.owner: Richard D A Hames & Walter O'Connor

runners.comment: Bagged a four-timer last summer but more recent form is far less encouraging; more needed
runners.spotlight: Bagged a four-timer (all at Cartmel) last summer but his more recent form is far less encouraging, a never-dangerous fourth of six over C&D 11 days ago; needs to take a step forward

quotes.race: AF Connell Ltd Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The wind op has been a big factor. The ground being a little bit softer and no weight on City Derby's back has helped. Lizzie's done a fantastic job. It probably should have been five, I hit the front a bit too soon the first day but four is brilliant - Sean Quinlan, rider, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: See A Stride
runners.comment: Good second in C&D novice in February; needs considering back in handicap company
runners.spotlight: Fair ex-Irish maiden hurdler is proving consistent for her current yard, runner-up in C&D novice in February; needs considering back in handicap company.

stable_tour.quote: She was fifth in a very messy bumper at Galway but beat the geldings on her only start between the flags. She's up to winning a bumper on soft ground, no problem. 15-11-21

runners.name: Sonning
runners.comment: Last for new yard in Flat handicap at Pontefract 11 days ago; has a bit to prove now
runners.spotlight: Fairly useful 2m hurdles winner in 2022 for Danny Brooke, but he came in last of ten for his new yard in 1m4f Flat handicap at Pontefract 11 days ago; he has a bit to prove now.

stable_tour.quote: I don't think he quite got a mile and a half on the Flat but mile - and - a - quarter horses should get two over hurdles and he's a little bit stronger as well now. He was second on his hurdling debut at Wincanton where he was a little novicey but will have learned plenty. 03-11-21

runners.name: George Darling
runners.comment: Improved when cosy winner on h'cap debut at Market Rasen latest; up 7lb but can go well
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced sort took a big step forward on his first foray into handicap company when scoring at Market Rasen (2m4f) 24 days ago; up 7lb but he scored cosily there and can go well again.

runners.name: Jumping Jupiter
runners.comment: Caught the eye when fourth at Newcastle latest; back on last winning mark; player
runners.spotlight: Caught the eye after a five-month layoff when a running-on fourth of nine in 2m1f handicap at Newcastle 19 days ago; now back on his last winning mark so is a player back up in trip.

runners.name: Rioja Alta
runners.comment: Very good second at Newcastle latest; merits serious consideration off the same mark
runners.spotlight: Galvanised by blinkers, getting off the mark at Sedgefield (2m4f) in February and following it up with a very good second in 2m4f handicap at Newcastle the following month; winner has gone in since and merits serious consideration off an unchanged mark.

quotes.race: Vickers.Bet Independent Family Owned Bookmakers Handicap Hurdle (Cab On Target Qualifier) (Div I)
quotes.quote: The first-time blinkers certainly sharpened up Rioja Alta, who ran a good, honest race - Micky Hammond, trainer.

runners.name: Big Storm Brewing
runners.comment: Sixth on h'cap debut at Newcastle two weeks ago; could still do better now dropped 4lb
runners.spotlight: Hinted at promise in novice company, but he came in a never-dangerous sixth of ten on his handicap debut at Newcastle (2m4f) two weeks ago; could still do better now dropped 4lb.

runners.name: Socks Off
runners.comment: Arrives in decent nick without winning; one for the shortlist eased 2lb
runners.spotlight: Arrives in decent nick without winning for his current yard, third of nine in 2m1f handicap hurdle at Newcastle 19 days ago; one for the shortlist eased 2lb.

stable_tour.quote: He won for us at Sedgefield around this time last year and was then a little bit unfortunate on a couple of occasions. He'll be competitive off his mark and the plan is to mix between hurdles and fences over the summer. 24-01-24

runners.name: Coral Blue
runners.comment: Ridden too aggressively when sixth at Hexham latest; considered with cheekpieces refitted
runners.spotlight: Without a victory since early 2023 but he comes here in good order, ridden too aggressively when a fading sixth in 2m4f Hexham handicap 25 days ago; considered with cheekpieces refitted.

quotes.race: Summer Party Pack Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Coral Blue worked well during the week so we were quietly confident. He was getting all the concessions. We'll see what the handicapper does and there's no reason why he can't go back on the Flat - Seamus Fahey, trainer.

runners.name: Rickety Gate
runners.comment: Course winner; solid fourth in Wetherby handicap last month; not out of it eased 1lb
runners.spotlight: Course winner who got back on track when fourth of nine in 3m Wetherby handicap last month; not out of it eased 1lb.

quotes.race: Get Daily Tips At racingtv.com Handicap Hurdle (Go North Middle Distance Series Qualifier) (Div I)
quotes.quote: Rickety Gate took a little time to win. He might jump a fence a time as he jumped tidy enough there - Nicky Richards, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: A solid handicap hurdler who won two races last season and should win another couple this time. He had a bad fall at Doncaster last season and it took a couple of runs to get his confidence back. He's looking good now and will run soon, as long as the ground isn't too soft. 25-10-23

1:42.race_name: Jump Season Finale Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle
1:42.going_detailed: GOOD, good to soft in places (GoingStick: Chase 6.6, Hurdle 6.1) (Selective watering) (Inner Hurdle course)

runners.name: Quaresome
runners.comment: Last on chasing debut at Sedgefield in November; needs to bounce back after a break
runners.spotlight: Winless since his debut over hurdles in 2023 and he came in last of seven on his chasing debut at Sedgefield (2m3f) in November; he needs to bounce back after a break with cheekpieces refitted.

quotes.race: Racing Post Supports Go North Weekend Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Quaresome was a bit green - Donald said he would be - and he was jumping a bit big early doors. But they went a good gallop and his jumping flattened out. He finished off well and he'll get further, but he's no need to go further just yet. He's still a bit babyish so I pulled him into the middle of the track to give him a clear sight at the last. I always felt I was going to win - Brian Hughes, jockey.

runners.name: Russian Virtue
runners.comment: C&D scorer; good third at Sedgefield 30 days ago; one to consider with cheekpieces added
runners.spotlight: C&D scorer who turned in his best run of the season when third of six in 2m Sedgefield handicap 30 days ago; he's one to consider with cheekpieces added.

quotes.race: Top Odds Every Day With BetUK Handicap
quotes.quote: They put this extra meeting on and Russian Virtue has been a bit unlucky for us on the Flat, being placed plenty of times. So while the weather is not great for going hurdling we thought we'd give him a spin on the Flat and it's great that he's won a third race in a row. I hope he'll be one for the two-mile hurdle at the Northern Lights finals at Musselburgh. He may run at Sedgefield on Sunday and get him qualified - Rebecca Menzies, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: A fun dual-purpose horse who's won eight times for us, with six coming over hurdles and two on the Flat. He thrives on racing and his work at home, and he hasn't finished winning yet. We're keen to keep his mark similar to where it is now so he has a nice weight for the Go North two-mile hurdle series final, which he finished fourth in last year. He'll be lightly raced before that and we might even go back on the all-weather. 24-01-24

runners.name: Lady Babs
runners.comment: Completed hat-trick over C&D and good Musselburgh third since; player off 4lb lower mark
runners.spotlight: Completed her hat-trick over C&D in March and posted another good effort when third of eight at Musselburgh (2m4f) 29 days ago; this veteran is a player off a 4lb lower mark here.

runners.name: Caramelo Rapido
runners.comment: Improved when fourth in C&D novice in February; much respected now going handicapping
runners.spotlight: 80-1 but took a big step forward on his third hurdling run when fourth of eight in C&D novice in February; he's much respected now going handicapping after a break.

runners.name: The Navigator
runners.comment: Beat only one over 2m3f here 11 days ago; he needs to get back on track
runners.spotlight: A three-time winner (at up to 2m5f) in the first half of the season but his more recent form is not so encouraging, beating only one over 2m3f here 11 days ago; he needs to get back on track.

quotes.race: Go North Sea Pigeon Series Final (A Handicap Hurdle) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The Navigator fell in this race last year and he never really recovered. I deliberately went to Sedgefield because I thought if there was anywhere he could get his confidence back it would be there, and he needed it. He's got a lot of ability, he's a big beautiful horse, he's stunning - Dianne Sayer, trainer.

runners.name: Gandhi Maker
runners.breeder: Mme M J Augereau & Mr R Terriere
runners.comment: Last at Doncaster on final run for Rebecca Menzies in January; lots to prove for new yard
runners.spotlight: A fair winning chaser (at up to 2m3f) for Stuart Coltherd but he came in last of 17 back hurdling at Doncaster (3m) on his final run for Rebecca Menzies in January; he starts out for another new yard now with plenty to prove.

runners.name: Bodygroove
runners.comment: Won at Wetherby but well held in third when unseating rider at Market Rasen since
runners.spotlight: Got off the mark on his handicap debut at Wetherby (2m) in March but he was well held in third when unseating his rider at the last at Market Rasen (2m4f) 24 days ago; more is required.

runners.name: Ambassador
runners.comment: Scored at Uttoxeter in July but he's been below par since; needs to take big step forward
runners.spotlight: Scored at Uttoxeter (2m) in July but he's been below par since, a never-dangerous sixth of ten at Sedgefield (2m) 16 days ago; he needs to take a big step forward.

quotes.race: Brit Direct Handicap Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: Ambassador came to us in good form and all we've had to do is tick him over. He was given a good ride by Brian Hughes and it just sort of fell right for us really - Micky Hammond, trainer.

runners.name: Arctic Fox

prev_owners.owner: Colin Taylor And Miss Kay Wilding

runners.comment: First hurdling run since unseating at Bangor (likely to have placed) last May; considered
runners.spotlight: A fair 1m6f Flat winner; lightly raced over hurdles and has her first run in this sphere since unseating her rider in 2m Bangor handicap (likely to have been placed) last May; needs considering.

quotes.race: Queen Mother's Cup Handicap (For Lady Amateur Riders)
quotes.quote: It's the right time of year for the three-year-olds taking on the older horses. Arctic Fox has won three in a row and the step up in trip has not bothered her - Richard Fahey, trainer.

runners.name: Woodys Boy
runners.comment: Has offered little all three runs; needs switch to handicaps to spark improvement
runners.spotlight: Has offered little all three runs over hurdles, pulled up in 2m Hexham novice 25 days ago; needs this switch to handicaps to spark major improvement.

2:17.race_name: Radio Carlisle Taxis Novices' Handicap Chase
2:17.going_detailed: GOOD, good to soft in places (GoingStick: Chase 6.6, Hurdle 6.1) (Selective watering) (Inner Hurdle course)

runners.name: Empty Nest
runners.owner: M Blades, S Morrell, K Hathaway
runners.comment: Progressive type; won pluckily at Newcastle latest; big shout with form working out well
runners.spotlight: Progressive type and he pluckily resumed winning ways in handicap chase at Newcastle (2m4f) last month; up 3lb but big shout with that form having been well advertised since.

quotes.race: William Hill Offers Top Price Guarantees Novices' Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: We always thought Empty Nest was quite a decent horse and he never quite put it together on the track. He's been frustrating and we thought about retirement but we took him to Malton and he worked really well. I'm not sure what's made the difference but something has definitely worked - Mark Walford, trainer.

runners.name: Top Of The Bay
runners.comment: In good form for new yard, second at Newcastle two weeks ago; bold showing on the cards
runners.spotlight: Remains winless but he's resumed from nine months off with a pair of good efforts for his new yard, runner-up in 2m4f Newcastle handicap chase two weeks ago; another bold showing is on the cards.

runners.name: Lucky Soldier
runners.comment: Yet to get his head in front and 11th at Doncaster latest; much more needed now chasing
runners.spotlight: Yet to get his head in front and he came in only 11th in 3m Doncaster handicap hurdle in February; much more is needed now he goes chasing after a break.

stable_tour.quote: He was second in his first bumper to Dunnet Head, who won nicely at Carlisle recently. He ran no race over hurdles at the end of last season but that wasn't his fault. He's had a bit of a setback but ought to be out at the beginning of December. He's a nice novice hurdle prospect. 22-11-23

runners.name: Yes And Yes
runners.owner: David W Jagger & Mrs Belinda Clarke
runners.comment: Won at Chepstow before a good Warwick third 23 days ago; can make his presence felt again
runners.spotlight: Gained his breakthrough win at Chepstow (2m3f) in March and followed it with a good third of six in 2m4f Warwick handicap 23 days ago; he can make his presence felt again off a 1lb lower mark.

runners.name: Hey Brother
runners.comment: Has failed to complete in three starts for present stable; significantly more is required
runners.spotlight: Has failed to complete in a trio of starts for his present stable, tried in cheekpieces when pulled up at Hexham (4m) last time; significantly more is required if he is to get off the mark.

stable_tour.quote: He finished second in an Irish point and it was too late in the season to send him hurdling so he had a couple of runs in bumpers. He's schooled well but got rather tired on testing ground on his hurdling debut at Wetherby. 10-11-23

runners.name: Deep Strato

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late Trevor Hemmings

runners.comment: Pulled up on chasing debut at Newcastle but scuppered by bad error 5 out; no forlorn hope
runners.spotlight: Poor maiden hurdler on balance; pulled up on his first run over fences at Newcastle (23f) last month but he was scuppered by a bad error 5 out so this point winner is no forlorn hope.

runners.name: Stonegate
runners.comment: Yet to offer much over hurdles; goes chasing now with lots to prove
runners.spotlight: Yet to offer much over hurdles and he was pulled up in 23f handicap at Market Rasen when last seen out in December; goes chasing now with lots to prove.

runners.name: Great Ballinboris
runners.comment: Remote sixth at Newcastle last month; since had breathing surgery
runners.spotlight: Still to get his head in front and he came in a remote sixth in 2m4f handicap chase at Newcastle last month; subsequent breathing surgery needs to spark a big resurgence.

runners.name: Uncle Mac
runners.comment: Best effort over fences when fifth at Musselburgh in November; possibilities off 5lb lower
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 7yo posted his best effort over fences when fifth of six in 3m handicap at Musselburgh in November; possibilities off a 5lb lower mark.

runners.name: Lady Hamilton

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late Mr A Lister

runners.comment: Not disgraced when fifth at Newcastle latest; not totally dismissed on her fencing debut
runners.spotlight: Is 0-16 over hurdles but she wasn't disgraced when fifth of nine in 3m handicap at Newcastle two weeks ago; she can't be totally dismissed on her first go over fences.

2:52.race_name: Flat Season Opener 19th May Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
2:52.going_detailed: GOOD, good to soft in places (GoingStick: Chase 6.6, Hurdle 6.1) (Selective watering) (Inner Hurdle course)

runners.name: Bel Amigo

prev_owners.owner: Ecurie Team Spirit, Jacques Detre & Patrice Detre
Ecurie Team Spirit, Patrice Detre & Jacques Detre

runners.comment: Two course wins make him the pick on form; rider's claim helps offset his double penalty
runners.spotlight: French 2m4f chase winner in 2024; now in a good vein of form over hurdles, winning two novices here (2m1f, good/good to soft) in March; that looks the best form on offer and Dominic Hislop's claim helps offset the double penalty; leading contender.

quotes.race: Pauline Phizacklea Memorial Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was obviously his race to lose. Bel Amigo was very impressive when he won a claiming chase in France and was very disappointing in his first two starts for us but it was obviously his wind. That's two runs in 14 days so we'll let him catch his breath and we may find something for him at Perth - Nick Alexander, trainer.

runners.name: Hes A Diamond
runners.comment: Winning hurdling debut at Market Rasen; jumped soundly in main and is open to improvement
runners.spotlight: Unplaced in bumpers but off the mark immediately over hurdles at Market Rasen (2m4f, good; 20-1) last month, making all under Brian Hughes; that form might not have much depth but he jumped soundly in the main and is open to improvement.

runners.name: Berry Edge
runners.comment: 3-33 on Flat; late to hurdling and stamina could be an issue over this trip
runners.spotlight: 3-33 on Flat, one of those wins on this course (1m1f) on good to soft ground; late to hurdling and stamina could be an issue over this trip.

runners.name: Cartonne
runners.comment: Better known as front-running chaser; dangerous at best but last two runs have been poor
runners.spotlight: Front-running chaser who can go clear in his races; last two runs have been poor and he bled from the nose on latest; carries risks but he'd be dangerous if this switch back to hurdling sparks a revival.

runners.name: Largy Spirit
runners.comment: Fifth in a point and sixth in a bumper in Ireland; bred to stay well
runners.spotlight: Fifth in a point and sixth in a bumper in Ireland, wearing a tongue-strap on second occasion; bred to stay well; also declared for the 2.10 Fairyhouse.

runners.name: Getaway Frankie
runners.comment: Modest form in bumpers in 2024; could make an impact on today's hurdling debut
runners.spotlight: Modest form in bumpers in 2024, one-paced fourth at Kelso (good) on latest; bred to be suited by this step up in distance, so it's not out of the question that she'll make an impact on today's hurdling debut.

runners.name: Moveonbuy
runners.comment: Unplaced all four starts, tailed off on hurdling debut; others preferred
runners.spotlight: Unplaced all four starts, tailed off on hurdling debut; others preferred.

runners.name: Goodlucktome
runners.owner: Hutchins Thoroughbreds Syndicate, Mrs F M Hutchins Et Al

runners.name: Boomtown Boss
runners.owner: Wessel Thoroughbreds Syndicate, R H Morrison Et Al

runners.name: Tuned
runners.breeder: Blue Gum Farm Aust Pty Ltd
runners.owner: Trilogy Syndicate, S Mcqueen Et Al

runners.name: Coles Best
runners.owner: G J R Wheeler & Mrs D F Wheeler

runners.name: Cosmo Centaurus
runners.owner: Mrs V A Heathcote, Ms R S Tyszkiewicz Et Al

runners.name: Mingardos
runners.owner: M J Finney & Mrs V M Finney

runners.name: Nepotism
runners.owner: Werrett Bloodstock Pty Ltd Synd, Madden Bloodstock Et Al

runners.breeder: G S A Bloodstock Pty Ltd

runners.owner: Mrs G L Muollo, Miss N A Muollo Et Al

runners.name: Within The Law
runners.owner: Darby Racing Syndicate, A J Barsby Et Al

runners.name: Bellazaine
runners.owner: Ms P A Bourke, Miss R Wakefield Et Al

runners.name: Spicy Lu
runners.owner: N J Olive, N Gopaul Et Al

runners.name: Tupakara
runners.owner: Tfi Syndicate & Kia Ora Stud W S Syndicate

runners.name: Next Jen
runners.owner: Anr Fashion Sniptz, Miss A S Neasham Et Al
