runners.owner: I R Johnson & Dr A R Johnson

prev_owners.owner: Barneswood Farm Ltd For S C Green & G C Beemsterboer

runners.name: Jimmysstar
runners.breeder: Mrs C A & P M Algie & Little Avondale Trust
runners.owner: A Kheir, J A Oneill Et Al

runners.name: My Oberon
runners.owner: D F Degenhardt, Hirecha Racing Et Al

quotes.race: All-Weather Mile Championships Conditions Stakes
quotes.quote: My Oberon gave me a moment of fright, I thought I was going to win by half a length when I took him off the bridle but he knows how much he has to do and he won't do an inch more. He's done really well to win because he's had a busy time being in Dubai and coming back and it takes its toll. It was a great training performance to get him here today and get his head in front, it's a tough one to judge when horses are travelling - Tom Marquand, jockey.

quotes.race: bet365 Earl Of Sefton Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: My Oberon is a lovely horse who's had plenty of work but he's a big horse so takes a bit of getting ready. Hopefully he'll have a good season as he's not many miles on the clock - Maureen Haggas.

quotes.race: William Hill Novice Stakes
quotes.quote: I don't know what My Oberon beat. He's a lazy horse at home but William has always liked him since he was a yearling. He was a bit backward as a two-year-old but he's getting his act together now. He still looks quite green and quite babyish, he's a long way off the finished product - Mareen Haggas, trainer's wife.

runners.name: Osipenko
runners.owner: C J Waller, I Bruce Et Al

prev_owners.owner: D K Woodhouse, Rusties Syndicate & J Clark
D K Woodhouse, O Smith Et Al

runners.name: Joliestar
runners.owner: B J Lindsay Mnzm & Mrs J E A Lindsay

runners.name: Benedetta
runners.owner: Eales Racing Pty Ltd Syndicate, B M Wilson Et Al

prev_owners.owner: B M Wilson, B K Parker Et Al
Eales Racing Pty Ltd, B M Wilson Et Al

runners.name: Grail Seeker
runners.owner: T C Clarke & C B Jones

1:25.race_name: Welcome To Racing Home For Easter Festival Maiden
1:25.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places

runners.name: Ben Lawers
runners.comment: Siyouni colt, half-brother to winners, nicely bred but Shane Foley prefers his stablemate
runners.spotlight: Siyouni colt; bought back for 98,000gns as a yearling; third foal; half-brother to French 1m2f/UAE 1m4f winner Webinar (RPR 96); dam 1m-1m2f winner (inc Canadian Grade 1; 113), out of 7f 2yo winning half-sister to 1m2f Australian Group 1 winner Glass Harmonium; nicely bred but Foley prefers Collecting Coin.

runners.name: Cecco
runners.comment: 25-1 and well beaten on testing ground on debut at Naas, up in trip, may need more time
runners.spotlight: Sent off at 25-1 for his debut at Naas (7f, soft to heavy) and was beaten 16.5l; steps up in trip and yard respected at this track but he may need more time.

runners.name: Collecting Coin
runners.comment: 52,000gns Lope De Vega colt, preferred by Foley, speedily bred, may be best watched
runners.spotlight: Lope De Vega colt cost 52,000gns as a 2yo; first foal; dam 5f 2yo winner (RPR 94), closely related to smart 5f/6f winner Angel Alexander, half-sister to 5f 2yo Listed winner Democracy Dilemma, out of Listed-placed 5f 2yo winning half-sister to 5f Group 3 winner; preferred by Foley but speedily bred so may be best watched on debut.

runners.name: Far Eclipse
runners.comment: Failed to figure at huge odds in two maidens last year at 7f-6f; one for handicaps
runners.spotlight: Triple-figure odds and failed to figure in two maidens over 7f at the Curragh (good) and 6f at Naas (good) last year; will qualify for handicaps after this.

runners.name: Gold Dublooms
runners.comment: 250-1 for both maidens and finished out the back, unlikely winner
runners.spotlight: No impact in first two maidens at 250-1 at Dundalk (10.5f) and Gowran (1m, yielding); an unlikely winner.

runners.name: Jagged Edge
runners.comment: Form of AW maiden run has been boosted, bred for turf, should be staying on at the finish
runners.spotlight: Ran really well on debut in a 1m maiden at Dundalk in February, staying on for a 1l third behind the now 103 rated Tiberius Thunder; Blue Point colt is bred to handle turf but he might need a bit further than this; should be doing his best work at the finish.

runners.name: Kasper Hauser
runners.breeder: Aston Mullins Stud & S Barrow Esq
runners.comment: Promise on debut last year, not as good on latest, will qualify for h'caps after this
runners.spotlight: Minor promise on debut last October at Leopardstown (1m, soft) but was still beaten 7.5l; may have needed latest at the Curragh but didn't show enough to fancy here; will get a mark after this.

runners.name: Omni Man
runners.comment: Okay run on heavy on debut, fine effort on good at Navan latest, leading form claims
runners.spotlight: Ran okay on debut at Galway on testing ground last October; much better on turf debut on seasonal reappearance at Navan earlier this month (1m, good) in first-time tongue tie (retained); leading form claims on that if he is as effective back on a softer surface.

runners.name: Omon Vase
runners.comment: Showcasing colt, 135,000gns yearling, attractive pedigree, worth a market check on debut
runners.spotlight: Showcasing colt cost 60,000gns as foal and 135,000gns as a yearling; second foal; half-brother to French 6f 2yo winner Havana Cigar (7f Group 1 runner-up; RPR 111); dam unraced half-sister to 1m4f Group 3 winner Danehill Kodiac; attractive pedigree and worth a market check on debut.

runners.name: Sheamus Seimhiu
runners.comment: 150-1 on debut last May and well beaten, gelded, may need more time
runners.spotlight: Has been gelded since heavy debut defeat at the Curragh (6f, soft) last May when a 150-1 shot; may need more time.

runners.name: Sidney Reilly
runners.comment: Cotai Glory colt, related to winners, yard can ready one, check the market
runners.spotlight: Cotai Glory colt cost 32,000gns as a yearling; fourth foal; half-brother to winners Venice Biennale (Listed-placed 1m2f; RPR 100), Artful Approach (7f; 85) and Valadon (2m hurdle); dam unraced half-sister to Italian 6f 2yo Group 3 winner Aria Importante; yard can ready one so watch the market.

runners.name: Summer Island
runners.owner: Nigel Ohare/Martin W White/Mark Devlin/Rockview Stables
runners.comment: Caravaggio colt cost 32,000euros as a 2yo, others make more appeal on paper
runners.spotlight: Caravaggio colt cost 32,000euros as a 2yo; third foal; half-brother to winners Tiz Erin (US 8.5f AW) and Classy Partner (Canadian 6.5f AW); dam US Graded stakes-placed 6.5f-1m turf winner (RPR 101); others make more appeal on paper.

runners.name: Tashir
runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late H H Aga Khan
runners.comment: Fine effort behind now 109 rated horse at Galway on debut, big chance if handles soft
runners.spotlight: Ran a blinder on only start last season when a 2.5l second behind the now 109 rated Monumental in a 7f Galway maiden on good ground; steps up to 1m and has a big chance on that form if he handles the likely softer conditions.

runners.name: Washington Street
runners.comment: Minor promise in 7f maidens at Naas and Dundalk last year, gelded, needs more up in trip
runners.spotlight: Two 7f maiden runs at the backend of last season weren't devoid of promise; has been gelded and now steps up in trip for his return; more needed to get his head in front.

runners.name: Curroy Lady
runners.comment: Well beaten at big prices in both starts, similar story likely here, improve for h'caps
runners.spotlight: Ulysses filly has been sent off at huge odds for both starts and failed to trouble the judge in both; looks more of a handicapping prospect.

runners.name: Love Sonnet
runners.comment: Not disgraced in two 1m Dundalk maidens, needs to improve for switch to turf
runners.spotlight: Ran in 1m maidens at Dundalk in December and January, beaten similar distances in both; major improvement required to be competitive here on turf debut.

runners.name: Missing Socks
runners.comment: Gregorian filly, half-sister to a Malaysian winner, best watched on debut unless backed
runners.spotlight: Gregorian filly is a fifth foal; half-sister to Malaysian 7f/1m winner Gunforhire; dam placed in Greece, half-sister to Group-placed 7f 2yo winner Takrice, out of 7f-1m1f winner; best watched on debut unless the market speaks.

runners.name: Offshore Bay
runners.comment: New Bay filly, plenty of stamina in pedigree, respected source but probably best watched
runners.spotlight: New Bay filly is a second foal; dam 7.5f 2yo/1m2f winner (RPR 96), sister to 2m-2m7f hurdle/chase winner Nachi Falls, half-sister to useful French 1m2f-1m5f winner Chill Wind, out of half-sister to 6.5f/1m Group 1 winner Moonlight Cloud; plenty of stamina on dam side of pedigree; respected source but probably best watched.

runners.name: Cabot Sq
runners.comment: Huge odds and no show in 7f maidens at Naas and Dundalk, hard to fancy; reserve
runners.spotlight: First reserve; well beaten at big prices in 7f maidens at Naas (soft to heavy) and Dundalk; hard to fancy on the form of those runs and may need more time.

runners.name: Starford
runners.comment: Mild promise when 18-1 on debut at Dundalk, worth a market check if gets in; reserve
runners.spotlight: Second reserve; midfield on debut at Dundalk (7f) earlier this month, running on well after meeting a bit of traffic; 1m should suit on that evidence; worth a market check if gets in.

runners.name: Bungle Lichious
runners.comment: Hard to make a case for after heavy defeats at Navan and Gowran; reserve
runners.spotlight: Third reserve; well beaten in a pair of maidens a week apart at Navan (1m, good) and Gowran (7f, soft); difficult to make a case for.

2:00.race_name: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Median Auction Race
2:00.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places

runners.name: Currawood
runners.comment: Rated 95, solid form in good ground maidens, won at Dundalk latest (7f), rain a worry
runners.spotlight: Rated 95; rock solid form in strong maidens last season all on good ground; confirmed that promise when off the mark on seasonal reappearance at Dundalk (7f); 1m should be within reach but not certain to handle soft ground on breeding; needs the rain to miss.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Median Auction Maiden (Median Auction Race)
quotes.quote: Currawood is a nice horse. I thought the race conditions suited him and the track suited him, he has a good action. He was a little bit immature as a two-year-old, he was up behind and a bit down in front so I just took my time with him. He's levelled out over the winter and he's become the horse that his frame said he would, he's got a bit of length and scope. He'll go to Cork in a winners' race around a mile in April - Paddy Twomey, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Green Triangle
runners.comment: 1-7 on turf, rated 94, win came on good ground, testing conditions a concern; cheekpieces
runners.spotlight: One of two for yard and preferred by McMonagle; rated 94; 1-7 on turf, the win coming over 7.5f in a Roscommon maiden (good); didn't seem to enjoy the testing ground at Naas on his return so the forecast rain is a concern; cheekpieces now added to tongue tie.

runners.name: Rowdy Yeats
runners.comment: Rated 94, won on soft to heavy at Naas latest, should stay 1m, leading claims
runners.spotlight: Rated 94; off the mark on seasonal reappearance at Naas (7f, soft to heavy) four weeks ago; form of maiden runs last year behind Cercene and Arizona Blaze has been boosted; should stay 1m; leading claims.

quotes.race: Space Traveller At Compas Stallions (C & G) Maiden
quotes.quote: We fancied Rowdy Yeats when he went to the Curragh last year but he was beaten by a very good horse [Arizona Blaze] and they were a long way clear of the third. I found it hard to get him back and I don't think he was 100 per cent when he came here at the end of the season. He has been training well. There's no reason why he can't win good races and I'd be hopeful he can be a stakes horse. Jamie said he might get further. He said he travelled really smoothly but parked a bit in front. Colin Keane rides him in all his work and always liked him a lot - Noel Meade, trainer.

runners.name: Honeysuckle Rose
runners.comment: Promise on easy ground on debut, won on latest at Dundalk, McMonagle prefers stablemate
runners.spotlight: Promise on yielding to soft on debut at the Curragh (1m) in November; won in fine style dropped back to 7f at Dundalk second time up in December; steps back up in trip and should be fine on soft ground but looks the stable second string on jockey bookings.

runners.name: Minella Study
runners.comment: Improved on soft in second maiden but still well beaten, up against it in this company
runners.spotlight: Improved in second maiden at Tipperary on soft ground (1m1f) but was still beaten 6.75l; looks up against it in this company.

runners.name: Radial Symmetry
runners.comment: Huge odds and well beaten both starts to date, hard to make a case for on those efforts
runners.spotlight: Huge odds and ran accordingly in two maidens at Navan and the Curragh on good and soft ground; difficult to fancy after those two tame efforts.

runners.name: Va Va Vroom
runners.comment: 7f maiden winner, not disgraced in stakes races last twice, may need the rain to miss
runners.spotlight: Won a 7f Leopardstown maiden on good ground last July; subsequently not disgraced in a Deauville Group 2 (soft) and a Listed race at Dundalk; rated 93 so well-treated by race conditions and 1m should be fine but she might want better ground.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Auction Series Maiden (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Va Va Vroom ran really well at Gowran ajnd it was good to see her put it all together there. She was still a bit green but she did it well. She's in the Debutante and we will have a look at that - Jessica Harrington, trainer

runners.name: Dress Dance
runners.owner: John Lavery & J P M Oconnor
runners.comment: 150,000euros Dandy Man filly, related to smart winners, this a tough task on debut
runners.spotlight: Dandy Man filly cost 150,000 euros as a yearling; ninth foal; half-sister to six winners inc New Energy (7f 2yo/Australian Group 3 1m1f; RPR 117), Victoria Regina (1m/1m1f inc AW 2yo/Italian Group 3; 105); dam French 9.5f/1m4f winner (101); nicely bred but this a big ask on debut.

2:35.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places

runners.name: Carvalhal
runners.comment: Cheaply bought in October, 1-10 for former yard, this trip may be a shade sharp, watch
runners.spotlight: One of two for yard; UK recruit picked up for 4,000gns in October; 1-10 on turf for Michael Dods, the win coming over 1m1f on good to firm off 53; this trip might just be on the sharp side, he lacks a run and he is probably best watched.

stable_tour.quote: He's basically what you see. He won at Hamilton off 53 in early August over 1m1f and then went back over 1m2f at Ayr. He ran okay but I'm tempted to pull him back a furlong or two now and see how he copes. He's rated 60 and is capable off his current mark. 28-08-24

runners.name: Genuine Jim
runners.comment: 1-7 on turf, went close on return, up 2lb, could be more to come, ground versatile, chance
runners.spotlight: Second runner for yard; 1-7 on turf; narrowly denied on seasonal return at Leopardstown (1m, good) three weeks ago; 2lb higher now but there could be more to come and he's ground versatile; chance.

runners.name: Hemight
runners.comment: Maiden is 0-6 on turf, ran well on latest at Dundalk, rider takes off 10lb, not discounted
runners.spotlight: Eleven race maiden is 0-6 on turf; best effort on grass a 3l third in a 7f Tipperary maiden on testing ground last May; decent run latest on second start for this yard when a 1.75l third of 14 off 59 at Dundalk (7f); 1lb higher here but rider claims 10lb; not discounted on first try at 1m.

runners.name: Royal Pippen
runners.comment: 2-33 on turf, no win since 2021, good effort after break latest at Gowran, place claims
runners.spotlight: Is 2-33 on turf but hasn't won since August 2021; well-backed and sound effort on return when beaten 2l off this mark at Gowran (1m, yielding); handles any ground and well-treated on old form; place claims.

runners.name: Limestone Red
runners.comment: AW winner at 10.5f, 0-11 on turf, below par last two starts at Dundalk, 1m a query
runners.spotlight: AW winner over 10.5f is 0-11 on turf; went close off 58 here over 1m1f last August; below par last two starts at Dundalk and this trip raises questions; others appeal more.

runners.name: May Night
runners.comment: C&D winner off 10lb higher last May; out of form on AW, can't be discounted; blinkered
runners.spotlight: Seven time AW winner is 1-12 on turf, his win coming over C&D off 69 last May; raced exclusively at Dundalk for current yard and has yet to hit top form but mark has tumbled and is now 10lb lower than last turf success; can't discount in first-time blinkers.

runners.name: Notforalongtime
runners.comment: Won two of last three on AW, 1-19 on turf, ran poorly in this last year, others preferred
runners.spotlight: Gained eighth AW win in a Dundalk claimer on latest (7f), his second win from last three starts; 1-19 on turf, the win coming in 2020 when trained by Clive Cox; fit from the AW and rated 9lb lower on turf but ran poorly in this last year; others preferred.

quotes.race: Irishinjuredjockeys.com Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Notforalongtime had lost his way when I got him and he had a few problems so we were able to sweeten him up. The cheekpieces made a big difference. We'll come up for the winter with him - Laura Hourigan, trainer.

quotes.race: Free Tips Daily On attheraces.com Handicap
quotes.quote: I was chuffed with that, it was a nice enough race and Notforalongtime is a gutsy little horse - Adam Kirby, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: We've gelded him and he's had a wind operation, which can hopefully help him take another step forward. I think he'll continue to progress over a mile and build on his head-bobbing win at Doncaster last summer. 22-04-21

runners.name: Ive Been Dreaming
runners.comment: Won on h'cap debut when last seen in 2023, just 1lb higher now, gelded, watch the market
runners.spotlight: Is 1-4 on turf; off the mark on handicap debut in a nursery at Galway (7f, heavy) in October 2023; just 1lb higher now, has been gelded and rain a plus but entitled to need this after a mammoth layoff; watch unless strong in the market.

quotes.race: www.swordsecurity.com Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: I've Been Dreaming did it well. He's a big raw horse and he surprised me how well he handled the track. He could be one to look forward to next year - Mark Fahey, trainer

runners.name: Higher Kingdom
runners.comment: Six time AW winner, 0-24 on turf, good effort on latest, handles soft, has a chance
runners.spotlight: Six-time AW winner but 0-24 on turf; has run well in defeat on grass, including when a 3.5l third of 10 at Leopardstown (1m1f, good) on latest; handles soft; in form and not without a chance.

quotes.race: Floodlit Friday Nights At Dundalk Stadium Handicap
quotes.quote: Higher Kingdom is a talented horse. He travelled like a dream and he just did enough - John McConnell, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He has really progressed this winter as having won off 62 in December at Dundalk, he has since added two more wins at the track and is up to a rating of 86 now. The plan is to send him over to Lingfield on Good Friday for either the 1m or 1m2f race. Even though he's now at a career-high mark, I think there could be a little more to come. He's a very talented horse who was highly thought of as a juvenile, but like so many Kingmans he has a mind of his own and has taken a while to get back on track. He was disappointing last time out, but he seems grand at the moment and we'll almost certainly be claiming off him at Lingfield. I'm not entirely sure who'll get the ride but Siobhan Rutledge has won twice on him. 06-04-23

runners.name: Feature This
runners.comment: 1-12 on turf, out of form recently, no signs of revival latest, cheekpieces go back on
runners.spotlight: Has won four on the AW and is 1-12 on turf; posted a good effort behind Higher Kingdom at Dundalk in this headgear combination in November but has gone off the boil since; no signs of a revival on return to turf at Leopardstown latest; others look more likely.

quotes.race: Irishinjuredjockeys.com Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Feature This likes it up here. I was trying to get her to stay further but that's probably her trip. There was not much pace which probably suited her. She battled well and will probably keep going up here for the winter - Paul Flynn, trainer

quotes.race: Join Us On Instagram @dundalk_stadium Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Feature This got a grand ride from Robert, he did everything I asked. I thought she was a bit lairy so we stuck the cheekpieces on her but she did it well - Paul Flynn, trainer.

runners.name: Harry The Rogue
runners.comment: Well-backed lately but not much luck in running, yard in form, testing ground a worry
runners.spotlight: One of two for stable; 0-9 on turf and 0-18 overall; well backed on last two starts but hasn't had much luck in running; yard has started the season well and he looks up to winning a race when things fall right; very testing ground would be a worry.

runners.name: Manhattan Dandy
runners.comment: 3-46 on turf, likes testing ground, 3lb below last win, had sharpener at Dundalk, claims
runners.spotlight: Is 3-46 on turf, the last two wins coming on heavy; is 3lb below his last victory, he has run well here before and he had a satisfactory pipe opener at Dundalk three weeks ago; interesting runner.

runners.name: Poppadom
runners.comment: 0-16 on turf, went close on testing ground last October, lacks a run, watch unless backed
runners.spotlight: Second runner for yard; twenty-race maiden is 0-16 on turf; went close at Gowran (8.5f, soft to heavy) last October off 47 under this rider; 4lb higher now and lacks a recent run; probably best watched unless backed.

runners.name: Han Solo
runners.comment: Two-time course winner on good including over C&D, lacks a run, needs the rain to miss
runners.spotlight: Has won twice on turf, both on good ground at this venue, including over C&D; clearly likes it here and is on a competitive mark for his seasonal comeback but the forecast rain is a big concern; needs it to miss.

runners.name: Sayfa Fad
runners.comment: Solid effort latest, Keane keeps faith, up 2lb, soft ground a query, chance if handles it
runners.spotlight: Is 0-8 on turf; big step forward on latest under Colin Keane at Leopardstown (1m1f, good) in first-time blinkers (retained) when a 1.5l second of 10 (Higher Kingdom behind); drops back in trip, up 2lb and different ground now; chance if she handles it.

runners.name: Sofia Tesoro
runners.owner: Hugh J Obrien & Colm Obrien & Andrew Everard
runners.comment: 0-4, last on h'cap debut when last seen in 2023, probably best watched after long layoff
runners.spotlight: Is 0-4 overall and 0-2 on turf; no impact all four starts; last of nine on handicap debut at Dundalk (7f) when last seen in 2023; still early days but she's been off the track a long time and is probably best watched.

runners.name: Bucky Larson
runners.comment: Four-time turf winner for Ger Lyons, shaped ok latest but the forecast rain is a worry
runners.spotlight: Won seven for Ger Lyons (four on turf) and was rated in the 90s in his pomp; has yet to get his head in front since joining this yard but he ran a decent race on latest when not beaten far at Leopardstown (7f, good); rain is a big concern, however.

quotes.race: Dundalk Stadium Claiming Race
quotes.quote: Bucky Larson has been coming down the handicap all year and I felt the last day that he was something like himself. He was entitled to do that - Colin Keane, rider

quotes.race: Naas Racecourse Handicap
quotes.quote: Bucky Larson has a bit of class in races like that. He's a good lead horse at home and pulls one out of the bag every so often - Shane Lyons, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: "Paddy & Saoirse Casey" Handicap
quotes.quote: Bucky Larson is still a baby of a horse but we think he'll get ten furlongs in time. He's a lovely individual, he's growing up and I'd say there's another day or two in him - Ger Lyons, trainer

quotes.race: Leopardstown Summer Pass Maiden
quotes.quote: We rode him all wrong at Dundalk. We don't take back from the stalls and it was just the wrong way to ride him.His work at home had been good and he loves hunting one down. That's what we were expecting him to do at Dundalk and we were disappointed last time but I'd rather win here - Ger Lyons, trainer

runners.name: So Messi
runners.comment: 0-11 on turf, good 1m2f run here last May, 5lb lower now, check market, new yard
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose maiden for Pat Martin; 0-11 on turf on the Flat but has run well in defeat; touched off here over 1m2f (yielding) last May off 49 and is 5lb lower now; has run well on heavy and he's worth a market check on his seasonal and stable debut.

runners.name: Swiss Army Officer
runners.comment: C&D winner, 5lb below last win, strip fitter for comeback, ground fine; reserve
runners.spotlight: First reserve; C&D winner back in October 2020; last won in May 2023 at Roscommon (7.5f, good to yielding); 5lb lower now, soft ground fine, is well-handicapped and should strip fitter for comeback run; not discounted.

quotes.race: Torc Waterfall Claiming Race

Early in the race he was travelling very well, he missed the second last but apart from that he was fairly good - Richie McLernon, rider.

quotes.race: Schooling At Tipperary Rated Novice Chase
quotes.quote: Jumping has always been his forte. So Scottish is an exciting horse and that opens up more avenues for him. He is an intelligent horse and hopefully we will mix it between hurdles and fences for the rest of the season. With the weather we've been having for the past few years I'd prefer if he handled that ground than heavy - Emmet Mullins, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He had a good run at Galway the last day and is in at Fairyhouse this weekend in the two-mile handicap hurdle, albeit two miles might be a touch sharp for him. He had a break after Galway and the new two-and-a-half-mile handicap hurdle at Leopardstown on St Stephen's Day looks a good fit for him. He was a bit unlucky to bump into The Wallpark at Galway, so hopefully he can get his day in the sun this season. 25-11-24

quotes.race: Happy 60th Birthday To Ger Dunne Of Punchestown Race
quotes.quote: Star Harbour was running over a trip well short of his best. We had him entered at Chester last weekend but we took him out because of the ground and because this race was there for him - Ado McGuinness, trainer.

quotes.race: Dubai Duty Free Irish EBF Ragusa Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: Star Harbour has been very consistent, he won a good one last year in the Racing League as well. He's a great horse. We were to go to Yarmouth for the Racing League but that could put him out of the ratings. if it does he could go to Galway - Ado McGuinness, trainer.

quotes.race: Castleisland Rated Race
quotes.quote: Star Harbour got a top class ride. He is entered in the Galway Mile and if the handicapper isn't too hard on him he will go there instead of the Curragh on Sunday. He probably didn't quite stay at Down Royal but in time I think he will - Ado McGuinness, trainer.

quotes.race: Royal County Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: We put blinkers on Star Harbour last time but he missed the break and got caught in behind. He has a lot of ability and he wasn't a cheap colt. We have castrated him as he was a bit of a boyo and wasn't giving us everything. We did feel he had a lot of ability and I said I'd run him in this even though we were a couple of pounds out of the handicap as he'd have a light weight on his back. He put it to bed fairly quickly. He'll be nice for a mile-and-a-half handicap at Galway or as regards closer plans I was talking about the Ulster Derby - Ado McGuinness, trainer.

runners.name: Mashhoor
runners.comment: Group 3 winner in 2023 but not as good last year; questions on return; best on good ground
runners.spotlight: Group 3 winner in 2023 but not as good last year; dropped to a reasonable mark but questions remain on return; best on good ground.

quotes.race: Paddy Power International Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: You'd have to say Mashhoor has improved immensely. He's been very straightforward this year. There was no pace today so I said to Ben (Coen) to just let him roll along as he leads the string at home. I knew when they turned in that they weren't going to get to him, as he wasn't going to stop because he won over a mile and a half last time - Johnny Murtagh, trainer.

quotes.race: FBD Hotels & Resorts Orby Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: That was great. Mashoor has been training really well at home and showing all the right signs that he had improved. I'm really delighted the way he won today. He can win at 1m2f and now he can get 1m4f so there are plenty of races for him - Johnny Murtagh, trainer

quotes.race: William Hill Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: Mashhoor ran very well in Cork on his first run and he had a very good draw today, and was given a very good ride by Shane. He's mentally immature but is toughening up now and being by Kingman I'd say he has loads of class - Johnny Murtagh, trainer.

quotes.race: MansionBet Bet 10 Get 20 Novice Stakes
quotes.quote: Mashhoor ran well on debut last year and learnt plenty from that and will have done the same today. He's a strong traveller but picked up nicely and showed a good attitude to go through the gaps - Richard Kingscote, jockey.

runners.name: Take Heart
runners.comment: Won a valuable Goodwood h'cap last year but not as good since off this mark; needs more
runners.spotlight: Won a valuable Goodwood handicap last year over 1m2f, his third win; not as good since off this mark; found 1m too sharp on return in Irish Lincoln; this trip suits better but needs more.

quotes.race: Coral Chesterfield Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: Take Heart has been training very well. Going to York, I thought he had a big chance but he was drawn on the outside which made things difficult. So, when he was drawn 18 today, I thought 'What did I do wrong to get these bad draws?'. He was only beaten by four and a half lengths at York and he had a lot of ground to make up in the straight, so Ben [Coen, jockey] said he would be a little closer today. They went so slow that he was controlling the race at all times. This trip is probably ideal. I haven't spoke to Barry [Irwin, founding member] and Team Valor yet, but there's the big handicap on Irish Champions Weekend that he ran very well in last year so he could go there. He's probably a Stakes horse and he might make it up to there one day - Johnny Murtagh, trainer.

quotes.race: TRM Speedxcell Multi Vitamin And Mineral Tonic Handicap
quotes.quote: Take Heart is a fine big horse that does not do much at home, but you cannot fault his form when he gets to the track. He's one of those slow developers but he could be a premier handicap horse if he keeps improving - Johnny Murtagh, trainer.

quotes.race: Edmondstown Maiden Hurdle

stable_tour.quote: He won twice in France for Jean-Claude Rouget but has been winless since and has only just joined us after a season with Ian Williams, for whom he finished second twice at Ascot. They were good runs and fingers crossed we can do something with him this year off his mark of 90. From what he has shown me at home he could win off his mark. He may start off this week at Newcastle on Friday and I think as the season progresses he can win a race or two. 28-04-21

She won nicely at Naas and she stepped up to a mile and half at the Curragh and finished sixth, which I was a bit disappointed with as I thought she had a great chance. I'm not quite sure she got the trip, so we're bringing her back in distance. She'll be near the bottom of the handicap but she has a fair chance of getting in. 11-09-24

stable_tour.quote: He's very solid and you'd love to have a yard full of horses like him. He turns up every time he runs and was unlucky not to win at the All-Weather Championships Finals Day at Newcastle. He goes to Leopardstown next for the Group 3 Amethyst Stakes next month. His rating is such that we will be sticking to Listed and Group 3 races with him. 21-04-22

runners.name: Happiest
runners.owner: Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor
runners.comment: Promise in maidens, well-bred, opening mark looks fair, of obvious interest upped in trip
runners.spotlight: Well-bred filly showed mild promise on good and heavy ground in two of three maiden runs for top yard; opening mark looks fair; of obvious interest stepping up in distance on handicap debut.

runners.name: Mocking
runners.comment: Big run on handicap debut last month, up 3lb, half-brother won on soft, chance up in trip
runners.spotlight: Is 0-4 on turf; big step forward on seasonal return and handicap debut at Leopardstown (1m2f, good) last month; up 3lb and will likely encounter very different ground here; half-brother won on soft so could handle it; chance upped in trip.

runners.name: Junkyard Dog
runners.comment: Off the mark at Navan, hiked up 8lb, has struggled on soft previously, needs rain to miss
runners.spotlight: Best maiden effort came on decent ground; won on his seasonal return in his first turf handicap at Navan (1m2f, good) eleven days ago; hiked up 8lb; should stay this far on that evidence but he struggled in maidens on soft-heavy; probably needs the rain to miss.

runners.name: Pallatine Hills
runners.comment: H'cap debutant, has run well on soft, gelded, tongue tied, up in trip, check market
runners.spotlight: Handicap debutant is 0-4 on turf; best effort on latest in a Curragh maiden, his first try on easy ground; opening mark looks fair on that run and he now steps up in trip in a first-time tongue tie; worth a market check on his seasonal return.

runners.name: Whats Your Game
runners.owner: Amo Racing Limited & Giselle De Aguiar
runners.comment: Promise in maidens at Dundalk, step up in trip should suit on h'cap debut, interesting
runners.spotlight: Promise in maidens at Dundalk; ran okay sole start on turf on yielding to soft at the Curragh; shaped like this trip might suit on latest at Dundalk (10.5f); interesting on handicap debut off what looks a fair opening mark.

runners.name: Birdie Time
runners.breeder: Exors Of The Late Her Majesty The Queen
runners.owner: Omega & Monmouth Bay Racing Llc & Tom Galway
runners.comment: Promise on latest on h'cap bow, struggled in maidens on soft-heavy, forecast rain a worry
runners.spotlight: Didn't show much in a trio of maidens last year including on soft-heavy; better effort on seasonal return and handicap debut at Leopardstown (1m2f, good); Foley now takes over but soft or heavy ground would be a major worry.

runners.name: Booklight
runners.breeder: Mount Coote Stud And M H Dixon
runners.comment: Promise in maidens, traffic problems on h'cap debut, new ground and trip here, watch
runners.spotlight: Showed clear promise in a couple of maidens at 6f-1m last year; encountered traffic problems on handicap debut when well behind Junkyard Dog at Navan; weighted to get closer to that rival here but untried on softer than good and steps up in trip; probably best watched.

runners.name: Georg Zhukov
runners.comment: Promise on good in Thurles maiden, shaped like this trip might suit latest, ground a query
runners.spotlight: Best efforts in maidens a 6.5l second of 14 at Thurles last October (1m, good); shaped like 1m4f would suit when beaten 7l on handicap debut and seasonal reappearance at Leopardstown (1m2f, good); yet to race on testing ground.

runners.name: Glinka
runners.comment: Stayed on well over 1m2f latest, 1m4f worth a go, cheekpieces on, chance if handles ground
runners.spotlight: Didn't show a lot in maidens at 1m-10.5f; better effort when midfield on handicap debut at Navan (1m2f, good) behind stablemate Junkyard Dog, running on well late; worth a go up in trip on that evidence and cheekpieces go on; chance if he handles the likely softer ground.

runners.name: Nakatomi
runners.comment: No impact in maidens or h'cap debut, gelded, trip a query on breeding, others preferred
runners.spotlight: Not much impact in three maidens and a similar story when beaten out of sight on handicap debut at Naas last September (1m, good); gelded since; not bred for this trip and is unproven on testing ground; others preferred.

runners.name: Enziya
runners.comment: H'cap debut, best maiden run on heavy, steps up in trip, potential improver, check market
runners.spotlight: Handicap debutant; best maiden effort a 9.75l fifth of 10 on testing ground at Gowran on debut; steps up in trip now and he's a potential improver; check the market.

runners.name: Longwinded Lady
runners.comment: No show in maidens, last in first handicap, lacks a run, best watched upped in trip
runners.spotlight: Long odds and no show in a trio of maidens at 7f-7.5f; wore cheekpieces for first handicap when finishing last at the Curragh and they have been discarded; steps up in trip and untried on softer than yielding; lacks a run and probably best watched.

5:30.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places

runners.name: Arthur Rose
runners.comment: Maiden needs to show improvement from return over 1m but was poor only 1m4f run; blinkers
runners.spotlight: Maiden needs to show improvement from return over 1m but was poor on only start over this trip; blinkers on.

runners.name: Fascinating Shadow

prev_owners.owner: Townley Hall Bloodstock And D J Cox

runners.comment: Dual-purpose winner lost his form last year and needs a revival on return
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose winner including at this track but lost his form last year and needs a revival on return.

quotes.race: Sign Up To Our Newsletter Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: I think Fascinating Shadow is a nice horse. He does everything right for me at home. We went to Dundalk with him, my first runner there in eight years, but I went up with him, and ever since he scored there the plan was to come here. He probably want nearly faster ground than that, but he'll be a nice novice horse for the year - Shark Hanlon, trainer.

runners.name: Grizabella
runners.comment: Won over hurdles last year; previously regressive on the Flat; new yard
runners.spotlight: Won over hurdles last year; previously regressive on the Flat; has to get back to form for new yard.

runners.name: Man Is King
runners.comment: Longstanding maiden has shown best form on AW and this trip is a question
runners.spotlight: Longstanding maiden has shown best form on AW; below form last two runs and this trip is a question.

runners.name: Picpoul

prev_owners.owner: Exors of the Late Mrs S M Rice

runners.comment: All three wins have been on AW and not at her best when last seen on turf
runners.spotlight: All three wins have been on AW and not at her best when last seen on turf; others preferred.

quotes.race: Happy Christmas From All At Dundalk Stadium Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: It's great to get Picpoul back on track, hopefully she'll now go on from this, next week there is another one for her. During the summer she had physio for a back problem but we have her back and I'm delighted with that. We wanted to try hurdling but she won't jump a pole! - Michael Rice, trainer, talking to Racing TV

quotes.race: DundalkStadium.com Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Picpoul is the first Flat horse that I've trained so I might be looking at getting a few more in! She's a decent filly. We might step her up in trip. There is a two mile race here on Friday week so we'll have a look at that - Michael Rice, trainer.

runners.name: Crypto Crash
runners.comment: Maiden whose best run was when raised to this trip last July; a player if ready on return
runners.spotlight: Maiden whose best run was when raised to this trip last July; a player on that effort if ready on return and handling this likely softer ground.

runners.name: Noble Andy
runners.comment: Best run came when runner-up over this trip last October; a player if ready on return
runners.spotlight: Best run came when runner-up over this trip last October at Bellewstown on yielding ground; a player if ready on return but the cheekpieces worn then are left off.

runners.name: Plunkett Street
runners.comment: Won over 1m2f at Navan last autumn and some decent hurdle runs after; can go well
runners.spotlight: Won over 1m2f at Navan last autumn; some decent runs after off this mark plus over hurdles too; can go well if ready on return.

runners.name: Gardone
runners.comment: Mostly running well in defeat on AW over winter/spring; turf form a question
runners.spotlight: Mostly running well in defeat on AW over winter/spring; turf form is a question though.

runners.name: Highland King
runners.comment: Ran well on AW last time and has a chance if back to some of his better turf form
runners.spotlight: AW winner and ran well on that surface last time; has a chance if back to some of his better old turf form.

quotes.race: CT1 Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: Highland King has turned the corner now and hopefully he can go on and win another one. He has form on the turf and would probably jump a hurdle - John McConnell, trainer

runners.name: Tatum
runners.comment: Maiden has run well in defeat several times including on recent return; player up in trip
runners.spotlight: Maiden ran well in defeat several times as a 2yo but was below form both 3yo starts; however, came back to form on recent return at Gowran over just short of 1m2f; looks a big player up in trip if she stays with Keane staying aboard.

runners.name: No Memory
runners.comment: Dual-purpose winner hasn't been seen since running over hurdles over three years ago
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose winner hasn't been seen since running over hurdles (fourth in a Grade 3) over three years ago; 11yo can only be watched.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mares Hurdle
quotes.quote: The ground was just a bit too good for her the last day and the way the race was run didn't suit her. The softer ground today was a big help; she is small but very tough - rider Ambrose McCurtin.

quotes.race: BoyleSports Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: She did very well and seems to be improving with her racing - Ambrose McCurtin, rider of No Memory

runners.name: Tyder
runners.comment: Third at Dundalk two starts ago but has to bounce back from a lesser effort on latest
runners.spotlight: Maiden was third at Dundalk two starts ago but has to bounce back from a lesser effort there on latest; has run well on turf.
